Historia Arcanum: Era of the Crusades.name: Historia Arcanum: Era of the Crusades
Historia Arcanum: Era of the Crusades.description:
Welcome to Era of the Crusades, Historica Arcanum’s massive guide to the monumental conflict between Crusader Knights and the Forces of Saladin.

The setting guide explores the sprawling open world of two legendary cities in 1182: Jerusalem and Cairo, with quests, character highlights and cultural articles allowing you to bring the era to your gaming table.

In addition to the deep dive to the two cities, the setting guide also houses all the gameplay options: Character Creation, Subclasses, Bestiary, the rules and guides for the Deck of the Damned and Knightly Orders, and Professions.

Paralyzing Gaze.name: Paralyzing Gaze
Paralyzing Gaze.description: The abu-kahil chooses two creatures within 60 ft. of it. The creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save they take 10 (3d6) damage and become paralyzed until the end of the abu kahil’s next turn.

Djinni’s Hand.name: Djinni’s Hand
Djinni’s Hand.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , or ranged 30 ft. , one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is paralyzed, it takes an extra 20 force damage (this extra damage is not doubled if the attack is a critical hit).

Djinntouched.name: Djinntouched
Djinntouched.description: A creature that touches a djinn, hitting it with a melee weapon or unarmed strike, or hit by the djinn, must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature loses 2d6 worth of Intelligence score. If the creature’s Intelligence score becomes lower than 5, it can only speak gibberish, become frightened by bright lights and loud noises and it can’t cast spells. However, it can discern friend from foe. This change lasts for days equal to the number rolled and can be reversed with a saving throw at the end of each long rest. If an affected creature rolls below 5 on two days that follow each other, the effect becomes permanent and can only be reversed with a greater restoration spell.

Slumber Aura.name: Slumber Aura
Slumber Aura.description: The Abu-Kahil has a 30-foot radius aura. Inside this aura, creatures that fall below half of their hit point maximum must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep. Creatures that are immune to charms are not affected by this feature. Creatures with advantage against charms also have advantage on this saving throw. The sleep state lasts for 1d6 hours. While a creature sleeps inside the Abu-Kahil’s aura, the Abu-Kahil gains 30 temporary hit points and advantage on all saving throws on each of its turns.

Claws.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
Flame Breath.description: The Aji Asil exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The creatures that failed the saving throw are caught fire. Unless an action is spent to put it out, a target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns for the next minute.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description: The Aji Asil can shapechange into any beast with a CR 2 or lower using an action. Its mental ability scores stay the same, but other statistics change. Any object carried or worn is subsumed into the new form. It can use its bonus action to return to its original form, or it reverts back to its original form when it reaches 0 hit points. Any remaining damage transfers to its original form.

Magic Devourer.name: Magic Devourer

It also can devour magic items within 5 ft. of it that are not worn or carried. It must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. The Essence Unleashed.name: The Essence Unleashed
The Essence Unleashed.description: When the hermit’s acolyte is reduced to 0 hit points, its armor slowly rots away and hermit’s essence sprouts from the creature.

Strategic Approach.name: Strategic Approach
Strategic Approach.description: When a hermit’s essence uses Merge the Mind ability on the hermit’s acolyte, it has advantage on attack rolls and can use its reaction to halve the damage taken if it can see the attacker Dispatch. The hermit’s acolyte can use its bonus action to deal itself damage equal to its half current hit points, it can create a hermit’s essence. The hermit’s essence gains the damage taken total as a resource for its Vitality Given ability. It appears in the nearest unoccupied space within 10 ft. of the hermit’s acolyte. Power in Unity (Recharge 4-6) The hermit’s acolyte can use its action and spends all its turn (can’t take bonus actions or reactions) to form a bond and empower another creature bearing the Moth’s Mark within 5 ft. When it does this, its form becomes incorporeal and gains resistance to all damage. The empowered creature gains bonus to its attack roll equal to 1d6 and gains temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns. The temporary hit point is equal to 2d4 + 5. At the start of each of its turns, it can continue this process, as if it is concentrating on a spell.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Jerusalem Noble can make two melee attacks with their longsword. Alternatively, the Jerusalem Noble can make two dagger attacks.

Light Crossbow.name: Light Crossbow

Order Of The Noble.name: Order Of The Noble
Order Of The Noble.description: Jerusalem Noble can spend its bonus action to give a command to a creature within 30 ft. of it that can hear it. The creature has advantage on its next ability check or attack roll until the end of its next turn.

Military Training.name: Military Training
Military Training.description: Jerusalem Noble has +1 bonus to attack rolls made with weapons.

Longsword.name: Longsword

Unity With Shadows.name: Unity With Shadows
Unity With Shadows.description: The karabasan can move through solid objects but takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn in a solid object. Additionally, it can turn invisible as a bonus action if it is within dim light or darkness. The invisibility stays until the end of its next turn, until it makes an attack or casts a spell. The Burden on Your Chest. As a bonus action, the karabasan can strike a foe within 15 ft. of it and run towards it without provoking opportunity attacks. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The karabasan sits on the creature. While sitting on it, the creature is paralyzed and karabasan weighs 5 times heavier. When any attempt is made to move karabasan off the creature, it has +10 bonus to related ability checks or saving throws due to its weight.

The Suffocating Mark.name: The Suffocating Mark
The Suffocating Mark.description: When the Karabasan sits on a creature, it leaves a mark of horror. At the end of each long rest, the creature must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. During the paralysis the creature can’t breathe. Each day, the duration increases by 1 minute. The mark of horror can be identified by a DC 10 Intelligence (Arcana) or Wisdom (Nature) check or an identify spell cast on the creature.

Ice Lance.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, plus 16 (3d10) cold damage.

Freezing Breath.name: Freezing Breath
Freezing Breath.description: The madd-jazir exhales a freezing wind in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Frozen Bones (1/day).name: Frozen Bones (1/day)
Frozen Bones (1/day).description: All creatures within 60 ft. of the madd-jazir that took cold damage in the last two rounds must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly frozen. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to ice and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming frozen on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The freezing lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. The frozen condition can be considered as the petrified condition.

Flame Eruption.name: Flame Eruption
Flame Eruption.description: In a 60 ft. radius, Odparvar unleashes a deadly flame. Creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 12d6 fire damage plus 6d6 force damage.

Ashes Of The Ancient.name: Ashes Of The Ancient
Ashes Of The Ancient.description: By providing proper ashes or remains of a humanoid that is dead, Odparvar can summon the spirit of the ashes by focusing on them for 1 minute. The remains gain intellect and memory of the deceased humanoid and stay for 1 minute and can be communicated. It is not obligated to answer any question and due its spirit condition, its answers can be cryptic or unusual.

Ashen Retribution.name: Ashen Retribution

Rekindle.name: Rekindle

Wail Of The Lost.name: Wail Of The Lost
Wail Of The Lost.description: The ruznara emits a mournful wail. Each creature within 60 feet that can hear it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the affected creatures are counted as sorrowful until the end of their next turn. While sorrowful, a creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw before doing an action or a bonus action or lose their said action (once per turn).

Touch Of Anguish.name: Touch Of Anguish
Touch Of Anguish.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn as sorrow overwhelms it.

Multiattack.description: The sphinx makes three attacks with its claws.

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) force damage.

Deadly Gaze.name: Deadly Gaze
Deadly Gaze.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, ranged 120 ft. three targets. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

Aura Of The Graves (30-foot Radius).name: Aura Of The Graves (30-foot Radius)
Aura Of The Graves (30-foot Radius).description: Creatures that enter the aura for the first time or start their turn there must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, their Constitution score decreases by 1d4. A creature that is killed in the aura rises as a specter controlled by the sphinx.

Inscrutable.name: Inscrutable
Inscrutable.description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
The sphinx can cast each of these spells innately. Charisma is its spellcasting ability.
At will: Protection From Evil And Good, Branding Smite, Chill Touch
3/day each: Guiding Bolt, Suggestion, Zone Of Truth, Scorching Ray, Detect Thoughts
1/day each: Fireball, Counterspell, Dispel Magic, Slow, Spirit Guardians

Protection from Evil and Good.name: Protection from Evil and Good
Protection from Evil and Good.description:
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

materials.value: Holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

Branding Smite.name: Branding Smite
Branding Smite.description:
The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike. The attack deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage to the target, which becomes visible if it's invisible, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can't become invisible until the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description:
You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.

If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.

materials.value: A snake's tongue and either a bit of honeycomb or a drop of sweet oil

Zone of Truth.name: Zone of Truth
Zone of Truth.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged Spell Attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

activation.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

Charming Nature.description: When a creature makes a saving throw against any charming attempt by the sphinx, it is made with disadvantage. In addition, if the creatures fall under her charm due to a spell, they won’t be able to tell that she put that spell on them such as charm person spell.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting

The sphinx can cast each of these spells innately. Charisma is her spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit):
At will: Minor Illusion, Glee, Vicious Mockery (2d4)
3/day each: Hideous Laughter, Charm Person, Command
1/day each: Hold Person, Confusion

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Vicious Mockery.name: Vicious Mockery
Vicious Mockery.description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

Hideous Laughter.name: Hideous Laughter
Hideous Laughter.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range perceives everything as hilariously funny and falls into fits of laughter if this spell affects it. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall prone, becoming Incapacitated and unable to stand up for the Duration. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less isn't affected.

At the end of each of its turns, and each time it takes damage, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. The target has advantage on the saving throw if it's triggered by damage. On a success, the spell ends.

materials.value: Tiny tarts and a feather that is waved in the air

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description:
You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is &Reference[charmed] by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description: The target is Charmed by the caster until the spell ends. The charmed creature regards the caster as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed] for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: The target is Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
This spell assaults and twists creatures' minds, spawning delusions and provoking uncontrolled action. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

An affected target can't take reactions and must roll from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.LHEts1oDaDwcehuj]{Confusion} table at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

Multiple Heads.name: Multiple Heads

The deafened condition can be dispelled by a greater restoration spell.

Speed Of Sound.name: Speed Of Sound
Speed Of Sound.description: The voiceless can use its action to teleport to a place it can see directly, no more than 1000 ft.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Invisible Existence.name: Invisible Existence
Invisible Existence.description: The voiceless one is a shapeless entity and therefore always has the invisible condition. When seen by a spell like see invisibility or a sensitive sight such as truesight, it appears as a pale and pure white cloud.

Lost Voices.name: Lost Voices
Lost Voices.description: The voiceless one remembers everything it’s heard and can repeat it. In addition, if it hears the voice of a dead creature, it can copy the creature’s talking style and can use its voice, mannerism and patterns for speech.

Memory Fragments.name: Memory Fragments
Memory Fragments.description: If the voiceless one is within 15 ft. of a dying creature, it can see the creature’s memories, ideals or other aspects decided by the GM. If the dying creature is willing, the voiceless one can see through their whole life. If the creature is unwilling, the voiceless one can force it to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the voiceless one can see any memory it desires and memorize the visuals immediately.

Wooden Staff.name: Wooden Staff
Wooden Staff.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning or 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

Shortbow.name: Shortbow
Shortbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, ranged 80/320 ft. , one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

Deadliest Blade.name: Deadliest Blade
Deadliest Blade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, plus 17 (5d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Arcane Veil.name: Arcane Veil
Arcane Veil.description: The Ajal’ayn can turn invisible as an action until it makes an attack or casts a spell.

Assassin Programming.name: Assassin Programming
Assassin Programming.description: The Ajal’ayn always has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn in combat yet, and any hit it scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If Ajal’ayn is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

Poison Mastery.name: Poison Mastery
Poison Mastery.description: The Ajal’ayn can apply its deadly poison to its weapons as a bonus action. The poison remains effective until it successfully hits a target.

Infiltrate And Escape.name: Infiltrate And Escape
Infiltrate And Escape.description: As a bonus action, the Ajal’ayn can take the Disengage or Hide action.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Atash-Parvaz makes two attacks with its Flaming Fists.

Flaming Fists.name: Flaming Fists
Flaming Fists.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) fire damage.

Arcane Flames.name: Arcane Flames
Arcane Flames.description: The Atash-Parvaz can release a burst of fire in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they catch fire. At the start of each of their turns for the next minute, the target takes 7 (2d6) fire damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Other than the saving throw, only magically created water or a wind spell cast on the creature can end the effect (it must at least be a 2nd-level spell).

Flaming Aura.name: Flaming Aura
Flaming Aura.description: When a creature enters the Flaming Aura for the first time or starts its turn there, it (or any metal object inside the aura) falls under the effects of heat metal spell. This aura can be turned off with a bonus action.

Immutable Form.name: Immutable Form
Immutable Form.description: Atash-Parvaz is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Big Maw can use its Deathly Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 3d6 necrotic damage.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The Big Maw can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Big Maw regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Ghostly Move.name: Ghostly Move
Ghostly Move.description: The big maw can turn itself into a spectral creature by concentrating for 1 minute. After that, unless it is dismissed by an action, it stays in this form. While in this form, it is incorporeal and moves through solid objects, however it can’t interact with any other objects. It takes 22 (4d10) damage if it stops moving in a solid object.

Turn Immunity.name: Turn Immunity
Turn Immunity.description: The big maw is immune to the turn damage.

Double Nature.name: Double Nature
Double Nature.description: The big maw both counts as a dragon and an undead.

Life Drain Bite.name: Life Drain Bite
Life Drain Bite.description: When Big Maw hits with its bite attack, the target takes an extra 3d6 necrotic damage (included in the attacks), and Big Maw regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

Deathly Presence.name: Deathly Presence
Deathly Presence.description: Any creature that starts its turn within 50 feet of Big Maw must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, becoming frightened for 1d6 rounds on a failed save and when it is within 50 ft. of the Big Maw it takes 3 (1d6) necrotic damage. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Tail Attack.name: Tail Attack
Tail Attack.description: Big Maw makes a tail attack

Wing Attack.name: Wing Attack
Wing Attack.description: (Costs 2 Actions) Big Maw beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of Big Maw must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. Big Maw can then fly up to half its flying speed.

Necrotic Breath.name: Necrotic Breath
Necrotic Breath.description: Big Maw exhales necrotic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 12d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crusader champion makes three longsword attacks.

Longsword.name: Longsword
Longsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 9 (1d8+5) slashing damage or 10 (1d10+5) slashing damage if used with two hands.

Holy Protection.name: Holy Protection
Holy Protection.description: When the crusader takes damage, it can use its reaction to roll 6d8. It deducts the total from the damage it took. Until the end of its next turn, it gains resistance to that damage type unless it is force or psychic damage (The damage deduction still applies to these damage types. ).

Holy Warrior.name: Holy Warrior
Holy Warrior.description: When the crusader hits a creature, it can use its bonus action to deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage to the creature.

Relentless Warrior (3/day).name: Relentless Warrior (3/day)
Relentless Warrior (3/day).description: When the crusader champion fails a saving throw, it can use its reaction to add 1d8 to the roll, potentially turning it into a success. If the roll isn’t enough for success, the feature is not expended.

Bulwark Of Faith.name: Bulwark Of Faith
Bulwark Of Faith.description: While wearing armor, the crusader champion has +2 bonus to its Armor Class and death saving throws.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crusader noble makes two longsword attacks.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Leader On The Field.name: Leader On The Field
Leader On The Field.description: Allies within 30 ft. of the crusader noble have +2 bonus to their attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Greatsword.name: Greatsword
Greatsword.description: A mighty two-handed blade is over four feet long an almost five inches wide. This weapon requires extensive martial training but those proficient in its use are formidable warriors.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Dullahan makes two melee attacks with its Spectral Spear.

Spectral Spear.name: Spectral Spear
Spectral Spear.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage, or 12 (1d10 + 6) slashing damage if used with two hands.

Dodge at the Edge.name: Dodge at the Edge
Dodge at the Edge.description: When a creature the Dullahan can see attacks it with an attack that could hit, the Dullahan can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack roll, provided the Dullahan isn’t incapacitated. If the attack misses, the attacker becomes frightened until the end of its next turn.

Headless Sight.name: Headless Sight
Headless Sight.description: The dullahan can see in all directions as if it had normal vision and head, unaffected by blindness, darkness, and invisibility within 120 feet.

Aura Of Dread.name: Aura Of Dread
Aura Of Dread.description: Any creature that starts its turn or enters the first time within 60 feet of the dullahan must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, becoming frightened for 1 minute on a failed save. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the dullahan is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Death’s Call.name: Death’s Call
Death’s Call.description: Once per day, the dullahan can target one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. A creature immune to being frightened is immune to this effect.

No Critical Hit.name: No Critical Hit
No Critical Hit.description: The dullahan is unaffected by any situations or effects when an attacker scores a critical hit against it.

Re-kindled.name: Re-kindled
Re-kindled.description: When the dullahan reaches 0 hit points, it doesn’t die, unless its head is burnt with a special oil made from roots that were gathered under moonlight and blended with a stick from an oak tree which is at least 100 years old.

pBFc9r6sPr6HI8cF.name: Headless Sight
pBFc9r6sPr6HI8cF.description: The dullahan can use its action to see and hear with its head, which leaves it blind and deaf within its own body.

Gloomy Bind.name: Gloomy Bind
Gloomy Bind.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit. Reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 necrotic damage. The creature is restrained by the gloombound.

Color Drain.name: Color Drain
Color Drain.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the creature is restrained by the gloombound, the color drain also decreases the target’s Charisma score by 1d4. For each lost Charisma score, the target appears colorless, ugly and repulsive to others of its kind.

Possession.name: Possession
Possession.description: One humanoid that the gloombound can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the gloombound; the gloombound then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The gloombound now controls the body but doesn’t deprive the target of awareness. The gloombound can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or another effect, except ones that may force it to leave the body, and it retains its alignment, its Ability Scores, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It has access to the target’s memory but not its other abilities or class features. dispel evil and good The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the gloombound ends it as a bonus action, or the gloombound is turned or forced out by an effect like thespell. When the possession ends, the gloombound reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this gloombound’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

Stygian Aura.name: Stygian Aura
Stygian Aura.description: Each creature that starts its turn in the gloombound’s aura or enters it for the first time must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or lose 10 feet of movement speed. If the movement speed reduces to 0, the creature is petrified. This aura can be opened or closed by the gloombound with a bonus action. It can stay open for 10 minutes and must stay closed until the gloombound finishes a short or long rest.

Gloom Charm.name: Gloom Charm
Gloom Charm.description: The gloombound can innately cast charm person spell (DC 16) but the target does not understand it was cast by the gloombound.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The golem makes three slam attacks.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. A hit creature must succeed on a DC 13.

Immutable Form.name: Immutable Form
Immutable Form.description: The grim golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Magic Weapons.name: Magic Weapons
Magic Weapons.description: The grim golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

Hardened Marble.name: Hardened Marble
Hardened Marble.description: The grim golem takes no damage if the damage it received is below or equal to 10.

Partial Magic Immunity.name: Partial Magic Immunity
Partial Magic Immunity.description: The grim golem is not affected by spells that are 2nd level or lower.

Spiritual Guidance.name: Spiritual Guidance
Spiritual Guidance.description: The local priest can spend 10 minutes talking and guiding a creature that can understand it. After 10 minutes, the creature gains 1d6 bonus to its ability checks for the next hour.

Religious Ward.name: Religious Ward
Religious Ward.description: All creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the local priest unless the priest attacked them, harmed them, or affected them with a spell.

Humble Approach.name: Humble Approach
Humble Approach.description: The local priest Staff (Shillelagh). Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage or 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: The priest can cast these spells. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability (DC 13). At will: light, guidance, spare the dying, shillelagh 1/day: lesser restoration, healing word, bless, protection from evil and good.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

Guidance.name: 神导术
Guidance.description: 你触碰一个自愿的生物。在法术终止前，目标可以选择在一次属性检定时额外掷一粒 d4，并将所得数值加入检定结果中。它可以在进行属性检定之前或之后掷骰。法术随后即终止。

Spare the Dying.name: 维生术
Spare the Dying.description: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Shillelagh.name: Shillelagh
Shillelagh.description: The wood of a club or quarterstaff you are holding is imbued with nature's power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage die becomes a d8. The weapon also becomes magical, if it isn't already. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.

materials.value: A shamrock leaf, and a club or quarterstaff

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Protection from Evil and Good.name: Protection from Evil and Good
Protection from Evil and Good.description:
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

materials.value: Holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Mamluk cavalry makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

Mamluk Blade.name: Mamluk Blade
Mamluk Blade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft. , one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

Ready For Holy War.name: Ready For Holy War
Ready For Holy War.description: When the Mamluk cavalry rolls for initiative, it gains an additional bonus to the roll, which is equal to 1d8. In addition, it gains +1 bonus to its Armor Class while wearing armor.

Outstanding Damage.name: Outstanding Damage
Outstanding Damage.description: When the Mamluk cavalry scores a hit, it can use its reaction to roll 6d6 and add it to the damage roll. Any critical hit doubles the damage and automatically activates this feature whether it has charge or not.

Master Archer.name: Master Archer
Master Archer.description: The Mamluk cavalry has +2 bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls with bows (included in the Actions).

Staff.name: Staff
Staff.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 2 (1d6-1) bludgeoning damage or 3 (1d8-1) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

Faithful’s Endurance.name: Faithful’s Endurance
Faithful’s Endurance.description: The pilgrim has advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and has +2 bonus to Armor Class while not wearing armor.

Peaceful Traveler.name: Peaceful Traveler
Peaceful Traveler.description: Unless it makes an attack, deals damage to a creature, or casts a spell that affects an enemy, the pilgrim is under the effects of a sanctuary spell. An attacker must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw in order to attack the pilgrim.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a spellcaster or a creature that uses magical abilities, they must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on spellcasting ability checks and cannot cast spells of 3rd level or higher until the end of their next turn.

Magic Disruption.name: Magic Disruption
Magic Disruption.description: Sihr’a-Dar Muhafiz emits a burst of anti-magic energy. All creatures within 15 feet that are concentrating on a spell must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or lose concentration.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: Sihr’a-Dar Muhafizhas advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Spell Nullify (5/day).name: Spell Nullify (5/day)
Spell Nullify (5/day).description: When a spell is cast within 60 ft. of the Muhafiz Al-Sihir, it can use its reaction to attempt to counter the spell. The caster must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or the spell and the slot are lost.

Anti-magic Aura (1/day).name: Anti-magic Aura (1/day)
Anti-magic Aura (1/day).description: With a bonus action, the Muhafiz Al-Sihir creates an aura that has a 10-foot radius. It has the qualities of an antimagic field spell.

Mage Slayer.name: Mage Slayer
Mage Slayer.description: When a spell is cast within 10 ft. of the Muhafiz Al-Sihir, it can use its reaction to attack the caster with a Slam.

Poison The Mind.name: Poison The Mind
Poison The Mind.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, one target, ranged 30 ft. Hit: 2 (1d4) psychic damage. The creature is forced to make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they fall under the effects of crown of madness spell until the end of their next turn.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, one target, reach 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

Merge The Mind.name: Merge The Mind
Merge The Mind.description: When a creature bearing the mark of the Moth Sigil is within 5 ft. of the hermit’s essence, it can spend its entire turn to merge with the creature. Unless it’s another hermit’s essence, it only activates the Strategic Approach feature. If it’s another hermit’s essence, one of them must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw. On a success, they can form a hermit’s follower together. The newly created hermit’s follower has hit points equal to the total current hit points of two hermit’s essences and maximum hit points equal to total of the two.

Taking Control.name: Taking Control
Taking Control.description: The hermit’s essence can take control of a suit of armor that is not worn or carried that is within 5 ft. of it and transform into a hermit’s follower. If two hermit’s essences do this, they transform into a hermit’s acolyte, if three hermit’s essences do this, they transform into a hermit’s prophet.

Strategic Approach.name: Strategic Approach
Strategic Approach.description: When a hermit’s essence uses Merge the Mind ability on the hermit’s reader, it has advantage on attack rolls and can use its reaction to halve the damage taken if it can see the attacker.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, one target, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

Light Crossbow.name: Light Crossbow
Light Crossbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, one target, ranged 80/320 ft. Hit: 5 (1d8+1) piercing damage.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Hard Feet.name: Hard Feet
Hard Feet.description: The traveling merchant can cover fifty percent more miles without the risk of exhaustion while traveling.

Innate Talents.name: Innate Talents
Innate Talents.description: The traveling merchant can innately cast mending, resistance, alarm, and goodberry spells once a day. Charisma is its spellcasting ability modifier.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: The warrior priest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12): At will: true strike (bonus action), mending, spare the dying 3/day each: bane, bless, command, shield of faith 1/day each: aid, gentle repose

Faithful Heart.name: Faithful Heart
Faithful Heart.description: While wearing armor, the warrior priest takes 2 less damage from each attack

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The warrior priest makes two attacks with its mace.

Mace.name: Mace
Mace.description: A heavy metal head mounted to the end of a sturdy haft meant to deliver powerful, crushing blows capable of shattering armor and bone alike.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: The traveling artist can cast these spells. Charisma is its spellcasting ability (DC 12). At will: vicious mockery, dancing lights, prestidigitation 3/day each: command, charm person, identify 1/day each: enhance ability, charm person, suggestion

Compelling Performance.name: Compelling Performance
Compelling Performance.description: Each creature with 5 or more Intelligence that spends at least 1 minute watching the traveling artist’s performance, has disadvantage on ability checks against the traveling artist for 1 hour.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: A thin tensile metal blade, light in weight but long in reach designed for quick darting attacks to target weak points in enemy defenses with lightning swiftness.

Light Crossbow.name: Light Crossbow
Light Crossbow.description: A small crossbow with a wooden haft and a tense cord which is capable of firing a single bolt which can puncture even heavy armor at close range.

Artistic Inspiration.name: Artistic Inspiration
Artistic Inspiration.description: The traveling artist can inspire an ally within 60 ft. of it that can hear it. The ally has advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw made in the next minute.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: The crusader priest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14): At will: guidance, mending, spare the dying 3/day each: bless, command, shield of faith, sanctuary, cure wounds 1/day each: aid, inflict wounds, zone of truth, haste, prayer of healing

Divine Endurance.name: Divine Endurance
Divine Endurance.description: The crusader priest has advantage on all saving throws related to exhaustion, poison, and disease.

Mace.name: Mace
Mace.description: A heavy metal head mounted to the end of a sturdy haft meant to deliver powerful, crushing blows capable of shattering armor and bone alike.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The warrior priest makes two attacks with its mace

Sacred Gaze.name: Sacred Gaze
Sacred Gaze.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, ranged 60 ft., two targets. Hit: 5 (1d10) psychic damage

Power of the Cross.name: Power of the Cross
Power of the Cross.description: When the crusader priest presents its holy symbol as an action, enemies within 30 ft. of the crusader priest that can see the cross must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage and be frightened for 1 minute (the saving throw can be repeated at the end of each of their turns to be free from the effect). On a successful save, they take only half the damage

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft. , one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

Tool Expertise.name: Tool Expertise
Tool Expertise.description: The artisan has advantage on ability checks related to its tool proficiencies

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: The artisan casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12): At will: mending, vicious mockery, guidance 1/day each: alarm, charm person, identify .

Hermit’s Follower Of The Moth Sigil.name: Hermit’s Follower Of The Moth Sigil
Hermit’s Follower Of The Moth Sigil.tokenName: Hermit’s Follower Of The Moth Sigil

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hermit’s follower makes two attacks in any combination.

Mind Distortion.name: Mind Distortion
Mind Distortion.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, ranged 60 ft. , one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

Powerful Mind.name: Powerful Mind
Powerful Mind.description: The hermit’s follower has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

The Essence Unleashed.name: The Essence Unleashed
The Essence Unleashed.description: When the hermit’s follower is reduced to 0 hit points, its armor slowly rots away and hermit’s essence sprouts from the creature.

Strategic Approach.name: Strategic Approach
Strategic Approach.description: When a hermit’s essence uses Merge the Mind ability on the hermit’s follower, it has advantage on attack rolls and can use its reaction to halve the damage taken if it can see the attacker.

Dispatch.name: Dispatch
Dispatch.description: The hermit’s follower can use its bonus action to deal itself damage equal to its half current hit points; it can create a hermit’s essence. The hermit’s essence gains the damage taken total as a resource for its Vitality Given ability. It appears in the nearest unoccupied space within 10 ft. of the hermit’s follower.

Power In Unity.name: Power In Unity
Power In Unity.description: The hermit’s follower can use its action and spend all its turn (can’t take bonus actions or reactions) to form a bond and empower another creature bearing the Moth’s Mark within 5 ft. When it does this, its form becomes incorporeal and gains resistance to all damage. The empowered creature gains bonus to its attack roll equal to 1d6 and gains temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns. The temporary hit point is equal to 3d4 + 5. At the start of each of its turns, it can continue this process, as if it is concentrating on a spell.

Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

Powerful Mind.name: Powerful Mind
Powerful Mind.description: The hermit’s prophet has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

The Essence Unleashed.name: The Essence Unleashed
The Essence Unleashed.description: When the hermit’s prophet is reduced to 0 hit points, its armor slowly rots away and hermit’s essence sprouts from the creature.

Strategic Approach.name: Strategic Approach
Strategic Approach.description: When a hermit’s essence uses Merge the Mind ability on the hermit’s prophet, it has advantage on attack rolls and can use its reaction to halve the damage taken if it can see the attacker.

Dispatch.name: Dispatch
Dispatch.description: The hermit’s prophet can use its bonus action to deal itself damage equal to its half current hit points, it can create a hermit’s essence. The hermit’s essence gains the damage taken total as a resource for its Vitality Given ability. It appears in the nearest unoccupied space within 10 ft. of the hermit’s prophet.

Multiattack.description: The custodian makes two attacks with its Spear of the Sands.

Spear Of The Sands.name: Spear Of The Sands
Spear Of The Sands.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5–6).name: Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5–6)
Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5–6).description: The custodian exhales a sleeping gas in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

The Protection Command.name: The Protection Command
The Protection Command.description: If the custodian is commanded to guard a place or a creature, the custodian has advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws while within 30 ft. of the place or the creature.

Sage Training.name: Sage Training
Sage Training.description: The scholar of Cairo has advantage on Intelligence checks.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5ft. , one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage.

You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.

Vicious Arcana.name: Vicious Arcana
Vicious Arcana.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. , one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) psychic damage.

Instinctive Charm (Recharge 4–6).name: Instinctive Charm (Recharge 4–6)
Instinctive Charm (Recharge 4–6).description: When a visible creature within 30 feet of Dankaran makes an attack roll against him, Dankaran forces the attacker to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker redirects the attack to the creature closest to it, other than Dankaran or itself. If multiple eligible creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Wonderful Illusions.name: Wonderful Illusions
Wonderful Illusions.description: When Dankaran casts an illusion spell, a creature makes the Intelligence or Wisdom checks with disadvantage, regarding whether the illusion depicts something real or not.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The enchanter casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

  • At will: friends, mage hand, dancing lights, vicious mockery (3d4)

  • 3/each day: alarm, expeditious retreat, healing word, disguise self, sleep (2nd level)

  • 2/day each: charm person, hold person, invisibility, suggestion, tongues

No Aggression.name: No Aggression
No Aggression.description: The muzahir can’t take the Attack action.

Recite.name: Recite
Recite.description: The muzahir, when commanded, starts to describe what it has seen or heard on a specific topic, location, creature or a similar aspect it has witnessed.

Flawless Immunity (Recharge 3-6).name: Flawless Immunity (Recharge 3-6)
Flawless Immunity (Recharge 3-6).description: The muzahir can use its action to be immune to all damage. The immunity lasts for 1d6 rounds.

Al-biruni's Fantastic Quill.name: Al-biruni's Fantastic Quill
Al-biruni's Fantastic Quill.description:
You touch an object with an avian feather to give it properties of a magical quill. The object must have some sort of a sharp part to be used. A wooden stick, a sharp stone, a metal shard, or a similar object would do.

The Marvelous Quill: The object can be used to write and produce its own magical ink when you activate it as an action. It can be used for writing on any solid surface for 1 hour. When you reach 5th level, you can spend 4 hours and 15 gd to produce a cantrip scroll of your choice. When you reach 11th level, you can spend 8 hours and 50 gd to produce a 1st level spell scroll of your choice. When you reach 17th level, you can spend 12 hours and 200 gd to produce a 2nd level spell scroll of your choice. The spells that you scribe as a scroll must be known to you or you must have them prepared.

The Unexpected Eraser: The object can be used to erase writing that is put on a surface within 1 day. The writing disappears, and the surface resembles as though it were never written. An identify spell cast on the surface reveals that the writing was erased and a dispel magic spell brings back the writing. When you reach 5th level, the duration of 1 day becomes 1 week. When you reach 11th level, the duration of 1 week becomes 1 month. When you reach 17th level, the duration of 1 month becomes indefinite.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Wizard

Al-farghani's Alchemy.name: Al-farghani's Alchemy
Al-farghani's Alchemy.description:
You touch a tiny object and grant a magical property from below that is useful for daily life and in matters of taste, aroma, and similar things.

Beverage Shifter: When put into a cup, jug or a similar object filled with water or another liquid, it can turn the liquid into a liquid that is drinkable and harmless, such as juice, coffee, tea, or something similar. Unless consumed, the liquid turns into its original state after 10 minutes. This object can't change the magical or other potentially harmless properties in the liquid (such as poison). When you reach 5th level, it can eliminate poisons and similar dangerous and non-magical properties. When you reach 11th level, it can change magical liquids into non-magical and harmless ones. When you reach 17th level, it can change magical liquids or normal ones into common or uncommon magical substances, such as turning water into a healing potion or a potion of fire resistance.

Magical Aroma: When applied to a creature, clothing or to a specific place, such as the corner of the room, kitchen counter or the dining table, it gives off a certain smell designated by you. It lasts for 1 hour. When you reach 5th level, you can make the aroma poisonous. You designate a point, and the air in a 5 foot radius area around that point becomes poisonous for anyone who enters or anyone who starts its turn there. They must make a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. When you reach 11th level, they also receive 1d8 poison damage on a failed save. When you reach 17th level, the damage becomes 2d8, and the radius extends to 15 feet. When you make the area poisonous, you must concentrate on this spell, and it lasts for 10 minutes.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Al-jazari's Metalsmith.name: Al-jazari's Metalsmith
Al-jazari's Metalsmith.description:
You touch a tiny object made from metal to assign one of the features below to it. The features last until you dismiss them (no action required), after 1 hour, or when the feature says so.

Flame Tender: The object can start or snuff out fires on candles, torches, campfires and similar objects, as an action. At 5th level, you can use it to make a melee spell attack using your spellcasting ability scores to deal 1d6 fire damage as the part of your action to lit it and it is extinguished at the end of your turn. At 6th level its damage increases to 2d6. At 11th level, 3d6. At 17th level, 4d6.

Acid Mouth: The object produces 0.1 ounces of acid. This acid can be used to melt and pierce through locks, handles and similar things and disappears after 3 uses. At 5th level, you can use it to make a melee spell attack using your ability scores to deal 1d6 acid damage. At 6th level its damage increases to 2d6. At 11th level, 3d6. At 17th level, 4d6.

Arcanasteel Shield: The object must be a circular or of a similar shape that is proper for a shield. It becomes a disk big enough for your hand. When a creature attacks you, you can use your reaction to activate it. It magically appears on your arm and does not take your ability to use your hand and grants you +1 to your Armor Class until the end of your next turn. When you reach 5th level, it grants +2 to your AC.

Class Lists: Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Al-jazari's Woodwork.name: Al-jazari's Woodwork
Al-jazari's Woodwork.description:
You touch a piece of wood that was carved into a shape by human hands and assign some features to it.

Water Diviner: The object can be used for 1 hour to guide you toward the nearest water source within 5 miles. You can use it to clean contaminated water of 5 gallons. It doesn't remove poisons. When you reach 5th level, it can be used to duplicate the purify food and drink spell and it can't be used again, until you finish a long rest. At 11th level, it can duplicate the create or destroy water spell and you can't use the Water Diviner again until you finish a long rest. At 17th level, it can be used to cast create food or water and you can't use the Water Diviner again until you finish a long rest.

Totemic Ward: This totem wards you from otherworldly threats. You designate a type of creature: Aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead. The object can be on a person, under a bed, or hanging above a door or a window to be active. While under the bed, whenever a chosen type of creature enters within 10 feet of the ward, it gives a designated sound, visual or scent and forces the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't come close to the ward until the end of its next turn and takes 1d6 psychic damage. The damage increases to 2d6 when you reach 5th level, 3d6 when you reach 11th level, and 4d6 when you reach 17th level.

Sturdy Weapons: You touch five pieces of ammunition, a wooden club, a wooden quarterstaff or a similar wooden weapon and grant them magical properties for overcoming resistances against non-magical attacks. For the duration, they can't be broken by normal means. For example, if you imbue 5 arrows, all can be collected after firing as normal ammunition. At 5th level, you double the number of ammunition or wooden weapons you can imbue. At 11th level, you triple the number.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Bedouin Fabrics.name: Bedouin Fabrics
Bedouin Fabrics.description:
You magically weave a tiny fabric to have magical aspects and choose one of the following options.

Saharan Haeadband: The object can be used as an action and grants advantage on saving throws related to extreme heat for the next hour to the creature using it. At 5th level, the creature wearing it is immune to the effects of extreme heat. At 11th level, the creature wearing it has advantage on death saving throws in extreme heat conditions.

Desertnight Scarf: The object can be used as an action and grants advantage on saving throws related to extreme cold for the next hour to the creature using it. At 5th level, the creature wearing the scarf is immune to the effects of extreme cold. At 11th level, the creature wearing the scarf has advantage on death saving throws in extreme cold conditions.

Surgeon's Bandages: When you receive healing from a source, or roll a Hit Dice to recover hit points, the bandage helps you magically. You can reroll a 1 or 2 once, but you must use the new roll. The bandage then disappears. When you reach 5th level, it can be used twice without disappearing. At 11th level, it can be used 3 times.

You can only have up to 3 of the objects at the same time.

Class Lists: Bard, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard

Emboldening Tune.name: Emboldening Tune
Emboldening Tune.description:
when you or a creature within 30 feet of you fails a Charisma check

Magic of the myths surrounds the target within range and it adds 1d6 to the failed Charisma check and possibly turn it into a success.

At Higher Levels: When you reach certain levels, the bonus increases: 5th level (1d8), 11th level (1d10), 17th level (1d12).

Class Lists: Bard

activation.condition: when you or a creature within 30 feet of you fails a Charisma check

Glee.name: Glee
Glee.description:
You attempt to convince a creature with 5 or more Intelligence within 60 feet of you to perform a trick that's been long performed in festivals, gatherings, and other meetings. You force a creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you choose one of the following actions:

Why Are You Hitting Yourself: You convince the target to spend its reaction to hit itself. The creature actually hits itself, spending its reaction and taking 1d6 force damage. The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (3d6).

Slip and Fall: The target falls prone in a hilarious way. When you reach certain levels, you can extend this effect's power. At 5th level, the target is pushed 10 feet away. At 11th level, the target is stunned until the end of your next turn. At 17th level, the target is either paralyzed or stunned until the end of your next turn.

Class Lists: Bard

Herculean Might.name: Herculean Might
Herculean Might.description:
Magic of the myths surrounds the target within range and it adds 1d6 to the failed check and possibly turn it into a success.

At Higher Levels: The bonus increases when you reach 5th level (1d8), 11th level (1d10), and 17th level (1d12).

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

activation.condition: when you or a creature within 30 feet of you fails a Strength or a Constitution check.

Mirror Mirror.name: Mirror Mirror
Mirror Mirror.description:
When you take damage from a creature within range, you make them look into a mirror as if they hurt themselves and inflict some damage onto them. You make a spell attack against the target, a melee spell attack if it's within your reach or a ranged spell attack if it is within 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage.

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

Class Lists: Bard

activation.condition: which you take when you take a damage from a target within 60 feet of you.

Li Jin's Tactical Movement.name: Li Jin's Tactical Movement
Li Jin's Tactical Movement.description:
You invoke the great words spoken by the great Tang commander from Shaanxi. You choose a creature you can see and that can hear you within range and urge them to move. You grant it the ability to move with its reaction. It can use their reaction to move up to half their speed in that instant.

At Higher Levels: When you reach higher levels, the spell allow you to target more creatures: 5th level (2), 11th level (3), and 17th level (4).

Class Lists: Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Patriarch's Blessing.name: Patriarch's Blessing
Patriarch's Blessing.description:
The wisdom of your belief surrounds you, and you add 1d6 bonus on your next Religion or Arcana check related to the trigger.

At Higher Levels: When you reach certain levels, the bonus increases: 5th level (1d8), 11th level (1d10), and 17th level (1d12).

Class Lists: Cleric, Warlock, Wizard

activation.condition: when you encounter a religious object, story, or a similar aspect related to your religion, or belief.

Unseen Strike.name: Unseen Strike
Unseen Strike.description:
You briefly make your weapon invisible and if you take the attack action this turn, you force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you have advantage on one of the attack rolls.

At Higher Levels: At 5th level, you can imbue all your attacks in that turn. At 11th level, you deal an extra 1d8 force damage. At 17th level, the damage increases to 2d8.

Class Lists: Bard

Eldritch Mark.name: Eldritch Mark
Eldritch Mark.description:
An eldritch dread erupts magically from your pointed finger towards an enemy within range. A dreaded scream is all that the target hears. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be marked for the duration. While the target is marked, whenever it takes damage, it takes extra psychic damage equal to your proficiency bonus and has disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Class Lists: Ranger, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock

Endless Arrows.name: Endless Arrows
Endless Arrows.description:
You draw your bow while it is empty and the spell conjures a magical piece of ammunition that can be fired with an action. You make a ranged spell attack or a normal attack roll with the bow. On a hit, a target takes 2d6 force damage + your Dexterity modifier. While the spell is active, you can use your bonus action to continue the spell. If you fail to do so, the spell ends early. If you have the Extra Attack feature or somehow make more than one attack on the same turn, you can conjure arrows, but the additional attacks only deal 1d6 force damage + your Dexterity modifier.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the force damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Ranger

Al-jazari's Practical Summons.name: Al-jazari's Practical Summons
Al-jazari's Practical Summons.description:
You conjure a solid and non-magical object that you have seen before within 15 ft. of you. The object must be Large or smaller, and its price must not exceed 150 gd. The object must not go further than 15 ft. from you or it disappears immediately. The object disappears 10 minutes later.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can conjure one more item equal to the slot's level.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Faithful's Strike.name: Faithful's Strike
Faithful's Strike.description:
You imbue your assault with your arcane potential. When you hit a creature you can choose to expend a spell slot to deal with an extra 2d10 damage of the same type as the weapon.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

activation.condition: With the action you hit a creature

materials.value: a melee weapon worth at least 1 cp

Eldritch Mirror.name: Eldritch Mirror
Eldritch Mirror.description:
You invoke the sense of aesthetic and beauty in a creature within range to lure their sights to a spectral mirror you conjure.
