After the creature gazes at the spectral mirror, you twist their reflection in an eldritch and horrific way to poison their mind. You force the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and takes 1d6 psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher you can target another creature for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Bard

materials.value: a mirror worth at least 10 gd

Li Jin's Agile Mobility.name: Li Jin's Agile Mobility
Li Jin's Agile Mobility.description:
You choose a creature that you can see and that can hear you within range and invoke the arcane powers of the great Tang commander Li Jin. It can use its reaction to take one of the actions: Dodge, Shove, Use an Object, or Hide.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can affect one more creature for each slot level above the 1st.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer Warlock, Wizard

Li Jin's Impervious Charge.name: Li Jin's Impervious Charge
Li Jin's Impervious Charge.description:
You invoke the arcane methodologies of the great Tang commander Li Jin to help your allies achieve greater measures of martial prowess. You choose a creature that you can see and that can hear you within range, and it can use its reaction to make an attack roll.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can affect one more creature for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Primal Mark.name: Primal Mark
Primal Mark.description:
You mark a creature with your mind's eye. That creature must be within range of this spell and must be visible to you. For the duration, even if you can't see the target anymore, you know where it is as long as it is within range. Until the spell ends, you can use your reaction to attack the target whenever it moves at least 10 feet if your attack can reach it. This attack is a special one, and deals 1d6 force damage only, rather than your normal weapon's damage.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Ranger

Primal Vengeance.name: Primal Vengeance
Primal Vengeance.description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot to damage the creature. It takes extra force damage equal to 2d6.

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st. It does not increase above 5th level spell slots (a 5th level spell slot makes the damage 5d6).

Class Lists: Ranger

activation.condition: With the action you hit a creature

materials.value: a weapon worth at least 1 cp

Resonating Smite.name: Resonating Smite
Resonating Smite.description:
When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend a spell slot to surround the creature with a ghostly bell. While the creature is surrounded with this spell, the first hit per turn you make (which also triggers for the attack that allowed you to cast this spell) deals an additional 1d8 thunder damage as the bell tolls. If an ally of the target comes within 10 feet of the target, the bell tolls again. The ally of the target then must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d8 thunder damage or half as much on a successful one. If the ally stays within 10 feet, it keeps making the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. This affects one additional creature per round.

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st. It does not increase above 5th level spell slots (a 5th level spell slot makes the damage 5d8).

Class Lists: Paladin

activation.condition: With the action you hit a creature

materials.value: a melee weapon worth at least 1 cp

Sacred Retribution.name: Sacred Retribution
Sacred Retribution.description:
When you are hit by an attack within 60 ft. of you, you can use your reaction to uphold divine punishment to those that dared to strike you. You make a melee or a ranged spell attack to the creature that caused you damage. On a hit, it takes 3d8 radiant damage.

At Higher Levels: For each slot level above 1st, the damage increases by 1d8.

Class Lists: Cleric

activation.condition: triggers when you take a damage

Siyah Qalam's Infernal Awareness.name: Siyah Qalam's Infernal Awareness
Siyah Qalam's Infernal Awareness.description:
You look deep into the eyes of a creature that is not a humanoid and utter the words of infernal domination, first discovered by the master demonologist, Mehmed Siyah Qalam. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. If the target fails the Wisdom saving throw, you roll a d4 and add that to your Armor Class for all attacks against you coming from that target. If the target succeeds on the save you learn one of the following:

  • Its resistances;

  • Its vulnerabilities;

  • Its immunities.

Alternatively, if you target an object you learn whether it is a magical object or not. When you do so it faintly glows only in your eyes, depending on its rarity: Blue for common, uncommon and rare; Purple for very rare and legendary.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

True Word For The Saint.name: True Word For The Saint
True Word For The Saint.description:
You point a finger at a creature you can see within range and ask a question. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must answer the question truthfully. You know if the creature has passed the saving throw or not.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin

Unreal Attack.name: Unreal Attack
Unreal Attack.description:
You create an illusional attack to strike an enemy within range. The type of the attack can be whatever you want: a dreaded fiend, an armored knight, a vicious orc, a flying sword, or something else entirely that is Medium or smaller. You force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, it takes 2d6 psychic damage. After each instance of damage, the target makes an Intelligence saving throw. On a success, it realizes the illusion and can no longer be harmed by the spell until you cast it again.

With your bonus action on your turn, you can strike another creature within 30 feet of you with the illusion. If an ally or another creature shares the information about the strike being an illusion, they have advantage on the Intelligence saving throw.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Al-ahmar's Arcane Shroud.name: Al-ahmar's Arcane Shroud
Al-ahmar's Arcane Shroud.description:
You utter the word of Al-Ahmar, The Red One of the Djinnfolk, and surround yourself with arcane energy. For the duration, your essence changes. When a spell or a feature attempts to detect your creature type (for example, detect evil and good or divine sense) you appear one of the following: celestial, fey, fiend, elemental, humanoid, or undead. You choose the type when you cast the spell.

If a spell or an effect has special effects depending on your creature type (for example cure wounds can't be cast on undead or construct), you must adhere to the rules accordingly.

Class Lists: Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Al-jazari's Flexible Casting.name: Al-jazari's Flexible Casting
Al-jazari's Flexible Casting.description:
When you cast this spell, you can choose a 1st-level spell (its duration must be 1 action) from your spellbook and cast that spell instead. If the spell asks for a material component, you must have it on you.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher (maximum is 5th level to benefit this) you can duplicate a spell that is one level below from your spellbook.

Class Lists: Wizard

materials.value: a spellbook worth at least 50 gd

Al-jazari's Greater Summons.name: Al-jazari's Greater Summons
Al-jazari's Greater Summons.description:
When you cast this spell, you can conjure a magical item that you have seen before, it must not be a consumable item and must not be rarer than an uncommon item. It vanishes after 1 minute or you use a bonus action to dismiss the item.

At Higher Levels:When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot, you can conjure a rare item.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: a giant eagle'sfeather, worth at least 100 gd, which the spell consumes

Fear Of The Depths.name: Fear Of The Depths
Fear Of The Depths.description:
You unleash the fear of depths in one creature you can see within range. A construct or an undead is immune to this effect. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you choose creatures equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. The target sees the chosen creatures as a source of eldritch fear and becomes frightened of them until the spell ends. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock

Flagellant's Aid.name: Flagellant's Aid
Flagellant's Aid.description:
Your maximum hit points increase by 10. This spell does not increase current hit points, and the effect does not stack on multiple casts.

At Higher Levels: For each spell level higher than 2nd, your hit point maximum is increased by 5 more hit points.

Class Lists: Cleric

Godfrey's Word Of Resilience.name: Godfrey's Word Of Resilience
Godfrey's Word Of Resilience.description:
Reaction, which you take when you see multiple allies take damage at the same time due to failing a saving throw, such as from a fireball, falling boulders, or cannonball

You utter words infused with the holy energy of Godfrey, the Advocate of the Holy Sepulchre. You choose up to five creatures (you can choose yourself) that take damage due to failing a saving throw. You roll a d6, and the chosen creatures add the result to their saving throws.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger

activation.condition: when you see multiple allies take damage at the same time due to failing a saving throw, such as from a fireball, falling boulders, or cannonball

Li Jin's Lightning Charge.name: Li Jin's Lightning Charge
Li Jin's Lightning Charge.description:
You target yourself and up to two allies within 10 ft. of you. They can use their reaction to cooperate with you. All three of you can move up to your speed and deal one attack to a creature within your reach. If any of you use ranged weapons or throwable melee weapons, you can also make an attack roll with them against a creature within range. You can aim for the same or different targets.

On a hit, each attack deals additional 1d6 lightning damage. Instead of dealing extra damage, any of you can choose to push the target up to 10 ft. and force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a fail, they also fall prone.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

Class Lists: Bard, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer,

Warlock, Wizard

Saint's Everlight.name: Saint's Everlight
Saint's Everlight.description:
When you cast this spell, all possible light sources are lit within range and can't be put out for the next hour, unless a 3rd level darkness or a similar spell is cast. If there are no possible light sources, an orb of light that sheds 30 ft. of bright light and a further 30 ft. of dim light appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range, and it stays for 1 hour.

If a 2nd-level or lower darkness spell is the trigger, you must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw to counter it. If you enter a space already filled with a 2nd level or lower darkness spell or a similar effect, you can cast this spell as well.

At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell affects darkness spells or similar effects that are equal to or less than the spell slot you used.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Paladin, Sorcerer

activation.condition: when your surroundings become full darkness or a darkness spell is cast

Smuggler's Arcane Subterfuge.name: Smuggler's Arcane Subterfuge
Smuggler's Arcane Subterfuge.description:
When you cast this spell, you cloud the mind of all who gaze upon a particular piece of paper or a similar item. Unless they succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, the item you show appears as a proper legal document with a function of your choosing, such as legalizing your presence there, proving you indeed have authorization to bring the goods into the city, and the like. On a success, they see through the illusion and realize that you were trying to meddle with their minds.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Celestial Force Of Attraction.name: Celestial Force Of Attraction
Celestial Force Of Attraction.description:
When you see a spell being cast within range, you can call upon your arcane might to misalign gravity and change the spell's course, presenting yourself as the target.

If the spell targets a creature and is made with an attack roll (for example, guiding bolt), it takes your Armor Class into account, and if it forces one creature to make a saving throw and not an area of effect (for example hold person), you make the saving throws. If the spell succeeds, you are affected by the spell, not the original target. If the spell is an AoE attack (for example fireball), the center of the spell shifts to right below your feet.

If it's a healing spell, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell heals you.

If the spell normally targets one creature at its lowest level and now somehow affects more than one target (for example, due to upcasting or Metamagic), you can only alter one attack roll or one saving throw.

At Higher Levels: For each level above the 2nd, you gain +1 bonus to your Armor Class or saving throw.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

activation.condition: when you see a one target spell is being cast within 60 ft. of you

Zengi's Armor Of Faith.name: Zengi's Armor Of Faith
Zengi's Armor Of Faith.description:
You draw the sigils of the lords of Zengi to the aether, summoning the arcane might of the powerful masters who fought for the Holy Lands with great faith and pride. For the duration, each time you take damage, you reduce the damage by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus or equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (your choice when you cast the spell). If you reduce the damage to 0, you gain the remaining damage as temporary hit points. For the purpose of your concentration saving throws, no matter the damage, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to hold your concentration.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer

Al-aswad's Interrogation Circle.name: Al-aswad's Interrogation Circle
Al-aswad's Interrogation Circle.description:
You create a runic magical circle centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range and up to a 10-foot radius in size. Runes are written in djinn speech, they glow faintly, and are imbued with the name of the great djinn, the Two Thunders, Al-Aswad.

You can use your action to activate the circle to target up to three incapacitated creatures inside the circle. The targets must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save they start to feel heavy pain. Whenever you desire, you can use your bonus action to deal 1d10 psychic damage to the target. This damage can't reduce the target below 1 hit point for the first time. Every damage you deal after reducing the target to 1 hit point triggers a spellcasting check by you against DC 13. On a failed save, the target takes the damage as normal and drops to 0 hit points, and it can't be targeted again by this spell for 24 hours.

While inside the circle and affected by its magic, a character has disadvantage on checks and saving throws related to interrogation, asked questions or spells of similar effects (for example, zone of truth).

For all the subsequent casts of this spell on the same creature after the very first time, the creature may go mad. When a target is submitted to this spell again, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw when the spell ends or goes mad. The details of the madness are determined by the GM.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell slot or higher, the damage of this spell increases by 1d10.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Al-jazari's Marvelous Duplicates.name: Al-jazari's Marvelous Duplicates
Al-jazari's Marvelous Duplicates.description:
You touch an object that is tiny. It can be a magical item and can be consumable but it must not be rarer than Uncommon. Within 5 ft. of the object, an exact duplicate of the item appears with a small puff of smoke and stays there for 1 minute. If it is a consumable item, it can be used as normal and will affect normally.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the item can be Rare. If you cast it with a 9th level spell slot, the item can be Very Rare.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: Identical flintstones worth at least 50 gd, which the spell consumes

Jarrah Al-hakami's Commander’s Sense.name: Jarrah Al-hakami's Commander’s Sense
Jarrah Al-hakami's Commander’s Sense.description:
You touch the ground and heighten your senses with magic. For the duration, you sense exactly how many humanoid creatures are present within range. If you desire, you can shorten the range to sense a limited area.

Class Lists: Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

Battle Focus.name: Battle Focus
Battle Focus.description:
You touch a creature and improve their focus to an extreme level, granting them one of the following effects:

Combat Maneuvers: The target adds +2 to their attack rolls.

Arcane Determination: The target's spell save DC increases by 2.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Li Jin's Glorious Attack.name: Li Jin's Glorious Attack
Li Jin's Glorious Attack.description:
You draw upon the lingering arcane wisdom of the Tang General Li Jin. As a part of the action you spent to cast this spell, you gain +2 bonus to your Armor Class and any saving throw you make. Until the spell ends, you can use your bonus action to grant three allies of your choice the following magnificent abilities, each of which lasts until the start of your next turn (you can choose other allies or the same ones when you use this again with another bonus action).

Magical Weapons: If not already magical, the weapons they hold are counted as magical weapons for the duration and deal an extra 1d4 force damage.

Precision Attack: They have 1d4 bonus to their attack rolls and damage rolls.

Hammering Strikes: For the duration, one of the hits made by each of the targeted allies forces the creatures that are hit by them to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target falls prone. For example, if you have three allies affected by this spell, until the start of your next turn, three of them force each creature they hit to make a saving throw with this effect.

Resurgent Assault: You can choose to end the spell early by using an action to make one weapon attack. If the attack hits a creature, you force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take 6d8 thunder damage. The total damage makes up a pool. You can distribute the pool as temporary hit points among three allies of your choice within range.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Nightmare.name: Nightmare
Nightmare.description:
Duration: 7 days

You put the seeds of nightmares in a creature within range that you can see. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or its dreams are polluted with fear and horror. When the creature attempts to take a long rest, instead it is forced to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it can't benefit from the rest and the creature's nightmares manifest into reality. A night terror creature is summoned within 10 feet of the creature. Normal exhaustion rules apply.

The spell can be removed early with a remove curse or a stronger spell.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Al-jazari's Infernal Metals.name: Al-jazari's Infernal Metals
Al-jazari's Infernal Metals.description:
You affect shields, armor, weapons, and all kinds of objects that are made of metal that are nonmagical in the range of the spell. The wearers or the ones that are in physical contact with the objects take 5d8 fire damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

If the wearer is wearing armor and does not doff the armor when the spell ends, the armor melts away and deals 8d8 fire damage to the wearer.

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above the 4th.

Class Lists: Cleric, Wizard

Binding Darkness.name: Binding Darkness
Binding Darkness.description:
You utter the word of the deep and summon darkness that lies in the realm of Al-Ghaib. A 20-foot-radius sphere of blackness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point within range and lasting for the duration and is counted as a 4th level darkness spell. Creatures that enter the area for the first time or start their turn there must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they fall into despair and experience a horror of your choice; you can choose different outcomes for different creatures that failed the saving throw. The effect either is instantaneous or lasts until the end of your next turn. Creatures that succeeded on the saving throw take 2d6 psychic damage.

Enemies Around: They perceive every living creature as hostile and menacing. They are frightened of the nearest creature.

Mind Blast: They take 4d6 psychic damage.

Bound Ethereal: Otherworldly creatures (creatures that are not humanoid, beast, monstrosity, giant, or dragon) have advantage on attack rolls against them.

Smothering Darkness: They feel the very air is being sucked out of their lungs and receive extra damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier when they take damage. In addition, they have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock

activation.condition: can be triggered at the end of an ally's turn

Li Jin's Ultimate Command.name: Li Jin's Ultimate Command
Li Jin's Ultimate Command.description:
An ally you choose is inspired by the words you invoke that belonged to great Tang commander Li Jin. Using your reaction you can inspire them to force their limits. They play an additional turn right after their normal turn ends in the initiative order.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 6th level spell slot, you can include one more of your allies that at least played one turn in the initiative order to take another turn right after this one.

Class Lists: Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

activation.condition: Can be triggered at the end of an ally's turn

Healing Litany.name: Healing Litany
Healing Litany.description:
A litany worthy of the skies above conjures an invisible aura with a 30-foot radius. The aura is centered on you and moves with you. Whenever a friendly creature damages or you damage a creature in the aura, you can use your reaction to heal an ally within the aura. The creature regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

In addition, if you take damage while the spell is active and your concentration is broken due to that damage, you can sacrifice your own vitality to help an ally within range. You can use your reaction to take an additional 2d8 necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, and one creature of your choice that you can see within range regains a number of hit points equal to twice the necrotic damage you take. Then the spell ends.

This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger

materials.value: a rare wood from a tree at least hundred years old, worth at least 250 gd

Al-jazari's Wondrous Armory.name: Al-jazari's Wondrous Armory
Al-jazari's Wondrous Armory.description:
You choose up to 6 pieces of armor or weapons within 10 feet of you. When the casting of this spell is complete the armor and weapons are animated. You can summon a number of animated armor* or flying swords* with a total combined Challenge Rating of 2. For example, you can create 1 animated armor* and 4 flying swords*. The constructs take orders from you and act best as their ability allows them to. You must spend your bonus action to command them. Unless they take commands, they simply follow you and attack the nearest enemies or take dodge action.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

materials.value: A shard taken from a blade or a rusty piece of armor that is at least a thousand years old and is worth 500 gd, which the spell consumes

Divine Agony.name: Divine Agony
Divine Agony.description:
You invoke an avatar of pain, drawing eldritch strength from your suffering. You create a pool based on your maximum hit points. You choose a point within range and force each creature within a 20-foot radius to make a Constitution saving throw. You can distribute any number of damage to creatures from your pool to the ones that failed. For the spell to work, there must be at least two creatures in the radius, and you can't exceed half of the pool when assigning damage to a single creature.

Class Lists: Cleric

Omar's Justice.name: Omar's Justice
Omar's Justice.description:
concentration on certain occasions.

You utter the words that were spoken by the Caliph Omar when he condemned his own soldiers when they defied his orders. You choose any number of creatures within range and force them to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are condemned to a divine punishment chosen by you. On a success, they only take 4d6 psychic damage.

Murder Penalty: The target takes damage equal to all damage it's dealt to other creatures or constructs within 10 minutes.

Ban of Magic: The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw each time it attempts to cast a spell. On a failed save, the spell can't be cast, but the slot is not expended. On a successful save, the spell is normally cast, but the caster takes damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier + the spell's level (1, if it's a cantrip). It lasts for 1 minute and you must concentrate on this spell.

Limb for Limb: The target loses the ability to control one of their limbs, possibly a hand or a leg, it can't be the head. The target faces a penalty according to the limb. For hands, they can't hold a weapon or a shield with that hand. For legs, movement speed is reduced to half. You must concentrate on this spell and it lasts for 1 minute. If you are able to concentrate on it for a full minute, the limb is chopped off from the body, and the target takes 8d8 necrotic damage as well as a one level of exhaustion.

Scorching Eyes: The target's eyes start to feel hot. It has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and has disadvantage on attack rolls. You must concentrate on this spell, and it lasts for 1 minute. If you fully concentrate on it for a full minute, the target is blinded permanently; its eyes melt away, and the spell deals 8d8 fire damage to the target.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Withering Breath.name: Withering Breath
Withering Breath.description:
You unleash an eldritch shout that defies the natural order. The metal objects within range that are not worn or carried are affected by your spell and instantly turn to rust. The objects that are worn or carried by other creatures are also affected if their owners fail their saving throws. You force each creature within range to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, any metal on them withers away in the form of rust. If there are magical objects made of metal, each requires separate saving throws. On a failed save, they lose their magical properties for the duration.

If your concentration is broken before the spell ends in a full minute, the objects being worn or carried by other creatures return to their normal state. However, if you concentrate for a full minute, they remain withered. Magical objects always gain their properties back after the spell ends.

Class Lists: Druid, Ranger

True Awareness.name: True Awareness
True Awareness.description:
For the duration, the creature you touch understands when it hears a lie, its passive Perception increases by 5, and has advantage on all Wisdom checks and saving throws.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: specially made peppermint worth at least 25 gd, which the spell consumes

Fate Intervened.name: Fate Intervened
Fate Intervened.description:
When you roll for Initiative, you choose up to five creatures (including you) that you can see within range. You force them to make Charisma saving throws. Creatures can fail the saving throw voluntarily. You roll 2d6 and add or subtract the result to their Initiative rolls. You can decide for each of the creatures separately.

At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, instead of rolling, you take the result as 12.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

activation.condition: Take after you roll for Initiative

materials.value: an hourglass worth at least 150 gd

Danger Inbound.name: Danger Inbound
Danger Inbound.description:
When you cast this spell using a reaction, you and all voluntary creatures within range are transferred into an ethereal version of this world. You can perceive your surroundings as if they were somewhat blurry, and the sounds reach you via echo. For the duration, you and other creatures are undetectable except by creatures capable of true sight or by divine means. Other ways, such as see invisibility or detect magic, do not reveal your presence. However, you and your companions can't take actions that involve walking outside your current position, can't communicate with anyone outside this ethereal world, and can't cast any magic or activate a magic item. For the duration, no other effect can harm you, and all effects on you are suspended. The spell ends early if you use a bonus action to end it.

When the spell ends, you and your chosen companions appear back where they left. If a space is occupied then the creature appears in the nearest unoccupied space. If the environment changes drastically, such as due to a fire, earthquake or a spell, you or other creatures may be susceptible to an otherworldly danger decided by the GM.

If the spell ends, and you roll for initiative again, you have advantage on that roll. If the enemies did not expect you, the GM may decide on a surprise.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

activation.condition: Take when you roll initiative or detect an enemy

Herald Of Doomsday.name: Herald Of Doomsday
Herald Of Doomsday.description:
You become the embodiment of your message, of the upcoming apocalypse. You briefly change your appearance suitable to your beliefs. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you for the duration. While they are frightened, they take 4d6 psychic damage at the start of each of their turns. After you concentrate on the spell for a full 1 minute, the creatures are still frightened and become paralyzed for 1d6 rounds.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock

Contact The Dead.name: Contact The Dead
Contact The Dead.description:
You invoke the name of a dead humanoid. It must be its true name or legal name: a nickname or a pseudonym does not work (If there are multiple creatures with the same name, you must use something distinctive, like a title or a nickname, such as Thomas the Unholy, One-eyed Ibrahim, Jonathan son of Abel, or the like). Its spirit appears within 15 feet of you to converse. The spirit immediately makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is required to answer you truthfully. On a success, it can act however it desires, at the GM's discretion. In both cases the spirit does not know the saving throw it makes, and succeeding on it won't impose any disadvantage. On a failure, it feels the truth is the best option. You can talk to the spirit for 10 minutes. After the duration, it is returned to wherever it belongs.

Class Lists: Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: a branch of a rotten tree

Mind Swap.name: Mind Swap
Mind Swap.description:
You choose two creatures within range, which can include yourself. You force them to make Charisma saving throws. Creatures can fail voluntarily. If both of them fail the saving throw, you swap their minds. For example, if you swap minds with an ancient red dragon, your personality remains the same, but you use its stat block and it uses yours. This spell lets special effects or features be transferred within minds, such as you can using its fire breath and it can use your spells for the duration, but it does not let memories and feelings pass between creatures. For example, a dragon won't have access to your memories or vice versa.

Class Lists: Bard, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard

True Execution.name: True Execution
True Execution.description:
You point your finger towards a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save it takes necrotic damage equal to half of its maximum hit points. On a success, it takes half as much. If a creature dies because of this spell, it can't be resurrected.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Blessed One.name: Blessed One
Blessed One.description:
Your dedication and time spent in holy places have affected you. You feel a divinity in your heart and you know a blessing is upon you:

  • You learn a cleric or druid cantrip of your choice.

  • You choose either the bless or the protection from evil and good spell. You can cast that spell without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. If you have spell slots, you can cast the spell normally using your spell slots.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Desert Wanderer.name: Desert Wanderer
Desert Wanderer.description:
A life in the desert is not unfamiliar to you. You showed respect to the sands, and now they respect you back. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Strength, Constitution or Wisdom score increases by 1.

  • Choose one skill you are proficient in. You double your proficiency bonus on the chosen skill if you have not already doubled it from another source, such as Rogue’s expertise.

  • You are not affected by extreme heat conditions.

  • Your speed is not affected by dunes, sandstorms, and other phenomena of the desert.

  • You only need 1/3 of the water humanoids normally need.

  • You gain proficiency in the Survival and Nature skills.

Desert Wanderer.name: Desert Wanderer
Desert Wanderer.description:
A life in the desert is not unfamiliar to you. You showed respect to the sands, and now they respect you back. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Strength, Constitution or Wisdom score increases by 1.

  • Choose one skill you are proficient in. You double your proficiency bonus on the chosen skill if you have not already doubled it from another source, such as Rogue’s expertise.

  • You are not affected by extreme heat conditions.

  • Your speed is not affected by dunes, sandstorms, and other phenomena of the desert.

  • You only need 1/3 of the water humanoids normally need.

Eldritch Warden.name: Eldritch Warden
Eldritch Warden.description:
You dedicated your studies to eldritch lore, and your skills and insight understand the rift between the material world and beyond the veil. You gain the following benefits:

  • You sense any djinn or aberration within 10 ft. you.

  • You can cast the detect evil and good spell once a day, without expending a spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

  • By expending a spell slot when you deal damage to an otherworldly being (which is not humanoid, beast, monstrosity, dragon or giant) you deal an extra 2d8 force damage to the creature and an extra 1d8 force damage for each slot level above the 1st.

Knight’s Oath.name: Knight’s Oath
Knight’s Oath.description:
Your days of struggle and pain only made you stronger. You are ready to take your skills with weapons and armor to a new level:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

  • You learn one Fighting Style skill from the Fighter class. If you already know one, you must choose another.

Knight’s Training.name: Knight’s Training
Knight’s Training.description:
You aspired to be a knight, and it’s time to arm yourself properly for a warrior.

  • You gain proficiency with martial weapons.

  • You halve your armor don and doff time. Donning or doffing a shield can be done with a bonus action for you.

Locksmith.name: Locksmith
Locksmith.description:
You spent a lot of time in front of locked doors and behind locked bars, becoming an expert on the topic:

  • You gain proficiency with thieves’ tools.

  • While using thieves’ tools against locks, you have advantage on the roll.

  • If you spend 1 hour with an unattached lock, you can make its mechanism more complicated, and if you ever use that lock, the DC used to open it increases by 1d6.

Occult Adept.name: Occult Adept
Occult Adept.description:
You have honed your skills and mind within occult circles and readied yourself for new abilities.

  • You learn a sorcerer or warlock cantrip of your choice.

  • You learn the bane spell and can cast it without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you do so, you can’t cast it again like this until you finish a long rest. If you have spell slots, you can cast the spell normally.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for those spells.

Wanderlust.name: Wanderlust
Wanderlust.description:
Your boots have seen everything and tasted the dust of many realms. Your life is full of travels, and you are accustomed to it more than anyone else. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Constitution or Dexterity score increases by 1.

  • Your walking speed increases by 5 ft.

  • You gain proficiency in the Survival or Nature skills.

  • You can take Dash as a bonus action on your turns.

  • You can lower your exhaustion level by only finishing a short rest. You can do so only with 2 short rests before you finish a long rest.

  • When you forage for food and water, you have advantage on the check.

Wildlife Explorer.name: Wildlife Explorer
Wildlife Explorer.description:
Your time spent with beasts and domesticated animals gave you an edge around them and you learned to communicate with them better than anyone else.

  • You learn the speak with animals and animal friendship spells. You can cast each of them without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can’t cast them again until you finish a short or long rest.

  • You gain proficiency in the Animal Handling skill.

The College of the Doomsayer.name: The College of the Doomsayer
The College of the Doomsayer.description: Doomsayers are an infamous cadre of bards that despoils the hearts of their enemies within and beyond combat. Just as their proficiency with foretelling cataclysmic events through prophetic verses is legendary, so too are the instruments of their choice: brutalistic grand horns, quarterstaffs with brutish religious iconography, and overbearing prayer beads with gothic trinkets.

Impending Doom - Voice.name: Impending Doom - Voice
Impending Doom - Voice.description: Your voice is infused with magic. You can awaken the feeling of impending doom in a creature you can see within 60 ft. of you as an action. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you for the next minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This feature works as if you are concentrating on a spell, and it lasts for 1 minute. It doesn’t work on undead or constructs.

Impending Doom - Inspire.name: Impending Doom - Inspire
Impending Doom - Inspire.description: You can inspire your allies at the brink of twilight. With a bonus action, you can give +1d4 bonus to ability checks, saving throws, or the attack rolls of the allies within 60 ft. of you. They must be able to hear or see you. They can use this +1d4 only one time in the next 10 minutes and must add it before making the roll. This bonus becomes 1d6 when you reach 6th level, and it becomes 1d8 when you reach 11th level.

Tale of the End: Destruction.name: Tale of the End: Destruction
Tale of the End: Destruction.description:
When you reach the 3rd level, your consciousness starts overflowing with visions of the End. Aspects of these visions have taken root in your speech, music, and art. Using your action, you can start a performance and choose one of the aspects of doom below, and you can use each feature once per long rest.

Destruction

A deep voice inflicts the minds around. Creatures within 60 ft. of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become paralyzed and have visions about the end of the world until the end of your next turn. Moreover, you can expend a Bardic Inspiration dice and roll it. You can spare people from this effect equal to the result, and they gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. This feature does not work on constructs.

Tale of the End: Conflict.name: Tale of the End: Conflict
Tale of the End: Conflict.description:
When you reach the 3rd level, your consciousness starts overflowing with visions of the End. Aspects of these visions have taken root in your speech, music, and art. Using your action, you can start a performance and choose one of the aspects of doom below, and you can use each feature once per long rest.

Conflict

A mix of loud and chaotic melodies invade the room. You choose up to five creatures other than you that hear you within 60 ft. and grant them either +2 bonus to their Armor Class, or they can add your Charisma modifier to their damage rolls for the next 3 rounds (limited to once per turn for each creature). You can’t choose differently: all chosen creatures are granted the same benefit. You can extend this duration by rolling one of your Bardic Inspiration dice. The extended number of rounds equals the result.

Imposing Prophecy.name: Imposing Prophecy
Imposing Prophecy.description:
At 6th level, the way you foretell impending doom is so powerful that you can manipulate the battlefield by using your words, dark melodies, and imposing rhythm. Using your bonus action, you can unleash a powerful melody and choose one of the effects from below:

Repelling Melody.

Each enemy within 15 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, they are pushed 15 feet away from you. If they hit a solid object like a wall or a person during this process, they take 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

Towing Rhythm.

Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Strength saving throw. On a fail, they are pulled 15 feet towards you.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Fear of Doom.name: Fear of Doom
Fear of Doom.description: Starting from 14th level, your mere presence can reek of doom and despair whenever you wish to have it do so. Every enemy within 30 feet of you gains vulnerability to every damage type as long as they are frightened.

Tale of the End: Judgement.name: Tale of the End: Judgement
Tale of the End: Judgement.description:
When you reach the 3rd level, your consciousness starts overflowing with visions of the End. Aspects of these visions have taken root in your speech, music, and art. Using your action, you can start a performance and choose one of the aspects of doom below, and you can use each feature once per long rest.

Judgment

A strong and short burst of a deep violin ranks with the sky. Every fey, fiend, celestial, and undead creature within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, you know their type and location precisely

Tale of the End: Salvation.name: Tale of the End: Salvation
Tale of the End: Salvation.description:
When you reach the 3rd level, your consciousness starts overflowing with visions of the End. Aspects of these visions have taken root in your speech, music, and art. Using your action, you can start a performance and choose one of the aspects of doom below, and you can use each feature once per long rest.

Salvation

The hopeful voice of a beautiful woman is heard in the distance. One creature you choose within 60 feet of you regains hit points equal to 2d8 + your Charisma modifier. You can increase this amount by rolling one of your Bardic Inspiration dice. The number of hit points gained equals the result.

Eyes of the Sun.name: Eyes of the Sun
Eyes of the Sun.description:
When you reach 2nd level, you bind your soul more intimately to the sun's relentless power than any mere mortal caressed by its rays. As an action, by spending one of your Wild Shape uses, you choose one of the benefits below for 10 minutes:

Eyes of the Sun

Your eyes shine like the sun and they shed bright light in a 5 ft. cone and dim light for an additional 5 ft. Any creature within 10 ft. of you is considered under the sunlight. You can ignite flammable objects within 30 ft. of you. Any damaging spell you cast deals an additional 1d6 fire damage. This damage becomes 1d8 at 6th level, 1d10 at 11th level and 1d12 at 16th level.

Might of the Golden Visage.name: Might of the Golden Visage
Might of the Golden Visage.description:
Basking in the sun's unyielding radiance, your form becomes nigh impervious, its golden armor deflecting blows.

While under direct sunlight or while using your Sun’s Embrace ability, you gain +2 bonus to your Armor Class, and each time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you roll 1d8 and gain temporary hit points equal to the total.

Molten Will.name: Molten Will
Molten Will.description:
When you reach 2nd level, you bind your soul more intimately to the sun's relentless power than any mere mortal caressed by its rays. As an action, by spending one of your Wild Shape uses, you choose one of the benefits below for 10 minutes:

Molten Will

The ground you call upon ignites with your eldritch might, and the heat obeys your command. You gain resistance to fire and cold damage. You can use your bonus action to make a 5 ft. square floor a fiery ground that damages whomever that enters. The square stays on fire for the next minute or until a spell of 1st level or higher extinguishes it. You can choose creatures up to a number equal to your Wisdom modifier (including yourself) to be unaffected by the flames. Anyone other than the designated characters take 2d6 fire damage when they enter the area for the first time or start their turn there. You can have 2 such squares active at the same time. This number increases by 1 each time your proficiency bonus increases.

In addition, your movements do not provoke opportunity attacks while the Molten Will is active in at least one square.

Scorched Eyes.name: Scorched Eyes
Scorched Eyes.description:
The sun's blazing majesty, which once might have seared the sight of mere mortals, becomes a mesmerizing dance for your eyes. Bathed in its pure luminance, you are shielded from all radiant harm and your scorched eyes are gifted with a sight beyond sight.

When you reach 14th level, you are immune to radiant damage and gain Blindsight (30 ft.).

In addition, when you take fire damage (you take no damage due to your immunity), you can use your reaction to embrace the damage. Until the end of your next turn, as an action you can direct the damage total to a creature within 30 ft. of you that you can see with a ranged spell attack. For example, if you are caught in the middle of a fireball spell that deals 33 fire damage, you can use this feature to deal a creature (within 30 ft. of you) 33 fire damage if you score a hit. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Solar Touch.name: Solar Touch
Solar Touch.description:
When you reach 2nd level, you bind your soul more intimately to the sun's relentless power than any mere mortal caressed by its rays. As an action, by spending one of your Wild Shape uses, you choose one of the benefits below for 10 minutes:

Solar Touch

Your hands seem as if they are aflame with golden radiance. Whenever you heal a creature within 30 ft. of you with a spell (including yourself), you heal the creature an additional amount equal to your Wisdom modifier. In addition, your unarmed strikes are empowered, or you can imbue non-metal weapons or ammunitions with the power of sun. You can use your bonus action to conjure the flames on your hands or a non-metal weapon of your choice (or 2 pieces of ammunition). Until the end of your next turn, if you score a hit with the chosen weapon or your unarmed strikes, you deal an extra 1d6 fire damage (any ammunition used like this loses its fiery power). This damage becomes 1d8 when you reach 6th level as a druid, 1d10 at 11th level, and 1d12 at 16th level.

The Solar Form.name: The Solar Form
The Solar Form.description:
The sun's fierce ardor and your unyielding allegiance to the circle meld, forging you into a being of transcendent resilience. The inferno's wrath leaves you untouched, and the sanctified luminance finds it hard to scald your now-hallowed essence.

When you reach 10th level, your connection to the sun and your devotion to your circle empower you greatly. You are immune to the fire damage and gain resistance to radiant damage.

In addition, when you enter one of the Sun’s Embrace forms, you can use your bonus action to change your form. You can do so a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

Channel Divinity: Holy Will.name: Channel Divinity: Holy Will
Channel Divinity: Holy Will.description:
Empowered by your unwavering faith, you let loose a divine warcry, emboldening your resolve and shattering the hearts of enemies around you.

As an action, you can force each creature within 20 ft. of to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take radiant damage equal to your highest possible divine smite.

Channel Divinity: Reclaim the Lost.name: Channel Divinity: Reclaim the Lost
Channel Divinity: Reclaim the Lost.description:
Your oath steels your soul against the onslaught of horrors, you stand resolute, unflinching, unyielding.

As an action, you use your Channel Divinity to renew your oath to regain what is lost to you and a divine help surrounds your soul. You are resistant to slashing, piercing and bludgeoning damage and one type of elemental damage of your choice (fire, cold, acid, lightning, thunder). It lasts for 1 minute.

Divine Retribution.name: Divine Retribution
Divine Retribution.description:
Your belief alone allows you to bring retribution to those who oppose you, by summoning holy flames from the aether.

Whenever an ally within 60 ft. of you that you can see or hear takes damage, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot and make a ranged spell attack against the enemy, if it is within 90 ft. of you. If you hit, the creature takes damage as if it were hit by divine smite. In addition, if your ally did not drop to 0 hit points it gains temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + the level of the spell slot you have expended.

Sword of the Divine.name: Sword of the Divine
Sword of the Divine.description:
Your divine essence grows so powerful that even the arms you bear are now infused with your radiant faith. They act as if they are not merely inanimate objects, but comrades in arms under the same oath, bringing divine retribution to your enemies.

As a bonus action, you can imbue one melee weapon you are holding with multiple benefits for 1 minute:

  • It deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

  • It ignores resistances.

  • You can score a critical hit with a roll between 18-20.

  • You can only willingly drop the weapon; external interventions can’t make you drop it.

  • Whenever you expend a spell slot to cast divine smite or a smite spell, you regain a spell slot. The slot you regain must be of a level lower than the spell slot you used to cast the divine smite or the smite spell and can't be higher than 5th level.

You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Unyielding Bulwark.name: Unyielding Bulwark
Unyielding Bulwark.description:
Death is but a distant possibility for a warrior of your grit and faith - you heed its call no more, and its unholy grasp is weak upon your body.

When you take a damage and not killed outright, you can expend a spell slot as a reaction and reduce the damage taken equal to 2d8 + your Charisma modifier. The damage neglected increases by 1d8 for each spell slot used above 1st level to a maximum of 5d8.

Aspect of the Celestial.name: Aspect of the Celestial
Aspect of the Celestial.description:
Not all that the Al-Ghaib touches is corrupted with evil. You invite the power of belief and pure conviction into your body.

You can use your action to touch a creature and bless it. The blessed creature adds 1d4 to its attack rolls or saving throws for the next minute. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your maximum Rage (Also 6 at 20th level). You regain expended uses after you finish a long rest.

Additionally, while raging you see if there are other otherworldly creatures within 30 ft. of you. They have a faint aura around them that is related to their origin – for example, black for fiends, green for feys, purple for aberrations, red for dragons, etc. You also deal 1d4 extra radiant damage with your melee weapon attacks based on Strength.

Aspect of the Fey.name: Aspect of the Fey
Aspect of the Fey.description:
The trickery, the overflowing essence, and the way of the eerie. Your body is now home to the secrets of the Green Gate.

You have resistance to being charmed.

Additionally, while raging you deal extra 1d4 psychic damage with your melee attacks based on Strength. If you forgo your rage after a landed strike (no action required), the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it believes to be in a situation determined by you and looks awed, and it is stunned until the end of your next turn.

Aspect of the Fiend.name: Aspect of the Fiend
Aspect of the Fiend.description:
Darkness and madness reign in your blood. You overcame the eldritch corruption of Al-Ghaib and bent this influence to your will.

You gain darkvision to a range of 30 ft. If you have darkvision from another source, this effect stacks on top of it, increasing the range.

Additionally, while raging you have resistance to fire damage and deal 1d4 extra fire damage with your melee attacks based on Strength.

Aspect of the Undead.name: Aspect of the Undead
Aspect of the Undead.description:
Some sought immortality in the world beyond - most found death and despair. But you are not most - your body is infused with the essence of undeath.

You have resistance to necrotic damage and you no longer need food, drink, and air.

Additionally, while raging, you deal extra 1d4 necrotic damage with your melee attacks based on Strength, and if you die while raging, you can’t be turned into an undead.

Celestial Aspect Improvement.name: Celestial Aspect Improvement
Celestial Aspect Improvement.description: You can use your action and your primal instincts become sharper than ever. You can discern lies for 1 minute and gain true sight for 1 round. Your damage die for your extra damage becomes 1d6 (if you chose another aspect earlier, its damage die increases, but does not become radiant).

Fey Aspect Improvement.name: Fey Aspect Improvement
Fey Aspect Improvement.description: When your rage ends (you can also end it early to use this feature with a bonus action), your fey aspect unleashes its illusory powers. It works as if you have cast a mirror image spell but requires no concentration.

Fiend Aspect Improvement.name: Fiend Aspect Improvement
Fiend Aspect Improvement.description: While raging and after you deal damage, you can end your rage early (no action required) and deal fire damage to a 20 feet radius. You deal 6d8 fire damage. Anyone caught in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. Any flammable objects catch fire in the area

Ultimate Celestial Aspect.name: Ultimate Celestial Aspect
Ultimate Celestial Aspect.description: If one of your allies within 30 ft. of you drops to 0 hit points while you are raging, you can use your reaction to end your rage early and save your fallen ally. The ally drops to 1 hit point instead and gains 4d8 temporary hit points. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Ultimate Fey Aspect.name: Ultimate Fey Aspect
Ultimate Fey Aspect.description: While raging you can attempt to affect your foes with great might. You can choose to end your rage early and choose up to three creatures within 20 ft. of you and force them to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, they are transformed into a creature of your choice that is no more than CR 2 and stay that way until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature 3 times and gain expended uses after you finish a long rest.

Ultimate Fiend Aspect.name: Ultimate Fiend Aspect
Ultimate Fiend Aspect.description:
You have Devil’s Sight (120 ft. darkvision and can discern colors in it, as well as see in magical darkness). Receiving fire damage while raging heals you 1d6, but you must use your reaction in order to do this. You may use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain expended uses after you finish a long rest.

If one of your allies within 30 ft. of you drops to 0 hit points while you are raging, you can use your reaction to end your rage early and save your fallen ally. The ally drops to 1 hit point instead and gains 4d8 temporary hit points. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Ultimate Undead Aspect.name: Ultimate Undead Aspect
Ultimate Undead Aspect.description: hile raging whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack based on Strength, you gain 1d4 hit points. You can use this feature a number of times to equal to double of your proficiency bonus. In addition, if you kill a creature while you are raging, the target rises as an undead of your choice no more than 2 CR. The creature follows your orders. There can be only one creature at a time under your control (except other ways, such as multiclassing into a class with necromancer abilities).

Undead Aspect Improvement.name: Undead Aspect Improvement
Undead Aspect Improvement.description: While raging undead have disadvantage if they attack creatures than you (or other creatures with this feature) if you are within their line of sight.

Channel Divinity: Redemption from the Lo.name: Channel Divinity: Redemption from the Lord
Channel Divinity: Redemption from the Lo.description:
With a divine gaze, you tear into the very minds of your enemies, making them endure the torment of every wound you bear. Your pain becomes their undoing, meted out in cruel, psychic reprisals. The more you've suffered, the more they will.

As an action on your turn, you choose up to six creatures within 60 ft. of you and force them to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. You deal psychic damage to the ones who failed the saving throw. The damage is coming from a pool which is equal to your missing hit points. For example, if you have 50 maximum hit points and currently have 10 hit points, the pool is 40. You can divide the number between the failed creatures.

Designer’s Note:This feature is intended to work together with the Level 1 feature Repenting the Sins. Temporary hit points do not count. For example, if you have 10 current hit points and 30 temporary hit points and your hit point maximum is 40, the damage pool is 30.

Faith is My Shield.name: Faith is My Shield
Faith is My Shield.description:
By the time you become 6th level, your unwavering faith has forged an ironclad bond with the divine. At the very moment you carve penance into your own flesh, you can channel this divine might, turning the pain into a testament of your unyielding devotion.

When you strike yourself to take Atoned Damage, you can choose to deal full damage. By doing so, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot to nullify the damage you took.

Punishing Strike.name: Punishing Strike
Punishing Strike.description:
At 8th level, the holy rage within you starts infusing your strikes with searing divine wrath; each blow bathes foes in sanctified agony.

When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal 1d8 radiant damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't use this feature again until the start of your next turn.

Repenting the Sins.name: Repenting the Sins
Repenting the Sins.description:
By spending an entire long rest dedicated to your flagellant rituals and forgoing recovering hit points, you gain the following benefits:

In case of restoring hit points, you are counted as if you have taken a short rest. You roll your hit dice according to the rules of short rest, but all the hit points you restore through this process are counted as temporary hit points and your hit dice remain unspent.

You recover your Spell Slots as you would in a regular long rest. Also, if you have other features from feats, multiclasses or other sources that replenish when you finish a long rest, they also replenish your such abilities.

You gain +2 bonus to your Armor Class.

You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Insight) checks.

You have resistance against Atoned Damage.

All features last until you finish a long rest.

The Ultimate Sacrifice.name: The Ultimate Sacrifice
The Ultimate Sacrifice.description:
When your zeal itself threatens to usher you to oblivion's door, the divine essence intervenes, granting you a shred of their holy might and leaving you teetering on the precipice between life and death, a place where your faith shines the brightest.

If the Atoned Damage you took reduces you to 0 hit points, you regain a use of your Channel Divinity, and instead of falling unconscious, you are reduced to 1 hit point.

In addition, you are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

Wounds of Faith.name: Wounds of Faith
Wounds of Faith.description:
From 1st level, your faith commands you to repent for your sins and remember martyrs and their pain. As a bonus action on your turns, you can strike yourself with a weapon and damage yourself. It is called “Atoned Damage”: you take normal damage from the weapon but don’t add your ability score modifier to the damage roll.

If you make a melee weapon attack on the same turn that you take Atoned Damage, it delivers your sins and the rot that corrupts your wounds to the opponent. If you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can choose one of the following:

You force the target to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it deducts the Atoned Damage on its next attack roll or saving throw until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

You force the target to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it takes poison damage equal to the Atoned Damage.

You gain a bonus to your Armor Class until the end of your next turn. It is equal to half of the Atoned Damage you took (rounded up).

In addition, due to constant fighting with infections on your body from the cuts of your flagellant rituals, you are resistant to poison damage and have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

Battlefield Command.name: Battlefield Command
Battlefield Command.description:
When you reach Level 7, your Mamluk discipline and the blood-soaked tapestry of the martial cultures you draw inspiration from have made you a beacon of command that others rally behind.

Your Mamluk Dice is now a d10. You can now use the following effects for your Mamluk Dice:

  • If an ally within 15 ft. of you fulfills the conditions mentioned in Mamluk Dice effects unlocked in Level 3, you can use your reaction to give one of Mamluk Dice uses to that ally. That ally can use the die for that fulfilled condition. If the ally fails to use the die at that moment, the die is lost.

  • When a creature has an advantage on an attack roll against you or an ally within 15 ft. of you, you can expend one of your Mamluk Dice to cancel the advantage.

  • You can spend 5 ft. of movement to escape a nonmagical restraint by expending one of your Mamluk Dice.

Custodian of the Sands.name: Custodian of the Sands
Custodian of the Sands.description:
In moments when your unyielding spirit defies fate, your ancient heritage compels you to surge once more, standing proud, fighting with unmatched discipline.

Whenever you use your Indomitable feature, you regain one of your Mamluk Dice.

Death Herself Trembles.name: Death Herself Trembles
Death Herself Trembles.description:
With a rallying cry that resonates with the spirit of battles past, you summon fallen allies to rise once more. Such is the gravity of your command that even in the face of death, they heed your call and rejoin the fray.

When a creature within 60 ft. of you drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to expend one of your Mamluk Dice. You roll the die, if the result is higher than 6, it is dropped to 1 hit point instead. A creature must be able to hear or see you to be able to gain this benefit, it can’t be an undead or a construct, and you must not be incapacitated. This feature does not work if the damage kills the creature outright. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest even if you have Mamluk Dice uses left.

Grizzled Veteran.name: Grizzled Veteran
Grizzled Veteran.description:
Sharpened by the relentless desert skirmishes, your agility and force of presence becomes nigh unbreakable, defying threats that would daunt others.

You gain proficiency in Dexterity or Charisma saving throws. In addition, your Mamluk Dice becomes d12.

The Art of War.name: The Art of War
The Art of War.description:
From 1st level, your faith commands you to repent for your Amidst the endless dunes and ancient ruins, your dedication to martial arts as a Mamluk has carved a path of mastery that mere aspirants can only gaze upon in envious reverie.

You gain a pool of dice that is called “Mamluk Dice,” which currently is a d8. The number of times you can use the Mamluk Dice is equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain expended uses after you finish a long rest. You can expend the die in some conditions that is mentioned here and in later levels and gain benefits from it:

  • When you are forced to make a saving throw that puts you in a condition, you can roll one of your Mamluk Dice and add it to your result. You must choose to do so after seeing the roll but before the outcome is announced.

  • When you fail a Strength or Dexterity check, you can roll one of your Mamluk Dice and add it to your result, potentially turning a failure into a success.

  • When you score a critical hit, you can roll one of your Mamluk Dice and add it to the damage.

  • When you roll for Initiative, you can roll one of your Mamluk Dice and add it to the result.

  • When an attack roll hits you, you can roll one of your Mamluk Dice as a reaction and decrease the number from the attacker’s attack roll, potentially causing it to miss.

Essence of the Long Road.name: Essence of the Long Road
Essence of the Long Road.description:
Tempered by endless horizons and the silent wisdom of the road, the journey bestows upon you an enlightened mind.

Starting at 3rd level, you gain these benefits:

  • You gain proficiency in the Survival skill and Navigator’s Tools.

  • You can’t be lost except by magical means.

  • While traveling, you have advantage on saving throws that force you to take exhaustion.

  • By spending 1 Ki Point, you can cast the misty step spell.

  • You can spend 3 Ki Points and 10 minutes meditating to decrease your exhaustion level by 1.

Hard Roads Stridden.name: Hard Roads Stridden
Hard Roads Stridden.description:
The roads, once mere pathways, now bend to your profound mastery. Such is the depth of your expertise that you can now invoke the arcane arts to bridge vast distances with but a thought.

You can spend 3 Ki Points and 1 minute meditating to decrease your exhaustion level by 1.

Share the Bread.name: Share the Bread
Share the Bread.description:
The shared hardships and camaraderie of the road have etched deeper lessons into your soul. Your presence alone steels the composure of your allies.

By the time you reach 6th level, you learned to share the roads and its perils with your companions. Whenever you spend a Ki Point near an ally that is within 5 ft. of you, you choose one of the benefits below:

  • Both of you gain +2 bonus to your Armor Classes for a number of turns equal to your Martial Arts die while you are within 30 ft. of each other. If another Ki Point is spent while this bonus is active, this AC bonus does not stack.

  • You and your ally gain temporary hit points equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

  • If you cast the misty step spell until the end of your next turn, you can include a willing ally that is within 5 feet of you. When you cast the spell, the target appears within 5 ft. of you in an unoccupied space. If no such place is available for the character, it fails to come with you.

  • You and your ally gain resistance to one type of damage for a number of turns equal to your Martial Arts die while you are within 15 ft. of each other. The damage type can be: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

Watchful Eyes.name: Watchful Eyes
Watchful Eyes.description:
At 3rd level, you have advantage on Survival and Investigation checks made to find your way and follow a target and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

In addition, once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you deal an additional 1d6 force damage. This damage increases to 1d8 when you reach 11th level.

Ultimate Ambush.name: Ultimate Ambush
Ultimate Ambush.description:
Harnessing the cityscape as your weapon, you command the battlefield with unerring precision. No foe can dodge your gaze, and your aim remains unchallenged, as even the shadows become allies in your relentless pursuit.

When you have advantage on an attack roll with a weapon, you have these benefits:

  • You ignore half cover and three quarters cover.

  • You can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature gains a condition of your choice: prone, blinded or deafened. The condition stays for 1 minute and the creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to free itself on a success. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

  • If you score a critical hit, you roll one additional damage die of the weapon

Warhawk’s Flurry.name: Warhawk’s Flurry
Warhawk’s Flurry.description:
With a tempestuous fury, you unleash a maelstrom of strikes, targeting a single adversary with a deadly barrage.

At 7th level, when you score two successive hits on the same target in the same turn, as a reaction you can apply one of the options:

Crippling Strike.

You cause the target to lose its balance. The target’s movement speed is halved for 1 minute.

Bleeding Strike.

You open a wound in the target. The target loses 1 hit point per turn, and for each hit it takes if its proficiency bonus is equal to +3 or below. Otherwise it loses 1d4 damage per turn and for each hit it takes. This lasts for 1 minute and works as if concentrating on a spell. If the target receives some healing or an action is spent to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check against your spell save DC, the condition ends early. It doesn’t work on creatures that don't have blood, such as constructs or some celestials.

Assisting Strike.

You distract the target. Until the end of your next turn, attack rolls against this enemy add your Wisdom modifier.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Sundering Blows.name: Sundering Blows
Sundering Blows.description:
With a profound understanding of your foes' vulnerabilities, your strikes now shatter their defenses, paving the way for subsequent blows that are even more lethal and unrelenting.

At 15th level, When you score a hit against a creature, you can cause it to have vulnerability against a type of damage of your choice. It lasts for 1 minute.

You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Secrets’ Power.name: Secrets’ Power
Secrets’ Power.description: With a chilling murmur, you unveil a sliver of the dread secret you harbor. When you make an attack and don’t have advantage on it, you can expend one of your dice to give yourself a bonus on the attack roll equal to the roll of your Secret die. If you don’t qualify for Sneak Attack, you can use Sneak Attack nonetheless.

Secrets Remembered.name: Secrets Remembered
Secrets Remembered.description:
With iron resolve, you shield both your thoughts and those of your comrades from malevolent intrusions.

You can use your bonus action to expend one of your Secret dice and choose a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (including you). You roll your Secret die and until the end of the next minute, the creatures can add the total to their attack rolls or saving throws, they can do that once with one expended die.

Secrets from the Depths.name: Secrets from the Depths
Secrets from the Depths.description:
Uttering a cryptic word steeped in personal significance, you channel its arcane might.

As a bonus action, you can reach into other minds by expending one of your Secret dice. The target must be within 15 ft. of you and its Intelligence score must be 5 or higher. On a failed save, you can read its surface thoughts for a number of rounds equal to your Secret die roll. If you wish, when the reading ends you can deal damage equal to your Secret die as a reaction. The damage is psychic. If a creature is immune to psychic damage, this feature doesn't work on them and if it has resistance, the saving throw is made with advantage.

Secrets Shared.name: Secrets Shared
Secrets Shared.description:
With caution, you bestow upon your allies a fragment of the forbidden knowledge you bear.

You expend one of your Secret dice and choose a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier within 30 ft. of you. These creatures gain temporary hit points equal to the number rolled and gain resistance to a type of damage until the end of the next minute. The damage type can be psychic, force, or necrotic.

Secrets Unleashed.name: Secrets Unleashed
Secrets Unleashed.description:
With a mere whisper, you awaken the deepest terrors within a soul.

When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one of your Secret dice to force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you can use your bonus action to whisper one word. The creature is considered frightened of that word. For example, you can say sword, hat, wall, ground, even your own name. The creature is frightened by a number of rounds equal to the result of your expended Secret dice. If the creature succeeds the saving throw, you deal psychic damage equal to half the total rolled.

Infiltrate the Mind.name: Infiltrate the Mind
Infiltrate the Mind.description:
Harnessing forbidden utterances, you breach the sanctum of minds, bending creatures to your malevolent will.

When you reach 13th level, you can expend 3 of your Secret dice, roll each of them and add the results together. You have two choices

Infiltrate the Mind

As the part of the action you make to hit a creature, you force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you enter its mind for a number of rounds equal to the total of your rolled Secret dice earlier. You can probe deep in its mind and learn its emotional state, goals, dreams, and secrets. The creature knows that you are in its mind. On each of its turns it can use its action to make an Intelligence contest with you. On a success, the effect ends.

Crush the Mind.name: Crush the Mind
Crush the Mind.description:
Harnessing forbidden utterances, you breach the sanctum of minds, bending creatures to your malevolent will.

When you reach 13th level, you can expend 3 of your Secret dice, roll each of them and add the results together. You have two choices

Crush the Mind

When you score a hit against a creature and roll for Sneak Attack damage, you can turn the damage type into psychic damage by expending one of your Secret dice and add it to the result. All Sneak Attack damage becomes psychic. When you do so, you can also force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you can issue a one sentence command to it. It must obey it until the end of its next turn. The command must not be directly harmful to it or its companions – for example to walk into a chasm or a similar command. The GM has the final say on the legitimacy of the command.

Occult Arcana.name: Occult Arcana
Occult Arcana.description:
Your psyche is now an impenetrable fortress, resistant to the darkest of intrusions.

You are always under the effects of the mind blank spell.

The Eldritch Retribution.name: The Eldritch Retribution
The Eldritch Retribution.description:
Bound within your very essence, the concealed truth not only fortifies your thoughts but manifests as a dark arcane force against foes.

By the time you reach 9th level, you have learned to cast these spells without expending a spell slot or a material component. You can cast each of them once a day: bane, detect thoughts, and fear.

In addition, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and your mind can’t be read by magical means.

Aspects of the Sands.name: Aspects of the Sands
Aspects of the Sands.description:
With ancient energy coursing through you, you call forth a primordial form, a titan of old, echoing an era when the world was young and wild.

At 1st level, by expending a 1st level spell slot as a bonus action, you embrace the form of a creature below. The form lasts for 1 minute. You gain the feature granted by it for the minute. Each time you spend a sorcery point (creating a spell slot, using a metamagic option, etc.), you can activate its effect.

Starting at 2nd level, you can use 1 sorcery point instead of spell slots.

Sphinx
