You assume the form of a mighty sphinx. Feature: You are under the effects of the detect evil and good spell. Effect: You gain flying speed, equal to half your walking speed, until the end of your next turn. If you end your turn in the air, you don’t take fall damage if the fall is no more than 30 ft., and you land on your feet if you don’t take damage.

Serpopard

You resemble the legendary creatures that are half serpents, half lions. Feature: You have resistance to poison damage and have advantage on saving throws about being poisoned. Effect: Your Armor Class increases by 2 until the end of your next turn.

Sha

You resemble the beast from the underground, the blessed of Set.

Feature: You gain darkvision with a range of 30 ft. and you can see in magical darkness.

Effect: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage until the end of your next turn, but you are vulnerable to radiant damage.

Maat’s Legacy.name: Maat’s Legacy
Maat’s Legacy.description:
The aspects of the Sands have grown more powerful, rendering your forms into monstrous paragons of dread and might.

By the time you are 6th level, whenever you activate a form, they gain heightened powers:

Sphinx the Mighty:

Its effect now lets you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

Serpopard the Mighty:

Its effect also gives temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Sha the Mighty:

With its effect, you are no longer vulnerable to radiant damage.

Book of the Dead.name: Book of the Dead
Book of the Dead.description:
As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 3 sorcery points to summon a black book or a golden scroll to your hand, and it remains there for 1 minute. With it you have resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on death saving throws. You can store your own life’s energy in it to unleash its powers:

Resonating Chaos

You can summon spectersj within 10 ft. of you. For each specter you summon, you take 1d6 psychic damage. The maximum number of specters you can summon is equal to your proficiency bonus. When you reach 11th level, you can summon poltergeistsj (1d10 damage for each), and when you reach 16th level, you can summon ghostsj (2d10 damage for each). This damage can’t be prevented by any means.

Echo of the Underworld

You can cast revivify without expending a spell slot and materials; then the book vanishes, and you take 2d10 psychic damage. Once you do so, you can’t cast spells of 2nd level or higher until you finish a long rest.

Doors of Death

You choose a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. The chosen creatures have advantage on death saving throws

Power of the Sands.name: Power of the Sands
Power of the Sands.description:
In the cruel embrace of the desert, you meld and contort, until the very grains of sand course through your veins, forging you into an unyielding specter of the ancient lands.

When you reach 14th level, your forms’ duration increases to 10 minutes.

The Immortal Pharaohs.name: The Immortal Pharaohs
The Immortal Pharaohs.description:
With the fury of ancient pharaohs pulsing within, death itself quivers at your feet, for you now possess the eldritch choice to tread beyond its grasp.

At 18th level, you can use your bonus action to change between aspects of the sands without expending sorcery points. While your aspect is active, when you are dropped to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction and spend 4 sorcery points to drop to 1 hit point instead. When you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest

Bound Fate.name: Bound Fate
Bound Fate.description:
Bound to the timeless weavers, your soul resonates with the very threads of fate and the inexorable march of time, making you a living conduit of the universe's most enigmatic designs.

Starting at 1st level, you can twist the threads of fate around you, and you can do that a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Bound Fate

As a bonus action, you bind your fate with a willing creature within 30 ft. of you for 1 minute. During that minute, you can magically swap places or share damage. To swap places you must use your action, and the creature must be able to hear you. After you swap places, the bond between you and the creature ends.

If either of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to split the damage in half (rounded up) and divide them amongst two of you, if the creature is willing. When you do so, the one that originally did not take the damage reduces the damage by half and your bond ends.

At 6th level, your range for this feature becomes 40 ft. At 11th level, it becomes 60 ft.

Bound Time.name: Bound Time
Bound Time.description:
Bound to the timeless weavers, your soul resonates with the very threads of fate and the inexorable march of time, making you a living conduit of the universe's most enigmatic designs.

Starting at 1st level, you can twist the threads of fate around you, and you can do that a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Bound Time

As an action you can rewind time for a brief moment whenever you or an ally that you can see within 30 ft. of you is endangered. If you or a creature you can see fails an ability check or takes a hit, you can use your reaction to reroll the dice. If the target is hostile to you, it can avoid the reroll by succeeding on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC.

At 6th level, you can also rewind saving throws.

Threads Intertwined.name: Threads Intertwined
Threads Intertwined.description:
The cryptic tapestries of destiny unfurl before your gaze, as your grasp over the intricate weaves of fate tightens, plunging you deeper into the world's shadowed secrets.

When you reach 6th level, you can magically control another humanoid’s fate within 15 ft. of you. As an action, you can force the humanoid to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you decide on its fate:

  • Bound. It is stunned until the end of your next turn.

  • Speechless. It can’t talk for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

  • Ill-Fated. It has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn.

You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest or you can expend a spell slot to refresh it. If you expend a spell slot in this way, it can’t be restored until you finish a long rest.

Threads Past and Future.name: Threads Past and Future
Threads Past and Future.description:
With the arcane rites whispered in forbidden tongues, you summon the audacity to beckon fate to your circle, demanding answers from the very cosmos that dares to weave destinies in its silent loom.

At 10th level, you can spend 10 minutes and 150 gd worth of special herbs that are collected under the blood moon to make a sacred ritual known to the weavers. You name a specific event, person, war, or place that existed in the past and ask up to five questions about it. Your patron or another entity related to that name answers the questions with one sentence. The answer’s accuracy depends on the nature of the creature.

Foretold Life.name: Foretold Life
Foretold Life.description:
Bound to the very sinews of time, your communion with fate elevates you to an omnipotent apex, where you deftly pull and twist the strings of destiny, reshaping the world's narrative in your dark design.

A 14th level, you learn the foresight spell and it doesn’t count against the warlock spells you know or Mystic Arcanum that is available to you. Until you reach 17th level, it works differently for you. You can cast it using an action, without expending a spell slot and its duration is 1 minute. When you reach 17th level, if you choose the foresight spell for your Mystic Arcanum, you can use this feature to cast it without expending a use of Mystic Arcanum, but the spell’s duration is 1 hour for you.

Aspirant Inventor.name: Aspirant Inventor
Aspirant Inventor.description:
You learn how to properly focus your arcane essence to mend the broken by deconstructing the broken objects' intricacies.

You learn the mending cantrip. It doesn’t count against the wizard cantrips you know, and it has different uses for you. You can repair twice the normal size and you can do it using an action.

Machines of War.name: Machines of War
Machines of War.description:
You improve upon your arcane designs and material techniques, creating advanced automata and war engines, their cold steel and clockwork hearts ready to unleash havoc upon a world unprepared for your innovations.

When you reach Level 6, your Automata can be of medium size now and add your Intelligence modifier to their hit points when you first create them.

In addition, you can invoke your magic on inanimate objects. By spending 30 gd and 10 minutes you can give an object a walking speed of 20 feet and ability to obey one command from you (Chosen when you first use this benefit). These commands can be from prestidigitation spell or another command that would suit the object’s nature. You can issue the command as a bonus action. The object has 10 AC and 20 HP. Additionally, it can record a voice up to ten seconds and can repeat it one time. The voice recording takes 1 action and if not repeated in the next 8 hours, it is deleted immediately. You can have only three such items at the same time.

Additionally, you can use your Search action as a bonus action and when you do so, you can identify substances and materials of objects and items easily.

Spirit of Everything.name: Spirit of Everything
Spirit of Everything.description:
Your feats of engineering are unparalleled, and you learned how to infuse your creations with an essence of your psyche. Your machines are yours and yours alone, ready to obey your orders.

By the time you are 10th level, your Automata can be of large size now and add your wizard level to their hit points when you first create them. In addition, they gain the Telepathic Bond feature of the homunculus, but it is limited to 1 mile in range.

You have a bond with handmade objects as well. When you expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher as an action while touching an object, you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw. The DC equals to 8 + the owner’s proficiency bonus + the owner’s Charisma modifier. The DC can’t be lower than 13. On a success, you learn the owner’s alignment and the last thought since it held the object.

Miraculous Invention.name: Miraculous Invention
Miraculous Invention.description:
You need but wish to craft the most powerful creatures and automate, as you now control your arcane potential with incredible ease.

When you reach 14th level, you learn the creation spell and can cast it without expending a spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest

Animus.name: Animus
Animus.description:
You have learned to control all inanimate objects around you and instill faint and obedient consciousness upon even the most basic of materials.

You learn the telekinesis and animate objects spells and have them always prepared, they do not count against the spells you can prepare each day. You can cast each of them without expending a spell slot but can’t cast them in this way again until you finish a long rest. If you have spell slots, you can cast them as normal

Wondrous Compass.name: Wondrous Compass
Wondrous Compass.description: This compass has interesting carvings and some personal runes carved by Al-Jazari himself. When you expend a spell slot as a bonus action while holding this compass, you can whisper a location’s name to it, and it will magically point to that location until the end of your long rest. The location must be specific and one of a kind – for example, the city of Samarkand, House of Wisdom in Baghdad, Forbidden City in Beijing, or Mahmud al-Isfahani’s Blacksmith Shop. Personal residence and similar locations do not work (for example, Farhad bin Abu Bakr’s House won’t work); the location must be a public place or at least must be known to many people. In addition, whoever holds this compass has advantage on Survival checks.

Primitive Automaton.name: Primitive Automaton
Primitive Automaton.description:
This robotic design resembles a metallic human or another creature of your choice. It can only be tiny in size, but when built from different materials, give out different benefits at different prices. You can use the homunculusj statblock (Speed 30 ft., no flying speed and no Telepathic Bond) for the created automata, any changes will be mentioned below.

  • Flesh:Price 10 gd. It can turn invisible as an action and can stay like that for 1 hour. If it attacks or takes damage, it reverts to normal.

  • Wooden: Price 50 gd. Its Armor Class is 14 and has +1d4 hit points. It deals 1 extra damage. While Wooden Automaton is within 15 ft., you can cast speak with animals without expending a spell slot. Once you do it, you can’t cast it again until you finish a long rest this way.

  • Stone:Price 75 gd. Its Armor Class is 15 and has +2d4 hit points. It deals 2 extra damage. While Stone Automaton is within 15 ft., you can cast mage armor without expending a spell slot. Once you do it, you can’t cast it again until you finish a long rest this way.

  • Steel:Price 100 gd. Its Armor Class is 16 and +3d4 hit points. It deals 3 extra damage. While within 5 ft. of an ally, the ally deals additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus when dealing slashing, piercing or bludgeoning damage.

  • Gold:Price 200 gd. Its Armor Class is 15 and has +2d4 hit points. It deals 2 extra damage. While within 5 ft. of you, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

Firestarter.name: Firestarter
Firestarter.description:
This tiny device creates fire and easily ignites flammable objects. You can use it to strike foes within 5 ft. of you. You make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes 1d4 fire damage.

When you reach 6th level, the firestarter can be used to produce other elements: acid, poison, lightning, cold.

Magical Mirror.name: Magical Mirror
Magical Mirror.description:
This mirror costs you 100 gd. It works and functions like a normal mirror and has other magical properties. Whenever you activate its magical powers, shapechangers, aberrations, fiends, feys, celestials and the undead shine with an aura in the mirror (if it can’t have reflections, only an aura is seen). The activation lasts for 10 minutes and can’t be used again until the next dawn.

When you reach 6th level, when such a creature’s reflection is caught in the mirror, you can expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher as a reaction and force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 4d6 psychic damage

Wondrous Hook.name: Wondrous Hook
Wondrous Hook.description: This hook works as a normal grappling hook with some magical properties. If a silk rope is bound to the hook, its magic prevents the silk from being ripped due to weight. It still can be torn by taking damage. Also, you can use its command word for it to cling to any surface you like or summon it back to your hand

Circle of the Sun.name: Circle of the Sun
Circle of the Sun.description:
From dawn's first light, mankind revered the sun's boundless blaze; it was their deity, compass, and ensign. Those who truly understood would dare to meet its gaze, finding solace in its brilliance. Recognizing its hand in the flourishing of both tender sprouts and towering titans, they hungered for such might, forging sacred circles.

Within these radiant conclaves, a chosen few began to commune more deeply, their souls intertwining with the very essence of the sun. They became the keepers of its secrets, the whisperers of its ancient tales, and the bearers of its untamed energy, sometimes leading whole civilizations with banners beholding the sun’s golden visage, sometimes with whispers within temple complexes and catacombs. The land responded to their call, the beasts heeded their song, and from their hands, golden, blazing magic flowed. It was whispered among the shadows and sung atop the mountains that these chosen were not mere druids but the very embodiment of the sun's benevolence: The Circle of the Sun Druids, guardians of nature's most hallowed luminescence.

Oath of Crusade.name: Oath of Crusade
Oath of Crusade.description:
They are more than just holy warriors; they are the harbingers of resurgence. Their armor, marred with the scars of countless battles, is adorned with emblems of a holy war. With blades that seem to shimmer with the promise of dawn and shields etched with tales of divine retribution, they stand as a beacon in the darkest of wars.

In the midst of clashing steel and fading faith, their presence is a chilling reminder: even in the throes of death, the Crusader fights on.

Path of the Otherworldly Might.name: Path of the Otherworldly Might
Path of the Otherworldly Might.description: Exposure to torn reality can change people, almost always in dreadful ways, but there are warriors who use these changes to pull strength from the void, the Al-Ghaib. Path of the Otherworldly Might is a warrior’s discipline passed down through lines of warriors who were marked by an arcane disaster, or a scarring spell rebound. This discipline allows the wielders to be aware of the reality rifts around them and use these rifts to draw upon martial aspects to enhance their combat abilities.

Otherworldly Aspect Improvement.title: Otherworldly Aspect Improvement
Otherworldly Aspect Improvement.hint:
Your body is a gateway through which the essence of arcane flows into this world. Being present in both ends of the bridge you see through the veil and sense the otherworld better than most.
                                
                                Starting at 6th level, you have advantage on Intelligence checks to remember lore about arcane aspects, other worlds, and such matters.
                                                
                                In addition, you can choose one of the aspects below. You can take your early choice again or choose another, as your understanding and mastery over the aspects have improved.

Otherworldly Communication.title: Otherworldly Communication
Otherworldly Communication.hint: Starting at 10th level, you start to hear and understand beyond the veil, as if you have ears there. You learn the contact other plane spell. You can only cast it as a ritual and you roll a Constitution saving throw instead of Intelligence saving throw as stated in the spell. You choose one of your aspects directly, and an appropriate creature answers you.

Ultimate Aspect.title: Ultimate Aspect
Ultimate Aspect.hint: you can cast the detect evil and good spell without needing any material and as an innate spell once a day.

sQYVtJc4uKFOtseF.title: Ultimate Aspect
sQYVtJc4uKFOtseF.hint: Starting at 14th level, the veil has shrouded you and you reach your ultimate understanding. You choose one of the aspects below and reach the epitome of your understanding of aspects. In addition, you can cast the detect evil and good spell without needing any material and as an innate spell once a day.

The Flagellant Domain.name: The Flagellant Domain
The Flagellant Domain.description: A sharp sound slices through the ungodly stagnation of the night. A follower, a believer, strikes herself repeatedly while quoting the Holy Scripture. Her blood is spilt all over the place. Her face is reminded of the ultimate serenity, and pain only flashes in the moments of the strike. Her faith prevails, and her sins are taken away with each stroke. She knows that her back is full of scars and with the memories of pain. She knows, however, that her Lord suffered more, and she finds power and might with each strike.

Channel Divinity: Redemption from the Lo.title: Channel Divinity: Redemption from the Lord

The Sentry.name: The Sentry
The Sentry.description: A Sentry, unlike the common ranger, is drawn to the heartbeats of settlements. Whether guarding the city's denizens from lurking dangers or lured by its manifold secrets, they tread the cobbled pathways more than the untamed trails, bound by a sense of higher purpose or captivated by the urban tapestry's intricate dance

The Veil Warden.name: The Veil Warden
The Veil Warden.description: In the oppressive shadows of the city's underbelly, silence is the currency of the powerful. Those who harbor the world's darkest truths wield a power far beyond mere knowledge, bearing burdens that could shatter weaker souls. Behind grimy facades and in the echoing chambers of forgotten crypts, initiates of time-forgotten orders, whispered cults, and clandestine sorcerers either stand as the last bulwark against these eldritch truths or scheme to thrust their malevolence upon the unsuspecting world

Soul of Maat.name: Soul of Maat
Soul of Maat.description:
These sorcerers are not mere conjurers of spells: they are living vessels of Maat, guardians of equilibrium in a chaotic universe. Their presence oscillates between shadow and light, their very souls a testament to the age-old dance of truth and balance. Every incantation they invoke is touched by the divine essence of harmony, and their gaze, penetrating and wise, reflects the eternal quest for order.

Clad in robes woven from threads of destiny and bearing staffs carved from ancient trees, these sorcerers carry a subtle yet powerful symbol – the ostrich feather, the emblem of Maat. It serves as a reminder of the universe's enduring search for balance: just as the hearts of the departed are weighed against this feather in age-old rites, so too do these sorcerers weigh their every action against the eternal scales of truth. In a world teetering on the precipice of imbalance, the Sorcerers of the Soul of Maat stand as unwavering sentinels of cosmic harmony.

The Weaver Patron.name: The Weaver Patron
The Weaver Patron.description:
Her hands moved with purpose, weaving a silent spell that bound a king's speech. Her smile, a subtle blend of triumph and secret delight, seemed to twist fate itself. Around her, the threads of destiny responded, bending gracefully to her silent command, making her the unseen weaver of a kingdom's fate in the heart of shadow.

Under the same dark stars, an elderly elf saw the threads of the future in mirrors, gently separating each one, delving into the mysteries of time behind the misty mirrors of fate. His raven black hair fell over his black robe covered in magical runes, perfectly complementing the hands that wove fate in the darkness.

In the heart of the void between cosmic horror and stars, the masters of predestination work the stretched strings. Legends like the Fates sisters, Norns, Shai, and Kala swirl around in this space. Some follow these legends, while others encounter a weaver in their search for power and answers. Through their pact, they aim to take the threads of their fate into their own hands. The real question, however, is whether they are merely serving a fate already written, or can they truly rebel against a fate written with their own free will?

The Sword Of Saladin.name: The Sword Of Saladin
The Sword Of Saladin.description:
It is said that this sword was a gift to Saladin from Nur ad-Din Zengi himself.
At the time of its gifting, this was a masterfully crafted blade, but it held no magical properties.
Yet the current state of the blade is much more powerful, hinting at Saladin’s skills in enchanting artifacts.
The Sword of Saladin is a yatagan with a classic curved blade; its hilt is decorated with black gems, the insides of which are adorned with purple silken script telling the legend of the Caliph Umar, who took Jerusalem in the 7th century CE.
On it, the following is written: تعلموا العلم، وتعلموا السكينة والوقار These words are written on the blade.
It is a quote by the Caliph Omar: “Acquire knowledge, and learn tranquility and dignity.
” Each creature of your choice within 30 ft.
of you gains advantage on all saving throws for 1d8 rounds.
You roll a d8 and add the result to your and up to 3 creatures’ Armor Class within 30 ft.
of you for 1 minute, as if you are concentrating on a spell.
You choose a damage type; you and up to 3 creatures of your choice within 30 ft.
of you are immune to it for 1d8 rounds.
The item gains 1d4-1 charges at dawn (minimum of 1), and two of the features can’t be active at the same time.

The Mask Of The Leper King.name: The Mask Of The Leper King
The Mask Of The Leper King.description:
This marble mask is carved to resemble a kingly visage and adorned with fine lines and astonishing details.
It is the mask that was worn by Baldwin IV, the Leper King to hide his leprosy-afflicted face.
An arcanist could easily tell that The Mask contains a sliver of Baldwin’s immense arcane power and consciousness, an eldritch accident undoubtedly related to the Leper King’s disease.
The mask fixes a creature’s Charisma, Wisdom and Intelligence scores to 19, if it isn’t higher already and gives advantage to all saving throws while wearing it.

The Robe Of The Leper King.name: The Robe Of The Leper King
The Robe Of The Leper King.description:
The Robe of The Leper King

Wondrous item, legendary, requires attunement

The Silver Cloak.name: The Silver Cloak
The Silver Cloak.description:
Adorned with handwoven symbols of Christian and Mesopotamian origins, the wielder of this cloak is surrounded by a gentle hum of singing and whispers.
It is currently worn by the brave knight of Jerusalem: Guy of Lusignan.
This silver robe grants the wearer +2 bonus to Armor Class and advantage on all saving throws.

Ring Of Muawiya.name: Ring Of Muawiya
Ring Of Muawiya.description:
,requires attunement) Legends tell the story of Muawiya’s Caliphate ring during the Battle of Sıffin, as he forced Ali to arbitration using his wits and possibly this magic ring.
The user can cast the charm person and suggestion spells at will and without using any components.
If the target does not succeed on the saving throw with a total of at least 5 more than the DC, it does not understand being charmed or that any magic was involved once the spell wears off.
In addition, the user can cast the mass suggestion spell once per day.
This ability recharges at dawn.

Amulet Of Al-jazari.name: Amulet Of Al-jazari
Amulet Of Al-jazari.description:
This clockwork amulet’s past is a mystery, though it does possess Egyptian hieroglyphics and Phonecian runes hinting at its ancient Mediterranean origin.
It is said that only the most powerful minds in the world can bind it to its will.
The amulet can be fed with spell slots of any level.
The total level of spell slots used to feed the amulet determines its charges.
It can have 15 charges maximum.
By spending any number of charges you want with an action, you can do one of the following: Golem Summoning: You can summon a golem within 30 ft.
of you in an unoccupied space based on the charges you spent: Jahi Golemh (1) Flesh Golemj (3), Grim Golemj (4), Clay Golemj(5), Stone Golemj (6), Iron Golemj (8).
The golems that have been summoned stay for 1 minute and fight by your side.
You can issue commands using your bonus action.
They vanish after 1 minute, they reach 0 hit points, or until you die.
Breath of Life (at least 5 charges): You animate objects around you following the rules of the animate objects spell by spending 5 charges.
You can make your creations more powerful depending on the extra charges you spend: +1 attack bonus to each object (2), extra hit points equal to your proficiency bonus to each object (2), +1 to Armor Class of each object (2), or +10 movement speed (2).

Bow Of Barjik.name: Bow Of Barjik
Bow Of Barjik.description:
Legendary commander of the Khazar cavalries and bane of the Arabic armies marching into the Caucasus, it is said that Barjik single-handedly hunted down the most prominent commanders in the opposing army with this longbow.
With a twist of fate following Barjik’s death, this longbow found its way to a Kievan merchant, stolen by Black Sea pirates, who sold it to a Maghrebi merchant, who supposedly lost it over the dunes of the Sahara.
This is a magical longbow.
It gives +3 to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it.
As an action, you whisper three names that are within 500 ft.
of you and loose one arrow from the bow to the sky.
Nicknames, pseudonyms, and titles do not work.
Each creature you named must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 10d10 force damage.
The weapon can be used this way once a long rest.
The bow holds the text in Old Turkic: 𐰚𐰀𐰠𐱅𐰢𐰚𐰇𐰼𐱅𐰢𐰘𐰀𐰏𐰓𐰢, which translates to the famous words of Julius Caesar: “Veni, vidi, vici.
”

Ring Of Roland.name: Ring Of Roland
Ring Of Roland.description:
This legendary ring is rumored to have been worn by the great Charlemagne and was gifted to a young man-at-arms after a feat of courage.
Although a mundane ring at first, the young soldier’s faith in the emperor, and hidden potential exposed by the magic in the ring, helped him to become one of the finest warriors ever: Roland from the Song of Roland.
The Ring’s exact succession is lost to history, but it is known that it reached the hands of Balian of Ibelin.
While wearing and attuned to this ring, you can choose a creature within 60 ft.
of you and grant them temporary hit points as an action equal to your Charisma modifier + 2d10.
The ring has 6 charges and gains charges equal to 1d6 at every dawn.
Spending 4 charges, you choose up to ten Commonersj or a similar humanoid with a CR lower than 1.
All of them now count as Knightsj.
This change lasts until the next dawn.
You can use the ring’s power once per dawn.
If you choose the same people for ten consecutive days and succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw for each person, the change becomes permanent.

Spear Of Li Jin.name: Spear Of Li Jin
Spear Of Li Jin.description:
Once belonging to the great general of the Tang Dynasty, Li Jin, this magic spear has +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.
The spear has a reach of 10 ft.
and 3 charges (regains 1d3 charges at dawn).
Once you expend a charge with a bonus action you gain the following benefits for 1 minute: Your walking speed becomes 60 ft, you are immune to fall damage, you don’t provoke opportunity attacks, you gain +2 bonus to your Armor Class, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

Al-jazari’s Goggles.name: Al-jazari’s Goggles
Al-jazari’s Goggles.description:
) These specially made goggles resemble a helm more than goggles, but their special lenses are charged with moonlight and grant darkvision (30 ft.
) to the wearer.
When activated with a command word, it grants the ability to see beyond solid objects until the start of your next turn.
This ability can’t be used again until the lenses spend at least 1 hour under moonlight.

Blessed Ayran - Yogurt Drink.name: Blessed Ayran - Yogurt Drink
Blessed Ayran - Yogurt Drink.description:
common) This cold beverage made from yogurt and water contains the love of a mother, the breath of a believer, or the goodwill of a herder.
When consumed, it removes one level of exhaustion and gives 1d4 temporary hit points.

Book Of Coming Forth By Day.name: Book Of Coming Forth By Day
Book Of Coming Forth By Day.description:
Commonly known as the Egyptian Book of the Dead, this mysterious series of tomes and papyrus, when attuned to, gives the ability to cast spare the dying at will and the following spells each without expending a spell slot.
Once you do so, you can’t cast the same spell again when you finish a long rest: gentle repose, speak with dead, blight.

Amulet Of Broken Tree.name: Amulet Of Broken Tree
Amulet Of Broken Tree.description:
A wooden amulet made from the branches of a tree that is broken and scorched from lightning.
It usually contains a carving symbolizing the broken tree.
While attuned to the item, you can cast spare the dying at will and can cast gentle repose and speak with dead spells without expending a spell slot.
Once you do so, you can’t use them again until you finish a long rest.

Blessed Date Palm.name: Blessed Date Palm
Blessed Date Palm.description:
common) These tiny fruits grow in the holiest places on earth.
The rumors say the rains that fall at Mt.
Zion, Makkah or a similar holy site carry the blessings of the sky.
Date palms that grow there have magical properties.
A bundle usually has 10 fruits.
Each fruit grants 2 hit points to the consumer and no other food is needed for the day.

Commander’s Helmet.name: Commander’s Helmet
Commander’s Helmet.description:
While wearing this helmet you can issue orders to your allies.
It has 5 charges.
You can expend a charge to give out one of the commands to a friendly creature within 60 ft.
of you that can see or hear you: F It can use its reaction to move half of its speed.
F It can make one melee weapon attack.
F It can use an object.

Crescent Blade.name: Crescent Blade
Crescent Blade.description:
This magic weapon is a yatagan, a shamshir or a similar bladed weapon with a curved blade.
You have +1 bonus to your attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon while you are attuned to it.
In addition, you can cast the faithful’s strike spell 3 times without expending a spell slot.
When you cast that spell 3 times like this, you can’t cast it again until you finish a long rest.

Crusader Armor.name: Crusader Armor
Crusader Armor.description:
While attuned to and wearing this armor, you gain +1 bonus to your Armor Class along with the armor’s normal rules.
In addition, you can cast the shield of faith spell 3 times without expending a spell slot.
When you cast that spell 3 times like this, you can’t cast it again until you finish a long rest.
The armor has variants.
It must be a metal armor such as Chain Mail, Breastplate, or Plate Armor.

Crusader Sword.name: Crusader Sword
Crusader Sword.description:
requires attunement by a paladin or a fighter This magic blade carries the wills of the fallen crusaders with it and only those who are worthy can wield it.
When a paladin or a fighter attempts to attune to the item it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw and it shouldn’t be of evil alignment.
On a failed save, it takes 4d6 radiant damage and can’t attune to the sword for seven days.
A more recent attempt increases the damage by 2d6.
On a successful save, it attunes with the sword.
While attuned to it, the sword has +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls and it has 5 charges.
With the charges, following spells can be cast: bless (1), detect evil and good (1), divine favor (1), resonating smite (1), branding smite (2).

Essence Of Al-ghaib.name: Essence Of Al-ghaib
Essence Of Al-ghaib.description:
) This specially made oil can be burned in a grazier for 1 minute and affects all creatures within 10 ft.
of it and then it vanishes.
All creatures that inhaled the smoke have true sight (60 ft.
) for the next hour.

Faithful’s Amulet.name: Faithful’s Amulet
Faithful’s Amulet.description:
common (requires attunement) This amulet is made of sacred metals or garments proper to the wearer’s beliefs.
You can use your action to activate the amulet’s magic and roll a 1d4.
For the total of times until you finish a long rest, you can cast the cantrip based on the type of your amulet.
Crescent.
guidanceCross.
sacred flameCandle.
produce flameHammer.
shillelaghWarrior’s Rune.
shocking graspYin-Yang.
spare the dyingEldritch Sign.
eldritch blast

Faithful’s Prayer Beads.name: Faithful’s Prayer Beads
Faithful’s Prayer Beads.description:
common) There are different colors of these special prayer beads, which are all the way from India or produced in the Holy Lands themselves, and each of them has different qualities.
Turquoise.
While you have these beads on, the time you can hold your breath is doubled.
When you run out of breath, the beads give a bluish shimmer and you roll 1d6.
You don’t need to breathe for that many rounds.
This ability is refreshed at dawn.
Viridian.
While you have these beads on, you can cast the druidcraft cantrip.
Crimson.
While you have these beads around your fist and you make an attack roll, you can deal 1 fire damage instead of 1 bludgeoning damage.
Your damage from the Strength modifier is still bludgeoning.
If your unarmed attacks deal more damage than one, only 1 point of damage is counted as fire.
Ivory.
When you touch a creature that is dying, you can use your bonus action to grant them advantage on the next death saving throw.

Horsemaster’s Bow.name: Horsemaster’s Bow
Horsemaster’s Bow.description:
d (Bow), uncommon) A bow made in the steppes is said to be the most powerful bow there is.
While using this bow, your attacks count as magical for overcoming resistances against nonmagical damage.
In addition, when you have advantage on the attack roll, you roll 3 dice and take the highest.
If you roll 1 or 2 on the damage dice, it is counted as 3.

Judge’s Hammer.name: Judge’s Hammer
Judge’s Hammer.description:
) This small wooden hammer has 5 charges.
It can be struck against a surface or a wall to be activated.
When this happens, a zone of truth (2) or a command (1) spell is cast.
The DC for the spells is 13.
The hammer gains 1d4+1 charges at dawn.

Lantern Of Otherworldly Ward.name: Lantern Of Otherworldly Ward
Lantern Of Otherworldly Ward.description:
) This lantern is made from Damascus steel and has a very simple design.
It uses a very special oil made from a tree’s essence that can only be gathered in sacred places.
For each 10 minutes, an amount of oil that is worth 25 gd burns.
While burning with the special oil, the lantern grants 15 feet of bright light and an additional 15 feet of dim light.
Aberrations, celestials, fey, fiends, and undead must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw, or they can’t enter the area.
While in the area they take 1d4 psychic damage at the start of each of their turns.

Marvelous Sherbet.name: Marvelous Sherbet
Marvelous Sherbet.description:
common) This sherbet has more than sugar and water in it:A little bit of love and magic.
The sherbet’s subtle magic boosts your confidence as the sweet flavor brightens your day.
When consumed, it gives advantage on the next Charisma check.

Moon Potion.name: Moon Potion

The Med Cezir.name: The Med Cezir
The Med Cezir.description:
common The waves at the coasts caused by the moon are called Med Cezir in Persian.
This blue sapphire carries the ability of the waves and gives its user the power to manipulate bodies of water.
While holding the gem, you can choose a body of water that you can see within 15 ft.
and that fits within a 5-foot cube.
You can manipulate the water by one of the following ways: You move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction.
This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage.
You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate in your direction.
This change lasts for 10 minutes.
You freeze the water.
The body of water must not have any living creatures in it.
The water unfreezes in 10 minutes.

Pilgrim’s Traveler Robe.name: Pilgrim’s Traveler Robe
Pilgrim’s Traveler Robe.description: common) While wearing this robe you gain +1 bonus to your Wisdom checks and you are not affected by extreme weather conditions.

Priest’s Shoes.name: Priest’s Shoes
Priest’s Shoes.description: common) Leather-made shoes made for traveling hard roads allow you to double your jumping distance when you shout a deity’s or a religious figure’s name until the end of your next turn.

Pilgrim’s White Robe.name: Pilgrim’s White Robe
Pilgrim’s White Robe.description:
While attuned to this robe and wearing it, you gain +2 to your Armor Class and Wisdom checks, as well as resistance to a damage type of your choice: cold or fire.
You choose the resistance when you finish a long rest.

Rod Of The Seeker.name: Rod Of The Seeker
Rod Of The Seeker.description:
This rod is made from a dead oak tree, under the full moon by a shaman.
While attuned to it, you can cast the locate object and locate creature spells once a day (each) without expending a spell slot or you can reroll a spell attack roll instead of casting these spells.
This feature recharges at dawn.

Ring Of Djinn’s Voice.name: Ring Of Djinn’s Voice
Ring Of Djinn’s Voice.description:
While attuned to this item, you can turn the jewel on the ring to activate it and enchant your voice.
You gain advantage on Deception and Intimidation checks for 1 minute.

Scheherazade’s Mirror.name: Scheherazade’s Mirror

Shahryar’s Crown.name: Shahryar’s Crown
Shahryar’s Crown.description:
This crown is made of gold, but it always looks rusty and very ancient.
While attuned to the item, the wearer’s Charisma score becomes 19 if it isn’t higher already, and they can cast each of the following spells without expending a spell slot: command, hold person, fear, hold monster, dominate person.

Shroud Of Sihr-i Azam.name: Shroud Of Sihr-i Azam
Shroud Of Sihr-i Azam.description:
requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock or wizard While wearing this shroud, you gain the following benefits: When you expend your last spell slot, you regain four 1st level spell slots, two 2nd level spell slots, or one 3rd level spell slot.
This ability works once per dawn.
While not wearing armor or carrying a shield, your Armor Class becomes 12 + your spellcasting ability modifier.
When you fail a saving throw against a spell or a magical effect, you can expend a spell slot and reroll the saving throw.
You must use the second roll.

Shroud Of Sihr-i Nadir.name: Shroud Of Sihr-i Nadir
Shroud Of Sihr-i Nadir.description:
requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock or wizard While wearing this shroud, you gain the following benefits: After rolling for Initiative, you gain 2d4+8 temporary hit points.
When you expend your last spell slot, you regain two 1st level spell slots or one 2nd level spell slot.
This ability works once per dawn.
While not wearing armor or carrying a shield, you have +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

Sundial Of Alexandria.name: Sundial Of Alexandria
Sundial Of Alexandria.description:
This sundial is made of a rare metal that was salvaged from a meteor and it is sensitive to sunlight.
While held, it gives the these abilities: You can cast the daylight spell once a day without expending a spell slot.
Once you do so you can’t cast it again this way until you finish a long rest.
You gain darkvision of 30 ft.
If you have darkvision from other sources, this expands your vision and you can’t be blinded.
You can force a creature within 30 ft.
of you that can see the sundial to make a Constitution saving throw (spell save DC 15).
On a failed save the creature is blinded for 1 minute.
It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

Water Diviner.name: Water Diviner
Water Diviner.description:
common) A carved wood in the shape of a stick with tribal runes on it.
The runes symbolizes flow, waves and the tides of blessed seas and vast oceans, enchanted to find water.
It can be activated with a command word.
When active, it vibrates subtly and points towards the nearest water source within 10 miles.

Holy Grail.name: Holy Grail
Holy Grail.description:
A grail made of clay that seems ordinary but has wonders hidden in it. For regular eyes, it is just a simple example of daily pottery, but heroes, saints, anointed knights, priests, or even an apostle’s hands were on this.

Any liquid poured in the grail gains the abilities of a flask of holy water or a healing potion (user’s choice). Only those of good alignment can use the holy grail. Creatures with neutral or evil alignments that touch the grail take 35 (10d6) psychic damage.

Necklace of Binding.name: Necklace of Binding
Necklace of Binding.description:
The necklace has African totems and weavings made out of bone, wood, and straw. The totems symbolize the unity of air, clouds, and the hearth of the tribe.

It has three tiny skulls. They represent the bound elementals of the necklace. Using an action, you can target an elemental with a CR equal to or below 5 within 60 ft. of you that you can see. The elemental must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it is trapped within one of the skulls. You can have three elementals trapped in the skulls like this.

Once trapped, an elemental remains in the necklace until released. An elemental trapped in the necklace doesn’t need to breathe, eat, or drink and doesn’t age.

You can use an action to touch the necklace’s skulls and release the elemental it contains. The creature is friendly to you and your companions for 1 hour and obeys your commands for that duration. If you give no commands or give it a command that is likely to result in its death, it defends itself but otherwise takes no actions. At the end of the duration, the creature acts in accordance with its normal disposition and alignment.

An identify spell reveals that a creature is inside the necklace, but the only way to determine the type of creature is to activate the skull. A newly discovered necklace might already contain a creature/creatures chosen by the GM.

The Hallowed Prayer Sheet.name: The Hallowed Prayer Sheet
The Hallowed Prayer Sheet.description:
It is a trinket touched by magic and when read by a believer shortens the long rest by 1 hour, as it soothes the heart and soul.

Variants:

The uncommon version of this prayer sheet reduces long rest by 2 hours and the reader wakes up with temporary hit points equal to their Wisdom modifier.

The rare version of this prayer sheet reduces long rest by 3 hours and the reader gains this ability: “Whenever you finish a short rest, you restore extra hit points equal to 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier.”

The very rare version of this prayer sheet gives the reader the ability to take the benefits of a long rest when it finishes a short rest. However, it must spend at least 48 hours in a place counted sacred by the believers to be used again after 3 short rests.

A prayer sheet’s rarity can be upgraded by the constant usage by a believer in a sacred place touched with the hallow spell for a year. A regular sheet that contains a prayer from a holy text and written by believers may gain magical properties after the sheet spends at least one year in a holy place and if used by believers every day. A church may contain this item with a chance of 10%. (A GM may roll a d100 when the adventurers walk into a church.)

The Stone of Sphinx.name: The Stone of Sphinx
The Stone of Sphinx.description:
Originally there were many of these stones during the ancient times of Egypt. Sphinx would bless some soldiers with this stone, and they would fight with gracious glory in battles in the name of Pharaohs. Any stone can give the same effect, as long as the sphinx breathes on it.

While held, the stone gives these benefits for 1 day:

Increases Strength score to 23 if it’s not higher already.

The user can cast each of the invisibility, heroism and expeditious retreat spells once per day. This ability recharges at dawn.

If the user dies, it turns into an Animal of Set.

Once a day passes, the same creature can’t benefit from the stone for a week.

Curse: This item is cursed. Anyone holding it for more than 1 minute must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw each hour. On a failed save, the creature is cursed and driven to madness. The cursed creature acts weirder than usual and gains overconfidence due to its newfound strength. After spending at least 6 hours with the stone the madness conditions the target to find the Well of Ikaros located near Memphis, where Magus Jambres Sneferu lies dead. The creature lets itself fall to the well to its eventual death. The creature is magically drawn to its place and knows what direction the well lies.

After each long rest passes without reaching the Well, the saving throw is repeated. Each failed save gives 1 Level of Corruption.

Sense the Sinner.name: Sense the Sinner
Sense the Sinner.description:
Choose a creature within 30 ft. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you learn about its past sinful actions. The GM will decide what a sin entails depending on your character’s own beliefs. You learn the sins as a vision where you see through the eyes of the sinner. The most recent sin is the most vivid one; however, as you delve deeper, the visions will get hazy, requiring a further casting of the spell. The creature is not aware of the spell the first time.

If you cast this spell on the same creature again, you can probe deep into the older sins. The creature will realize someone has reached into their minds with magic in the second casting of the spell. On the third time, they will know who is probing into their minds, but you will be able to choose a direct sin from the creature’s mind (You can ask questions, like “What is your biggest sin?” “What is the sin you regret the most?” “What does your heart yearn for that you regret the most?” and similar questions.).

results.1-1: Stutter: The caster stutters for the next 3d6 hours. Disadvantage on spell attack rolls for the duration (Spells with verbal component).
results.2-2: Bodily Dysfunction: The caster suffers a malevolent effect that badly affects the body. For example, if the leg is affected, the caster may suffer a limp and thus have his walking speed reduced to half. It lasts for 3d4 days.
results.3-3: Rot: Vegetables and plants within 120 ft. of the caster wither and die. It lasts 2d6 days.
results.4-4: Pale Skin: The caster appears sickly and extremely pale. It lasts 2d6 days.
results.5-5: Glow in the Dark: The caster’s eyes or other limbs (for example, their hand) glow in total darkness. It lasts for 3d4 days.
results.6-6: Scar: The caster receives a scar determined by the GM. It can’t be removed.
results.7-7: Wild Despise: The wild seems to despise the caster. Wild beasts are aggressive towards them, and urban animals are terrified of them. Dogs and cats alike usually hiss and growl at the caster.
results.8-8: Shaking Hands: The caster’s hands start to shake, and it constantly gets worse. The caster has disadvantage on Dexterity or Strength check that is related to the hands. It lasts for 2d4 days.
results.9-9: Constant Cold:The caster constantly feels cold and appears to be shivering.
results.10-10: Reflection Mishap: The caster’s reflection in proper surfaces may occur differently, such as facing in the wrong direction, doing something else entirely: crying, appearing angry, or appearing extremely happy. These mishaps usually happen briefly, for mere seconds, and disappear. These effects can be seen for 2d8 days.

results.1-1: Hellfire: The flames erupt from you as if you are bringing the fire itself from the depths of Tartarus. Any object that is flammable catches fire within 120 ft. of the caster. Each creature within 120 ft. must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 5d6 fire damage. Each proficiency bonus after +2 adds another 2d6 fire damage.
results.2-2: Quake: The ground shakes. Each creature within 300 ft. must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. For the next minute the shake continues and standing up requires another Dexterity saving throw. Each fail results in 1d6 bludgeoning damage. Each proficiency bonus after +2 deals another 2d6 damage.
results.3-3: Blinding Light: A bright light erupts from the caster. Each creature within 120 ft. of the caster must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded. At the end of each day, the affected creatures can make another saving throw to be free from the effect.
results.4-4: Deafening Sound: A horrible scream, a crash of thunder, or another loud noise is heard within 300 ft. of the caster. Each creature within the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be deafened. At the end of each day, the affected creatures can make another saving throw to be free from the effect.
results.5-5: Poison Aura: A foul stench overwhelms you. Each creature within 60 ft. of the caster must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for the next 4d6 hours, and they take 3d6 poison damage (damage occurs only once). Each proficiency bonus after +2 deals another 2d6 damage. The stench stays in the area for the next 2d4 hours. Each creature that enters the area or starts its turn there must make the saving throw.
results.6-6: Smell of Mortem: A feeling of dread and the impending doom of time surrounds the area. Each creature within 120 ft. of the caster must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or age 1d6 x 5 years. The magical aura stays there for 24 hours. Each creature that enters the area or starts its turn there must make the saving throw.
results.7-7: March of the Dead: A loud heartbeat fills the caster’s mind and creates an aura within 300 ft. of it. Dead creatures within the aura become undead creatures proper to their state and body. The creatures in the aura take 1d6 necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns or when they enter the first time; the undead are immune to this. The undead created by this aura are relentless and attack everyone on sight. If no creature has become undead, a blast within the area deals each creature 2d6 necrotic damage.
results.8-8: Thunderous Hands: A flash of lightning erupts from the caster. Each creature within 120 ft. of the caster must succeed on DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 lightning damage. The creatures that have failed take extra 1d6 lightning damage whenever they touch a metal object. This effect lasts for 2d4 days.
results.9-9: Enduring Cold: The reign of foretold winter in the ancient myths comes to life within 120 ft. of the caster. Each creature within range must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 cold damage, or half of it on a successful save. Each proficiency bonus after +2 adds another 2d6 cold damage. The cold aura persists after the first blast. If a creature enters the aura for the first time or starts its turn there, it takes 1d6 cold damage.
results.10-10: Aura of Nightmare: A voice from the apocalypse reaches out from the depths with a vision of terror. Each creature within 120 ft. of the caster must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they see random visions and hallucinations. In addition, whenever they attempt a long rest, they must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they can’t benefit from a long rest, as their sleep is haunted by terrible nightmares.

results.1-1: One of the prominent warriors (a Crusader Veteran named Alfonso) has actually made a pact with a creature from Al-Ghaib ( a devil like Chain Devilj or a demon like Glabrezuj) and wants to plant some “evidence” against the commanding officers by accusing them of adultery or a similar huge crime.
results.2-2: Four Crusader Knights are openly seeking hostility with the Knights Hospitaller, and they will initiate a conflict on a given chance.
results.3-3: A Crusader Priest has been converted to Islam and is leaking information to Saladin. He believes Saladin is the messiah that returned, and the true way is Islam.
results.4-4: A Crusader Infantry has a feud with the officers and will eventually try to poison him.
results.5-5: A Crusader Knight fails to distribute the donations fairly among the company of his 3 fellow Crusader Infantry, causing annoyance among them.
results.6-6: A Crusader Infantry is in love with a Muslim woman, while the rest of his band is unaware of this relationship. It will create a dispute amongst them if or when they find out.

results.1-1: The caster has disadvantage on saving throws for the next 1d6 hours.
results.2-2: The caster gains two levels of exhaustion.
results.3-3: The caster can’t cast a spell for the next 3d6 hours. This includes cantrips and features like divine smite.
results.4-4: The caster can’t gain any benefit from a short or long rest for the next 1d6 days.
results.5-5: The caster’s spell save DC is reduced by 1d4 for the next 24 hours.
results.6-6: The caster has a short term memory loss. It lasts for 4d6 hours.
results.7-7: The caster loses the ability to move one of their limbs.
results.8-8: The caster loses the ability to see or to hear for the next 24 hours.
results.9-9: The caster’s maximum HP is reduced by 1d6. Each proficiency bonus after +2 reduces it for another 3d6. For example, a creature with +4 proficiency loses 7d6 maximum HP.
results.10-10: The caster is driven mad in a way determined by the GM.

results.1-1: Unbeknownst to you, your significant other has been working for the enemy.
results.2-2: After a horrible accident, you were stripped of your rank in the army.
results.3-3: You embarked on a lengthy journey, and upon your return, your family was nowhere to be found.
results.4-4: You fell deeply in love, only to discover that they were a ghost.
results.5-5: You have been followed by the same crow throughout your entire life. It appears to desire something specific from you, but it is unable to communicate (the speak with animals spell reveals that the crow is speaking in Ancient Egyptian).
results.6-6: You have never experienced a single dream throughout your entire life. Suddenly, you find yourself within a dream, and a voice is calling you to come and find them.
results.7-7: You have witnessed a horrifying murder, yet the victim returned to your village the following day with a sinister grin on their face.
results.8-8: Throughout your entire life, you have been catching glimpses of a veiled figure just at the corner of your eyes, a presence that no one else seems to perceive. Since “it” happened the figure has disappeared.
results.9-9: One day, you woke up in a different body and found yourself in an unfamiliar place where no one recognized you, not even yourself.
results.10-10: You made the foolish decision to deceive one of the most influential businessmen in your region and have been in hiding ever since.
results.11-11: You discovered an incredibly valuable gem, yet you are the sole individual able to perceive it.
results.12-12: You stumbled upon a buried parchment that purportedly holds the world's secrets, but it's written in a language that no one seems to recognize.
results.13-13: You found yourself burdened with an incredibly heavy debt to a warlord, leading to the kidnapping of your family for ransom.
results.14-14: Someone has stolen your beloved dog, and you are now on a quest for revenge.
results.15-15: A con artist made a promise to double your entire sum of money if you entrusted it to them. However, they lost it all, resulting in your family disowning you.
results.16-16: Just before your mentor's passing, they disclosed the existence of a substantial hidden treasure that could guarantee wealth for generations in your lineage. Unfortunately, they forgot to specify the exact location before their demise, leaving you with the knowledge that it's somewhere in the vicinity of Jerusalem.
results.17-17: Your community holds the belief that you were the chosen child destined to bring them greatness. However, you actually switched places with your twin sibling, who was the true chosen one. As the pressure from the community continues to mount, you are compelled to locate your twin, who was sent to live with your aunt many years ago.
results.18-18: Unbeknownst to you, a fairy has fallen in love with you. You can't fathom why you're incredibly fortunate in every facet of your life except for matters of the heart.
results.19-19: Throughout your life, you've received telepathic messages from an unknown source. While you've been able to witness what they see, pinpointing their location has been an enigma. Until now.
results.20-20: You formed a close friendship with a mimic whose sole delight is to listen to stories. Resembling a mirror in shape, you carry this mimic with you. In return for sharing captivating tales, the mimic vowed to safeguard you, and this unique bond thrives as long as you continue to feed it with engaging narratives.
results.21-21: You find yourself recalling memories that don't belong to you – these are remnants from your previous life when you possessed great power.
results.22-22: One day, a door materialized within your house, a door that had not previously existed. Despite your persistent attempts, it remained resolutely sealed. Curiously, intricate carvings adorned its surface, guiding your attention to a mosque in Cairo. It became evident that this mosque might hold the key to unlocking the door's secrets.
results.23-23: As the offspring of one of the most prominent families in your hometown, you are entangled in a longstanding vendetta between your family and another. In a bid to preserve a fragile peace, you were designated as a sacrificial pawn. However, you managed to elude this grim fate and escape.
results.24-24: After a ritual gone wrong, you are now stuck with a completely useless and incredibly annoying demon by your side, who steadfastly refuses to assist you in any manner. However, they prove to be an exceedingly intriguing character.
results.25-25: Having struck a life-saving agreement with a dragon, you are now obligated to periodically locate new lairs for them, lest the dragon follow through on their promise to consume you in a most gruesome manner.
results.26-26: You repeatedly encounter individuals who bear an uncanny resemblance to you, yet the moment your eyes meet, they hastily flee. Despite your efforts, you have never managed to catch up to any of them.
results.27-27: Abducted as a child for ransom, your family's apparent indifference led your captor to raise you as a fellow criminal. In an unexpected turn, they proved to be the best parental figure you could have hoped for.
results.28-28: A curse cast upon you by a fairy has had an unexpected outcome. Instead of rendering you unlovable, it has made everyone perceive you as incredibly adorable, increasing your Charisma score to 17, if it isn’t higher already.
results.29-29: Your reflection has gained sentience, representing the most exasperating aspects of your personality. As a result, you actively evade mirrors and any reflective surfaces.
results.30-30: Each time you drift into slumber, your mind immerses itself in incredibly lifelike dreams that unfold as if they were reality. Unknown to you, you are astral projecting during these moments, yet your abilities remain beyond your control. You had never realized this until you saw a familiar face.
results.31-31: For a significant duration, you served as the right-hand person to a satrap. However, your position was terminated after you delivered an incorrect message that jeopardized their identity. Consequently, your memories were erased, and you were left to navigate your path independently. Nevertheless, intermittent flashes of your former life manage to resurface in your consciousness.
results.32-32: One fateful day, you awoke from a profound slumber to find a knife clenched in your hands and your entire family brutally slaughtered. As you hurriedly stepped outside in a state of panic, the horrifying reality became apparent: your entire village had been mercilessly slaughtered. Since that harrowing moment, you've been in a constant state of evasion, fleeing from the law.
results.33-33: You had been employed by an amoral mercenary leader for years. Your employer saw no problems in slaying children, burning villages, or torturing ordinary people. When you were already fed up with him, he learned that he was not supposed to push your buttons the hard way. Now that you have killed their leader, the whole mercenary gang is trying to hunt you down.’’
results.34-34: Having undergone rigorous training among the Hashashins, you stood on the brink of receiving your inaugural assignment. Yet, fate intervened when you overheard your supervisor unveiling the true character of the individual you were meant to assassinate. That very night, you made your escape, vowing never to return to that path.
results.35-35: Your master endeavored to ensnare a djinni within a bottle, similar to Aladdin's tale, yet the magic misfired, incarcerating you within the vessel instead. Accompanying your master, you embarked on a global quest to unearth a means of liberation. Only upon his demise did you finally escape the confines of the bottle, reemerging in Cairo.
results.36-36: Once a soldier within the Saladin’s naval fleet, you found yourself in the throes of a tumultuous night of revelry. As morning broke, you awoke to discover that your ship had set sail without you, leaving you stranded in an unfamiliar land. Bereft of any means to return home, you now faced the daunting task of navigating this foreign territory.
results.37-37: Raised within the opulent confines of Jerusalem's palace as a member of the aristocracy, your life took a grievous turn several years back. Due to a mere rumor, your father and your entire family were exiled from the palace, forcing you to relinquish your privileged status. Since then, you've been navigating the unfamiliar realm of the common folk, endeavoring to find your place in this new world.
results.38-38: Your heart stopped when you were a child, leading to your death and subsequent rebirth. Ever since then, you have possessed the ability to see people who remain unseen by others.
results.39-39: You nursed an injured stray puppy back to health. From that day on, you have gained a loyal friend who was there for you in all your adventures.
results.40-40: When you were a teen, you were kidnapped by an entity of draconic origin and set aside to be food later on. However, upon seeing your birthmark, the creature let you go. Ever since, you have wondered what was so special about your birthmark that you were spared that day.
results.41-41: Your mother was a beloved witch and healer of your village. When witch hunters killed her, you vowed revenge.
results.42-42: You were experimented on by a group of scholars in the House of Wisdom. They kidnapped you and subjected you to torturous experiments, resulting in serious trauma and the acquisition of arcane powers.
results.43-43: Every year, one person from your village goes missing for a few days and returns with a changed appearance, sporting a completely different face and character. They resume their daily routines as if nothing has happened. No one but you seems to notice these changes. You didn't pay much attention to this phenomenon until your sister came back with a new face.
results.44-44: One day, you are stopped by a strange old person. Tears are streaming down their face, and they keep telling you how much they love you. No matter how many times you ignore them or try to get rid of them, they keep finding you. They tell you that you haven’t met them yet, but when you do, you’ll fall in love, too.
results.45-45: After winning a bet against a warlock, out of anger from losing, he told you that you have been cursed to die by the hand of a horse. You have been avoiding horses ever since.
results.46-46: While living in Cairo, you were digging into the ground to build a strong foundation for your new house. However, the area you were excavating turned out to be the grave of an Egyptian general. As a result, their soul became bound to you, and they now accompany you wherever you go. Only you have the ability to see him, and he is quite a stubborn individual.
results.47-47: You served as the food tester for the king. One day, while you were completely unaffected, the king suddenly died. It was later revealed that the king had been allergic to a spice that you were not allergic to. Despite your innocence, you were blamed for the incident and narrowly escaped being executed by beheading.
results.48-48: You were abducted by a cult with the intention of being sacrificed. Just moments before they could carry out the act, an invisible power intervened and mercilessly wiped out the entire cult. Miraculously, you emerged as the sole survivor of that fateful day. However, the remaining members of the cult, those who did not attend that particular ritual, hold you responsible for the devastation, and now they are relentlessly hunting you down.
results.49-49: For centuries, tales have circulated about a family heirloom prophesied to bestow wealth and power upon the entire lineage, should it ever be found. This legendary artifact is said to be housed within the Old Temple. Despite being dismissed as mere bedtime stories for generations, you made the daring decision to embark on a quest to locate it. Regrettably, the inner chambers of the temple are heavily guarded by the knights of Guy de Lesignon.
results.50-50: Throughout your entire life, you’ve kept seeing the spirit of a Hashashin everywhere you go. It was somewhat easy to ignore him until the day he finally spoke to you.
results.51-51: Having managed to escape from an emir’s harem, you find yourself on the run, evading pursuit. Though your time within the harem was brief, you did receive some training, granting you a degree of arcane knowledge that could prove invaluable in your current circumstances.
results.52-52: Operating covertly as a monster hunter, you maintain the façade of a lumberjack in your official role. However, individuals who are aware of your true nature engage your services to safeguard against these creatures.
results.53-53: Upon the passing of your parents, you stumbled upon a letter hidden within your home. To your astonishment, the letter unveils a long-held secret: you were abducted as a child and raised under false pretenses by your parents. The letter repeatedly alludes to your father's immense power, tempered by a lurking danger. However, it withholds the true identity of your father, leaving you with a cryptic trail of clues to decipher. Determined to unveil the truth, you embark on a mission to follow the hints provided in the letter and finally uncover your father's identity.
results.54-54: For years, your sister persistently claimed to be the wife of Saladin. Her assertions, however, were met with disbelief, and many considered her to be delusional. Despite her pleas falling on deaf ears, one fateful night, a contingent of soldiers arrived and forcibly took her away. You have been looking for her ever since.
results.55-55: Your father held a distinguished position as a prominent knight within Baldwin's court, aligning himself with Tiberius' faction. His life was tragically cut short by a mysterious and unsolved murder, leaving his killer's identity concealed. In the course of your journey, you discovered his cherished dagger among his belongings. Strangely, from the moment you took hold of the dagger, an extraordinary connection was forged – enabling you to perceive your father's presence. Through this ethereal link, he shared the identity of his murderer and his unquenchable thirst for retribution.
results.56-56: (If the PC is older than 40 years old) The love of your life, an unforgettable figure who left an indelible mark on your heart, was a summer romance that blossomed during your youthful years. This person embodied all your desires and dreams. Yet, inexplicably, they vanished from your life without a single trace. However, recent events have taken an astonishing turn. A wandering painter happened upon your village not long ago, their canvases displaying a range of scenes. To your astonishment, one of these paintings depicted your long-lost love, frozen in time, bearing no signs of aging. This artwork was crafted merely months ago in the city of Jerusalem.
results.57-57: You have discovered a map that displays the locations of treasures. Every time you unearth a treasure, a new marking appears on the map. You've been diligently following the map to discover treasure chests and jewelry, which you intend to sell to sustain yourself. This marks the first instance where the marking, situated atop Jerusalem, is twice as large as the previous ones.
results.58-58: You had served as the palace entertainer for many years. However, you were sold to another king and were in transit to your new destination. Tragically, during the journey, your chaperone suffered a heart attack and passed away. As a result, you find yourself stranded in an unfamiliar land.
results.59-59: You were raised by a single mother on the outskirts of a small village. The house you moved into had been abandoned for some time due to its haunted reputation. However, your mother didn't mind, and neither did you, because the ghosts residing in the house became your closest friends and essentially raised you. You made a promise to these spirits that you would find a way to bring them back to life. This promise became your life's purpose.
results.60-60: You have carved out a livelihood by studying the stars and unraveling their hidden meanings. The constellations and their arrangements serve as your guide to foreseeing what lies ahead. Individuals from around the globe seek your insights to gain a glimpse into their future. One fateful day, you received a summons from a princess.
results.61-61: Throughout your life, you held onto an imaginary friend. Even as you matured, this companionship remained unbroken. As time advanced and your features became more defined, you gradually noticed an uncanny resemblance between your imaginary friend and an older iteration of yourself.
results.62-62: You have discovered a thick notebook among the belongings of your late father. It had belonged to your grandfather, who was evidently an adventurer, and these are the logs of his escapades. Within its pages, a few unfinished quests remain, which could possibly be undertaken even today.
results.63-63: Abducted and raised by a healer warlock in the heart of a forest, you were released to forge your own path upon reaching adulthood. As years flowed by, a startling realization settled in – the whereabouts of the warlock who had raised you had slipped from your memory entirely. The knowledge of your true parents remained a mystery, and the yearning to unearth your origins intensified.
results.64-64: Once a prosperous caravan master, wealth flowed through your veins. However, a harsh period of relentless security breaches and a chilling assassination attempt shattered your world. Faced with no recourse, you made the daring choice to orchestrate your own demise and slip into the shadows of hiding. Now, consumed by the need for answers, you are determined to unveil the hands that stole your life from you.
results.65-65: You have found an old book. It seems that someone has written a long novel about the protagonist’s life story. The first few chapters eerily resemble your life. In the fifth chapter, it exactly matches your life. As the story moves along, the character sets out on a long journey that changes their life.
results.66-66: You are a priest or an imam, and you have been assigned to a new church in the unfamiliar land of Jerusalem.
results.67-67: Among the belongings of your late mother, you have found a worn-down pile of letters. They were written by your father, whom you have never met. It seems as though he had been sending funds to your mother for your care and inquiring about your life. You notice that the letters have been signed by a knight. Filled with curiosity, you decide to find him, hoping that you might inherit his knighthood when he passes.
results.68-68: You had been an emir who dared to offend a shah. Prior to your execution, an old friend orchestrated your escape. Now, you are wanted by the palace and find yourself on the run.
results.69-69: Raised in a cult your entire life, you were devoted to its beliefs. One night, you were abruptly awakened by whispers outside your door. Inexperienced cult members had been assigned to capture you for an upcoming ritual sacrifice. Their panic was evident. Seizing the opportunity presented by their incompetence, you managed to escape. However, you remain uncertain whether the cult is still actively searching for you or not.
results.70-70: You were an incredibly talented calligrapher. One day, you received a special pen as a gift and were instructed to use it only on special occasions. Upon using the pen, you realized that it possessed arcane powers. The things you wrote with the pen had a tendency to come true, although the effects were limited to minor things. Just as you were becoming adept at using the pen and achieving more significant miracles, it was stolen from you. The only distinctive detail you could recall about the thief was their bright red hair. Now, your sole aspiration in life is to recover your stolen pen.
results.71-71: You have spent years working as a guide for caravans. As your master's retirement approaches, you are poised to take over the business. However, there is another candidate vying for the same position. Both of you have been striving to maintain a favorable relationship with your master and seize any available business opportunities. The most recent assignment involved leading a caravan to Jerusalem. Surprisingly, your rival allowed you to take charge of this task without any dispute.
results.72-72: Due to your frequent work-related travels, you found yourself forming separate families in three different cities. On a particular day, as you were about to enter one of your homes, a chilling sight met your eyes: all three of your partners stood there, their gazes filled with vengeance.
results.73-73: Having been betrayed by your closest friend, you've been consumed by a desire for revenge. You've been on a quest to settle the score for a while now. The most recent information places them in Jerusalem.
results.74-74: As a highly skilled painter specializing in religious murals, you have received a prestigious commission. Your task involves creating a mural for a church located in Jerusalem.
results.75-75: From a young age, you have been deeply immersed in the teachings of Sufism. Integrating music into your prayers, you've skillfully played the oud and earned a revered place among your community's musicians. However, as time passed, you felt a calling to visit the sacred religious sites that hold profound significance to you. This inner urging led you to embark on a meaningful journey.
results.76-76: In the lands that ruled by the Seljuk Empire, you served as an alchemist in a manor, spending years trying to uncover the mysteries of the universe for patrons whose values clashed with your own. Having had enough, you orchestrated your escape and are, finally, free.
results.77-77: You were a well-established priest. One day, a person came to your church for confession, wearing a mask. They began talking about their life and started coming for confession every week. However, you never knew who they were. As they spoke, you found yourself falling deeply in love with them. One day, during a confession, they revealed that they would be moving to Jerusalem and that this would be the last time you would see them. Unable to banish them from your thoughts, you are determined to uncover their true identity.
results.78-78: You had a happy home with your partner and child. It was a peaceful sanctuary until that fateful day when individuals from the palace arrived and abducted your child. Your partner was slain as they attempted to intervene. Now, all that consumes your thoughts is vengeance and the determination to locate your missing child.
results.79-79: For years, you have been striving to initiate a revolution, but unfortunately, nobody is willing to join your cause.
results.80-80: You have been the owner of a bookstore for years. The best part about your store is the fact that it is immensely haunted. However, all the ghosts that live there are truly intriguing scholars and writers who simply didn't want to depart from the world of literature.
