The Hallowed Prayer Sheet

Wondrous item, common

It is a trinket touched by magic and when read by a believer shortens the long rest by 1 hour, as it soothes the heart and soul.

Variants:

  • The uncommon version of this prayer sheet reduces long rest by 2 hours and the reader wakes up with temporary hit points equal to their Wisdom modifier.
  • The rare version of this prayer sheet reduces long rest by 3 hours and the reader gains this ability: “Whenever you finish a short rest, you restore extra hit points equal to 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier.”
  • The very rare version of this prayer sheet gives the reader the ability to take the benefits of a long rest when it finishes a short rest. However, it must spend at least 48 hours in a place counted sacred by the believers to be used again after 3 short rests.

A prayer sheet’s rarity can be upgraded by the constant usage by a believer in a sacred place touched with the hallow spell for a year. A regular sheet that contains a prayer from a holy text and written by believers may gain magical properties after the sheet spends at least one year in a holy place and if used by believers every day. A church may contain this item with a chance of 10%. (A GM may roll a d100 when the adventurers walk into a church.)

Fountain of the Blessed (Uncommon):he water in this fountain is believed to be holy water. In the mechanical perspective of 5th edition, it is not. However, it contains some magical power. Believers that use some of the water according to their beliefs (such as crossing oneself), gain temporary hit points equal to their Wisdom modifier.

Wooden Cross (Common): These wooden crosses are made by believers on harsh days under the scorching sun. Wearers of the cross have +1 bonus to their Wisdom checks, Religion checks and Wisdom saving throws.

Thurible of the Priest (Uncommon):hese metal censers burn the incense and fill the air with relaxing and blessing fumes. It stays active for 1 minute and each creature within 30 ft. of the item gains resistance to poison damage and receives +1d4 bonus to Constitution saving throws for 1 hour. After the time is up, it must be refilled with materials worth 5 gd.

Crimson Mitre (Common):Worn by bishops and important religious figures, crimson mitre is adorned with precious gems and touched by subtle magic. While wearing it, you have +1 bonus to Charisma checks.

Candle of the Church (Common): Made by devoted sisters and brothers of the Christian churches, these candles possess a magical nature. While they are lit, the creatures in its light restore 1d4 more hit points when they finish a short or long rest.

Wilfred’s Eatery.name: Wilfred’s Eatery
Wilfred’s Eatery.text:
Wilfred’s Eatery

The first thing that greets you at Wilfred’s Eatery is the thick smoke hanging in the tavern’s air, as if it owns the place. It almost seems to. The second thing you notice is an aura of anger. It oozes from the pores of every patron seated in their half-rotten, old chairs. Even beneath the smiles on the faces of the drunkards, there lurks a sort of misery, something almost every city resident can relate to but hates to discuss. The anger towards their lives and current circumstances ricochets from patron to patron like a charged lightning bolt.

Then you notice two curious eyes that began watching you the moment you stepped in. Behind the broken-down bar, where a couple of men rest their heads trying to stave off the effects of the ale in their veins, are the bright eyes of Wilfred. Perhaps he looks at you with the excitement of welcoming new customers, or maybe it’s something more. Those eyes are difficult to read, but you sense there’s a story there. With a casual gesture, he signals the waiter to approach you. He shows you to a table, identical to the others, but just as he’s about to take your order, a large hand lands on his shoulder, stopping him mid-sentence. “I’ll handle this. You go take care of that table that’s been waiting for a while.” It’s Wilfred.

Your gaze follows the waiter as he escorts a group to what seems like a back room, receiving a handsome payment under his cloak. No one appears to care about this mysterious room or the large group heading there. Everyone is too engrossed in drowning their sorrows.

The locals are regular patrons of Wilfred’s Eatery, which occupies a sizable space in a somewhat dubious part of the city. It thrives as a hub for underground activities, attracting those engaged in less conventional business ventures. Beneath the tavern, there are concealed tunnels that were once connected to the Temple Mount during its initial construction. Originally intended to function as a town hall, the tavern’s history has seen it go through periods of abandonment before being purchased by a family who transformed it into a recreational establishment where townsfolk can unwind and release their tensions.

While the ancient tunnels have been blocked off for years, small chambers remain, serving as storage areas and discreet spaces for customers to conduct private activities or carry out business transactions. The tavern owner, Wilfred, is a half-orc who assumes the guise of a muscular man and commands respect with every step he takes. However, it is wise not to incur his displeasure, as he possesses a formidable presence and maintains a loyal community of non-human patrons of the tavern who stand ready to support him when needed.

Wilfred (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoner}j): The esteemed proprietor of this charming establishment. He possesses a unique heritage as a half-orc, seamlessly integrated with both the human and the non-human community. His parents hail from Nordic origins, and their union, an orcish father and a human mother led to their banishment from their respective societies. During a fortuitous encounter with a priest en route to Jerusalem, they decided to follow his guidance, embarking on a prolonged journey until they found solace among the non-human populace of Jerusalem. In this vibrant community, their beloved son Wilfred was born.

After enduring years of concealment, Wilfred grew weary of the destitute living conditions and adamantly refused to engage in a life of crime. With resolute determination, he decided to remove his tusks and obliterate any remnants of his orc lineage in his visage. Seizing the opportunity, he took over an elderly man’s abandoned dwelling and ingeniously transformed it into a tavern catering to the needs of those on the fringes of Jerusalem’s society. Although not situated in the most affluent parts of the city, Wilfred’s establishment rapidly gained popularity, and he, in turn, embraced a life of integrity and respectability amidst all the strata of the city.

Presently, the Eatery also acts as a crucial institution for the non-humans of Jerusalem, assisting them in conducting their enterprises in the human world and keeping their guises.

Gwyneth (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoner}j): Gwyneth, a kindred spirit to Wilfred, shares his half-orc heritage and serves as a valued waitress in his bustling tavern. Among her non-human community, she is affectionately known as Gwyneth. She adopted the name Gülfem when introducing herself to the human folk, crafting an identity with roots in Persian culture - surely as a stubborn act of defiance against the Crusaders of the city. Before joining forces with Wilfred, Gwyneth had a brief stint in the palace kitchen, where her culinary talents shone. It was during this time that fate led her down a serendipitous path, crossing ways with the amiable Princess Sybilla.

A strong bond soon formed between Gwyneth and Princess Sybilla, who grew genuinely fond of her. However, the prevailing societal norms and biases surrounding non-humans prevented the princess from keeping Gwyneth within the palace walls. Undeterred, Gwyneth emerged as an invaluable asset to Sybilla, taking on the role of a discreet informant for the palace. Her unparalleled knowledge of everyday life and the intricate political landscape among the locals made her an invaluable source of information for the princess.

Ilana (@UUID[Actor.nW8Aj5aNHyswBvNs]{Traveling Artist}): Ilana is exceptionally skilled with the lute and the lyre. Occasionally donning the title of the bard of this tavern, Ilana sings songs of sorrow and remembrance. With a lineage steeped in Celtic heritage mixed with elven blood, she embodies a captivating charm that draws many a gentleman to frequent the tavern, captivated by her songs and beauty. With a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check, players notice, she slightly lifts the scarf wrapped around her head just enough to make one ear naked to hear what she is playing when performing.

As a testament to her undeniable talent, Ilana is sought after by esteemed figures, including high-ranking officials, who request private shows to indulge in her artistry. Among her known patrons are the illustrious Guy de Lusignan and Raynald de Chatillon (check out The Sigil of Jerusalem’s Characters section for further information). Though the majority of the tavern’s regulars remain unaware of this privileged clientele, Ilana herself does not hold a great fondness for either of them. Nonetheless, she finds solace in the generous rewards these engagements bring. If players chat with Ilana, they can make a DC 13 Charisma (Persuasion) check to talk about Guy de Lusignan or Raynald de Chattilon; on a failed save Ilana, refuses the players, stating she can not share details about noble and powerful people. On a success, players are informed of Ilana’s opinion regarding them. She thinks Guy de Lusignan is much wiser than what his age shows and sometimes describes historical events as if he were there as they happened; Raynald de Chatillon, on the other hand, acts like a violent beast but is always very loyal to Guy.

Seraphine’s Threads and Trimmings.name: Seraphine’s Threads and Trimmings
Seraphine’s Threads and Trimmings.text:
Seraphine’s Threads and Trimmings

Seraphine’s Threads and Trimmings is impeccably organized, and every corner is adorned with an array of mannequins showcasing the most breathtaking outfits you’ve ever laid eyes on. From wall to wall, these striking ensembles catch the light and draw you further into the display.

As you venture towards the back of the shop, you find the owner engaged in conversation with a customer, who is describing the outfit he desires to be crafted. The owner herself possesses an ashy complexion, a result of the thick layer of white paint she has applied all over her skin. Her cheeks are artificially flushed with an unnatural red hue, and her eyes are expertly adorned with smoky black soot, extending elegantly into a winged shape. Two exquisite purple headwraps are stylishly wound over her hair, skillfully crafted to create the illusion of two elegantly cascading ponytails that gracefully extend all the way down to the floor. Despite her artistic appearance, she appears visibly frustrated.

“My love, wouldn’t you like to add some color to your ensemble? Just black, really? How dreadfully dull,” she remarks with a hint of disdain, as she hastily scribbles down the order. Once the man departs from the shop, she turns her attention to you with a warm greeting. “Oh, hello! Please tell me you’re here for something vibrant and colorful. Today, I’ve had three orders for black leather vests, and I must admit, it’s pushing me towards despair. I yearn for a touch of creativity and diversity in my creations.”

The town’s tailor, Seraphine (@UUID[Actor.1JK80RxGJvsa6UG4]{Artisan}), is a striking tiefling woman who possesses a unique sense of style and artistry. Adorned in vibrant fabrics and headwraps that combine her own pitch-black hair with colorful strands, she embraces her distinctive appearance with confidence. Her light green skin is disguised with the application of white ash and elaborate makeup, enhancing her already striking features. Many view her as an extravagant individual due to her distinct fashion choices.

Beyond her captivating appearance, the tailor possesses remarkable skill in her craft. She utilizes her innate magical abilities to weave enchantments into the very fabric she works with, allowing her to create extraordinary costumes that serve as effective disguises. Her expertise is particularly sought after by nonhuman clients, as she possesses an innate understanding of their unique needs and preferences.

In addition to her proficiency in costume design, the tailor is known for crafting durable armors specifically tailored for warriors. With her magical touch, she ensures that these armors not only provide reliable protection but also exhibit a touch of her artistic flair. Armors bought from this place grants +1 bonus to Charisma checks while wearing it, and noble folk who are unaware of nonhuman races are intrigued, as they don’t know who makes such fine garments.

The Cleaver.name: The Cleaver
The Cleaver.text:
The Cleaver

Inside the butcher shop, The Cleaver, several customers await their orders, and a woman emerges from the inner chamber carrying packages of freshly cut meat. With a warm smile, she efficiently serves the waiting patrons, wishing them a happy day. As her eyes meet yours, she greets you, recognizing you as unfamiliar faces in her usual clientele.

“Hello, strangers. Welcome. What can I offer you today?” she inquires, her friendly demeanor putting you at ease. However, she quickly adds, “Actually, let me check what we have left before I make any suggestions. We’ve had a busy few days, and our stock is running low until the next hunting expedition.”

With that, she heads back inside the inner chamber, where you catch a glimpse of four women diligently cutting up meat.

In the heart of the town, a butcher shop stands, adjoining a grand abode sheltering twelve enigmatic women. These ladies are often perceived as peculiar spinsters by the townsfolk. Yet a darker truth lurks beneath the surface. Unbeknownst to the residents, they form a clandestine coven of witches who devote their time to hunting the criminals that roam the streets of Jerusalem, using their nefarious acts as the source of their sustenance.

Any remnants from their mystical rituals are skillfully prepared and presented for sale in the modest shop that graces the front of their dwelling, open to the locals. Despite the doubts surrounding their lifestyle, the allure of their meat is irresistible, drawing scores of people to their doorstep. Little do the unsuspecting customers realize that the exquisite flavor they savor is a testament to the wicked origin of the ingredients. With a DC 13 Wisdom (Perception) check, players notice a glimpse of the room inside and see remains of humanoid body parts. If players eat any products of the place after body parts are seen, they must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 exhaustion level by throwing up.

Willa (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.CHEUjiYrVM9X0vIT]{Acolyte}j): Willa grew up as the daughter of a butcher. Her arcane powers revealed themselves during puberty, leaving her unsure of how to handle them. Consequently, Willa and her best friend, Faith, endeavored to keep this mysterious gift hidden from others. However, fate intervened when she crossed paths with Isabel, the High Priestess of her coven. Under Isabel’s guidance, Willa was taken under her wing and initiated into the coven, gaining invaluable knowledge and skills.

Tragedy struck when Willa’s father passed away, leaving her as the sole heir to the butcher shop and their home, given that she had no other relatives. With the support of her coven, Willa erected a substantial house adjacent to the butcher shop, and together, they assumed control of her father’s business. They used human flesh and blood to do their rituals, and they sold the leftover products in their butcher shop.

Isabel (Handmaiden of Jahij): Isabel, the High Priestess of her coven, possesses an ageless appearance, appearing to be around 40 despite her true age of about 200 years. Having grown up within a small coven, her ascent in the ranks was propelled by her innate arcane abilities.

However, as time passes, she senses her powers gradually waning, and she realizes that her tenure as the High Priestess is drawing to a close.

Feeling the weight of responsibility, Isabel searches for a worthy successor to take on the mantle of High Priestess. Two potential candidates have captured her attention: Willa and Arden. Willa’s compassionate nature and natural leadership qualities resonate with Isabel, while Arden’s immense power and prowess in the arcane arts make her a formidable contender.

Torn between these two promising individuals, Isabel finds herself in a difficult position. She understands that choosing the next High Priestess is a momentous decision that will shape the future of the coven.

Arden (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{Cult Fanatic}): Arden’s origins are rooted in a dark and mysterious past. She is the daughter of a tremendously powerful witch, and her mother’s demise came tragically when a potent spell rebounded upon her. In the aftermath of this loss, Isabel, the High Priestess, took Arden under her wing and raised her as her own. Arden rapidly exhibited an uncanny prowess in the arcane arts, effortlessly matching her mother’s formidable strength. The coven embraced her as an essential and valued member, unaware of the sinister forces that lay dormant within her.

Secretly, Arden harbored a malevolence that even Isabel sensed but couldn’t entirely control. Unbeknownst to the coven, Arden failed to inherit her mother’s powers. Instead, she struck an unholy alliance with the very demon her mother had fought to banish. As it turned out, it was Arden herself who had originally summoned the malevolent entity. Upon her mother’s demise, she forged a dark pact with the demon, binding herself to it in exchange for newfound abilities and strength.

Obsessed with gaining more power, Arden now seeks the position of High Priestess, driven by her insatiable thirst for dominion over the arcane.

Beloved’s Bounty.name: Beloved’s Bounty
Beloved’s Bounty.text:
Beloved’s Bounty

As you step into the overcrowded pawn shop, you are greeted by an impressive display of various items, each neatly arranged in their designated sections. Shimmering jewels, old coins, intricate daggers, and even clothing of exceptional value catch your eye. Despite the absence of anyone overseeing the shop, an inexplicable feeling in the pit of your stomach reminds you that taking anything without permission is simply not an option.

Curious about the deserted atmosphere, you notice a bell on the register and decide to ring it. The sound resonates through the shop, and moments later, hurried footsteps approach. A man in his late fifties emerges from behind, wearing an amiable expression on his face. “Oh, hello! I was just checking up on my wife; apologies for the brief delay. How can I assist you today?” he asks politely, ready to provide his help with any inquiries or purchases you may have in mind. The mysterious allure of the shop, combined with the proprietor’s friendly presence, creates an intriguing experience that leaves you eager to explore what hidden treasures this pawn shop might hold.

In the heart of Jerusalem, a pawn shop is overseen by Leofric (@UUID[Actor.ZNy2IXH6DjXJsE9k]{Traveling Merchant}), a man in his late fifties, bearing a melancholic tale. His life was intertwined with that of a woman he deeply loved, Esther (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoner}j), who was unlike anyone he had ever encountered. She possessed a unique spirit, exuding confidence, beauty, and strength. People marveled at her enchanting allure, but she remained resolute and declined numerous marriage proposals, leaving a trail of disappointed suitors in her wake. Until, one day, fate brought her and Leofric together, and their hearts intertwined in a love that was undeniable.

Yet lurking in the shadows was a warlock, a suitor spurned by her before her marriage. Consumed by jealousy and anger, he cast a wicked curse upon her, rendering her paralyzed from the neck down. Only if her husband could find an item that she would cherish with all her being, could the curse be lifted. Desperate to free his beloved from the malevolent enchantment, the pawn shop owner embarked on a tireless quest. After searching for a long time for such a miracle and returning empty-handed, he realized that opening a pawn shop might bring the solution to their doorstep. He named it Beloved’s Bounty. With a DC 14 Wisdom (Perception) check, players can understand that the clothing pawned are well made and are for non-human folk. If they have visited Seraphine’s Threads beforehand, they roll the check with advantage, on a success they know it is from the hands of Seraphine. Players who have lost their items or had them stolen inside the city can find them here if they have the lucky trait or succeed at a DC 13 Intelligence (Investigation) check.

On a successful DC 12 Intelligence (Arcana) check or players casting detect magic or detect poison and disease, they find out that Esther’s curse can only be inhibited with a piece of wood shaped like a heart and enchanted with Al-Jazari’s woodwork Totemic Ward. Even though it is not a definitive solution to the curse, Leofric thanks players immensely, stating they can get an item from the shop free of charge. Overjoyed by making his beloved free to move again, Leofric makes the heart fit onto a necklace for her to wear at all times.

Tender Hearth Bakery.name: Tender Hearth Bakery
Tender Hearth Bakery.text:
Tender Hearth Bakery

As you patiently wait in the long line at the Tender Hearth Bakery, you observe a heartwarming scene of a mother and daughter working together with remarkable efficiency. They seem to have perfected a harmonious dance: one takes freshly baked bread out of the oven, and the other deftly packs orders in cloth and places them into customers’ bags.

Your attention is drawn to a man who approaches the daughter, and their exchanged glances suggest a familiar understanding. She swiftly disappears inside the bakery and reappears with a package already prepared for him. It becomes evident that they have a special arrangement, and he pays for the services.

Finally, the line reaches you, and the daughter greets you with genuine enthusiasm, her warm smile inviting and comforting. “Hello! What can I prepare for you today?” she asks, eager to provide you with a delightful treat from their bakery. The aroma of freshly baked goods fills the air, and you can’t help but feel a sense of anticipation for the delectable offerings that await you.

The delightful bakery in town is a heartwarming family affair overseen by a devoted mother and her talented daughter. Together, they craft a wide array of delectable desserts, each one a labor of love. Their passion for baking goes beyond just offering scrumptious treats, as they have also established a unique tradition of exchanging sweets for recipes with visitors from various corners of the globe. This charming practice has turned their bakery into a cozy haven where one can always find a taste of home, no matter where they come from. Located in the lively marketplace adjacent to the Western Wall, the bakery has become a bustling hotspot, attracting a steady stream of eager customers.

Giselle (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoner}j) as the owner had spent her entire life as a skilled baker, just like her mother before her. She took great pride in her craft and even trained her own daughter Faith (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoner}j) to carry on the family tradition from an early age. When Faith became friends with Willa from the butcher shop Cleaver and delved into potion making and witchcraft, Giselle couldn’t help but notice the changes in her daughter’s behavior. She noticed how Faith would keep certain recipes hidden, selling them exclusively to select customers. However, unbeknownst to Giselle, Faith only sold these special treats to customers who were aware of their magical properties. After some delving through Faith’s personal items, her mom found some of the secret recipes and started using them to charm people into loving the bakery more without informing Faith. With a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check, players notice the bakery is loved with a great passion unlike any other workplace. If players eat anything baked here, they must succeed a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, players order once more and roll the saving throw again. Players investigating the food must succeed a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check to understand the baked goods are infused with magic and charm those consuming it. If they ate it before, the DC decreases by 2 for each order.

Vaha Al-Quds.name: Vaha Al-Quds
Vaha Al-Quds.text:
Vaha Al-Quds

Vaha Al-Quds makes one feel like they have entered home as they walk in. Visitors from all corners of the globe flock to this remarkable establishment, seeking solace and respite. At the entrance, the gracious innkeeper warmly presents keys to the newcomers, welcoming them with genuine hospitality. Some patrons patiently await the preparation of their rooms, while a group of men with damp hair strolls leisurely, having just indulged in the soothing hammam. A couple of eager customers inquire of the waiter about the status of their eagerly anticipated meals. And, in the midst of this bustling scene, a diligent busboy adeptly ascends the stairs, effortlessly carrying two weighty bags.

As you wander through the halls of the Vaha Al-Quds, your eyes are drawn to the splendor of the private suites, a true embodiment of luxury. Adorned with elegant furnishings and tasteful decor, these suites provide a haven of tranquility for 2-3 individuals. Beyond the cozy sleeping quarters, a grand lounge area beckons, a realm of exclusivity where intimate business meetings take place amidst an ambiance of sophistication.

Continuing your exploration, you encounter the charming rooms designed to accommodate a larger party of 3-4 people. Here, a warm and inviting atmosphere embraces you, ensuring a restful night’s slumber after a day of adventure and exploration in the bustling city.

As you ascend to the uppermost floors, a unique and communal experience awaits. The innovative bunk bed rooms reveal a delightful camaraderie, where up to 8 individuals share a living space.

Surprisingly, this inclusive environment extends its arms to embrace non-human guests as well: in the lower levels of the establishment, you can find a few of each category of rooms thoughtfully tailored to accommodate their needs.

The Muslim community visiting Jerusalem stays at Vaha Al-Quds, which is a grand establishment offering numerous amenities. Nearly all the affluent Muslim visitors to Jerusalem seek refuge in this inn. It boasts a spacious building with a multitude of features. Inside, there is a sizable lounge area where guests can unwind, enjoying their tea and hookah, indulging in delicious food, and relishing melodious music during the evenings. The inn provides a range of accommodations to suit diverse preferences.

On the upper levels, one can find opulent rooms that cater to caravan masters and affluent businessmen, who often choose to reserve these luxurious quarters. As you ascend the stairs, private rooms designed for 2-3 individuals are available, providing a comfortable and cozy atmosphere. Lastly, on the highest floor, there are dormitory-style rooms where up to 8 individuals can find restful repose.

Moreover, the inn has thoughtfully allocated 10 rooms on the lower levels specifically for the non-human community of Jerusalem. These unique rooms offer a direct connection to the catacombs through a narrow tunnel, allowing convenient access for those guests.

Nabil Mustafa: The owner of Vaha Al-Quds, Nabil Mustafa (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.GlaCGcgIP6YjBjGc]{Noble}j), is a unique figure, being a half-elf and a respected pillar of the Muslim community. His deep connections to the palace have allowed his establishment to thrive, even during times of oppression faced by the Muslim community. Thanks to his father’s extensive relationships with past rulers of Jerusalem, Mustafa enjoys significant privileges.

In return for the comforts the palace affords him, such as lifted taxes and flexible permits, Mustafa offers valuable insights into the lives of Muslim people and the various businesses operating within the community. Within his grand meeting room, crucial business gatherings take place, and the palace benefits from direct knowledge of these events, acting as eyes and ears to important matters.

Imaan: Imaan resides in the inn, offering her services as a gifted fortuneteller (check out the Fortune-tellerh statblock in Appendix) in exchange for her accommodation. Within the inn, she has a private and cozy suite, carefully partitioned by a curtain, with a dedicated table where she attends to her clients. Her reputation among the Muslim community is remarkable, and her popularity extends beyond Jerusalem, attracting visitors from distant places.

Being a valued asset to Mustafa, Imaan’s presence draws numerous clients to the inn, with some individuals even choosing to stay there solely for the opportunity to seek her guidance. Her mystical abilities and insightful readings have earned her a devoted following and garnered the trust of many.

In recognition of the valuable business she brings, Mustafa allows Imaan to stay at the inn without charge and, in addition, receives commissions from her earnings. Players utilizing Imaan’s fortunetelling services are presented with a choice; the GM rolls two d20s for players to choose one. Players can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by a player or a creature that they can see with the chosen foretelling roll. They can choose to do so before or after the roll, but it is only available within 24 hours after the foretelling.

The Qadim Hookah.name: The Qadim Hookah
The Qadim Hookah.text:
The Qadim Hookah

As you step into the Qadim Hookah, you are welcomed by the sight of large round tables where people gather in earnest discussion about a wide range of topics, from business matters to the state of the world, and particularly the role their community plays in the city. The atmosphere is filled with a mix of hopefulness and intensity - in direct contrast to the situation of the Muslim Quarter of the city, as emotions run high during these conversations. Amongst the discussions, some tables are occupied by individuals engrossed in various games, adding a touch of leisure to the vibrant scene.

Moving towards the back of the lounge, you’ll find the diwans, now bearing the marks of time, where people comfortably settle to enjoy the hookah while engaging in the same spirited discussions as in the main area.

As you venture upstairs, you’ll discover private rooms thoughtfully provided by the owner for daily rental. Each room offers a mini version of the lounge downstairs, featuring a single round table and a diwan, providing the perfect sanctuary for individuals to indulge in their favorite activities without prying eyes. These exclusive spaces become a hub for discreet business talks and a chance to immerse in earthly pleasures undisturbed.

The Qadim Hookah is located in the desolate Muslim Quarter, serving as a popular destination where many men spend their leisure time during the day. It is a bustling hub, particularly after working hours, as individuals gather here to engage in friendly games, chat with companions, and savor the flavors of hookah. This expansive establishment spans multiple floors, proudly holding the title of the largest coffeehouse in town, making it a common meeting place for the entire Muslim community.

The coffeehouse is renowned for fostering a warm and inviting social atmosphere, encouraging camaraderie and relaxation. It provides ample space for patrons to unwind and enjoy each other’s company.

In addition to the main communal areas, there are private rooms available for those seeking a discreet setting to enjoy their preferred alcoholic beverages. These secluded spaces provide an opportunity for individuals to indulge in their personal choices away from prying eyes. For the most discreet and favorite customers, there are all kinds of services they can enjoy for some gold as well.

Sameer (Commonerj): Hailing from Egyptian ancestry, he faced the trials of oppression when his father, a merchant seeking greater wealth, uprooted their lives to settle in Jerusalem. However, their heritage made them targets of discrimination in their newfound home. Tragedy struck when Sameer’s mother passed away, leaving him in the care of a neighbor, as his father returned to their hometown and never looked back. Left to his own devices with sporadic financial support from his absent father, Sameer persevered and diligently saved every penny.

In time, Sameer’s determination bore fruit as he courageously established a grand coffeehouse, The Qadim Hookah, which swiftly became a revered institution in the community. This coffeehouse served as a welcoming haven, uniting people and fostering a sense of belonging amidst the difficulties they faced.

Whispers of Time Apothecary.name: Whispers of Time Apothecary
Whispers of Time Apothecary.text:
Whispers of Time Apothecary

The Whispers of Time Apothecary presents a scene that is far from the typical appearance of a shop. Instead, it appears almost abandoned, as if it has been the dwelling place of a hoarder with no regard for cleanliness. Empty, broken, and half-filled vials are scattered haphazardly throughout the space, giving an air of disarray and neglect. The bookshelf, laden with dusty old tomes, seems untouched for ages, their pages yellowed with time.

As you explore the dim corners of the shop, a mumbling sound draws your attention. From the far corner emerges the figure of an old man who seems to be quite displeased by your presence. His frustration is evident as he exclaims, “Oh, great! What the bloody hell do you want?” His demeanor offers no warmth or kindness; rather, he gives the impression of someone who should have passed away long ago but somehow forgot to do so. Despite his impatience, he acknowledges, “I would tell you to hurry, but I have nothing but time, unfortunately.”

The Whispers of Time Apothecary is helmed by an incredibly aged man, Khaled (@UUID[Actor.W0lLe9hBvZnZClaV]{Scholar of Jerusalem}), who appears to have outlived the normal bounds of mortality. He carries an air of grumpiness and possesses a sharp tongue. The apothecary itself, rather than resembling a conventional shop, bears the semblance of a small, cave-like space. Bottles and potions line every available surface, requiring visitors to tread cautiously to avoid accidental mishaps. The owner typically remains secluded in some corner, engrossed in the meticulous preparation of medications.

Despite its somewhat dubious appearance, the apothecary holds the distinction of being the finest establishment of its kind in town, surprisingly earning a reputation for reliability and trustworthiness. The owner is a familiar figure to every resident of Jerusalem, as his presence extends back to their childhood memories. Curiously, no one can recall a time when he was younger, leaving the impression that he has been trapped within the confines of a temporal prison, eternally bound to stir his potions.

There exists an air of mystery surrounding the owner, as no one has ever witnessed him stepping foot outside his shop. The apothecary’s inner room serves as his residence, accessible through a connecting passage. The owner relies on his errand boys to deliver supplies, which he then diligently prepares within the confines of his secluded abode.

In a profound twist of fate, the truth behind the apothecary’s owner unveils a deeply tragic story. Over two centuries have passed since he first began working at the shop. In his late nineties, his beloved wife fell gravely ill, prompting him to undertake a desperate and daring venture. In an attempt to save her life, he concocted a risky potion infused with powerful magic. However, the spell misfired, resulting in a catastrophic event that caused his wife to vanish, ensnared within a binding vortex of magic.

Trapped within the confines of an unbreakable time bubble, the owner has remained in the shop for the past 150 years, perpetually haunted by the weight of guilt and grief. His existence has become a ceaseless penance for his perceived failure in rescuing his wife from her magical entrapment. The passage of time, both relentless and unforgiving, has found him eternally locked within the confines of the shop’s walls. Players can buy any common potions from this shop for 50 gd and some uncommon potions that are listed. If players attempt to steal a potion, they must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity (Stealth) check. On a failed save, they are noticed by Khaled, but he doesn’t care unless they steal more than one potion. In a situation where players steal more than one potion, he warns them, saying he didn’t care for one, but they shouldn’t be greedy. Players can roll a d8 on the list to see which potion they have stolen if stolen in a hurry.
