  • While using thieves’ tools against locks, you have advantage on the roll.
  • If you spend 1 hour with an unattached lock, you can make its mechanism more complicated, and if you ever use that lock, the DC used to open it increases by 1d6.

Knight’s Training.name: Knight’s Training
Knight’s Training.text:
@UUID[Item.dmx2cZeovEFkn648]{Knight’s Training}

You aspired to be a knight, and it’s time to arm yourself properly for a warrior.

  • Your Strength score increases by 1.
  • You gain proficiency with martial weapons.
  • You halve your armor don and doff time. Donning or doffing a shield can be done with a bonus action for you.

Knight’s Oath.name: Knight’s Oath
Knight’s Oath.text:
@UUID[Item.wWXkUfUO9ffj0qu4]{Knight’s Oath}

Prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher

Your days of struggle and pain only made you stronger. You are ready to take your skills with weapons and armor to a new level:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
  • You learn one Fighting Style skill from the Fighter class. If you already know one, you must choose another.

Occult Adept.name: Occult Adept
Occult Adept.text:
@UUID[Item.3GvcwRXi26jK9Q5P]{Occult Adept}

You have honed your skills and mind within occult circles and readied yourself for new abilities.

  • Your Charisma score increases by 1.
  • You learn a sorcerer or warlock cantrip of your choice.
  • You learn the bane spell and can cast it without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you do so, you can’t cast it again like this until you finish a long rest. If you have spell slots, you can cast the spell normally.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for those spells.

Wanderlust.name: Wanderlust
Wanderlust.text:
@UUID[Item.k8nLOaKZUYQWHEbh]{Wanderlust}

Your boots have seen everything and tasted the dust of many realms. Your life is full of travels, and you are accustomed to it more than anyone else. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Constitution or Dexterity score increases by 1.
  • Your walking speed increases by 5 ft.
  • You gain proficiency in the Survival or Nature skills.
  • You can take Dash as a bonus action on your turns.
  • You can lower your exhaustion level by only finishing a short rest. You can do so only with 2 short rests before you finish a long rest.
  • When you forage for food and water, you have advantage on the check.

Wildlife Explorer.name: Wildlife Explorer
Wildlife Explorer.text:
@UUID[Item.ymdqgHxfGtsweaQB]{Wildlife Explorer}

Your time spent with beasts and domesticated animals gave you an edge around them and you learned to communicate with them better than anyone else.

  • Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
  • You learn the speak with animals and animal friendship spells. You can cast each of them without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can’t cast them again until you finish a short or long rest.
  • You gain proficiency in the Animal Handling skill.

Profession Options.name: Profession Options
Profession Options.text:
Core of the System

The Profession System is designed to enhance the backgrounds and current occupations of player characters besides their “adventuring classes.” Adventuring classes define players’ core abilities and their general features from combat encounters to social situations. The Profession System is aimed at giving players opportunities to enrich their downtimes, backgrounds, non-combat activities, explorations, daily goals and occupations, and their characters out of adventure days.

Characters can take up the path of a Profession between Levels 1-3 and have access to Apprentice levels of the Professions if they meet the prerequisite for the intended profession. It is recommended that players should take at least 2 weeks of downtime to begin a Profession. It is not advised for characters to have more than one profession, as the system is not designed for multi-professions. However, at the GM’s discretion, players may take suitable perks from other professions if needed. If a character wants to start a Profession at later levels, GM may let them start with more Profession Experience (PEX) depending on the earlier experiences of the adventurer.

PEX is the main way of progressing through the Ranks and gaining new abilities. Most of the Professions explain how to gain PEX. For example, the very first Profession designed by us – The Bounty Hunter in The City of Crescent – gains PEX through collecting bounties, and it is scaled with Challenge Ratings of said bounties.

To improve ranks, a character must spend their PEX for the current rank’s abilities (usually at least two of them), and also reach the designated PEX for the next rank and expend the experience as well. It should be noted that the rank system does not work like 5th edition class leveling; you must spend your PEX in order to rank up.

There are 4 ranks for each profession: Apprentice, Journeyman, Expert, and Master. Apprentice is the starting level, and there is no PEX needed to enter that profession, but investments should be made beforehand or the backstory of the character must fit the profession.

For Journeyman rank, you must spend at least a total 100 PEX on abilities and spend 300 PEX to reach the rank.

For Expert rank, you must spend at least a total of 200 PEX on abilities and spend 1,000 PEX to reach the rank.

For Master rank, you must spend at least a total 400 PEX on abilities and spend 5,000 PEX to reach the maximum rank.

When you spend enough PEX to reach the next rank, you can also purchase other abilities as well. In addition, you can purchase earlier abilities from lower ranks.

Earlier Professions

In earlier books (The City of Crescent and Empires of the Silk Road), there are several professions: Grave Robber, Oracle, Herbalist, Tinker, Beast Tamer, Smuggler, Ecclesiastic, Merchant, Bounty Hunter, Antiquarian, Burglar, Alchemist, Archeologist, and Spy. Most of these professions can work for the Era of the Crusades as well, so it is recommended to examine those books for inspiration.

Earlier Professions did not have prerequisites; they are provided here:

ProfessIon

Prerequisites*

Alchemist

Intelligence 13 | Arcana |

Antiquarian

Intelligence or Wisdom 13 | Insight |

Archeologist

Intelligence 13 | Survival or History |

Beast Tamer

Dexterity or Wisdom 13 | Animal Handling |

Bounty Hunter

Dexterity or Strength 13 | One martial weapon |

Burglar

Dexterity 13 | Sleight of Hand or Stealth |

Ecclesiastic

Wisdom or Charisma 13 | Religion or Persuasion |

Grave Robber

Dexterity 13 | Survival |

Merchant

Wisdom 13 | Medicine |

Oracle

Charisma 13 | Persuasion or Deception |

Smuggler

Wisdom 13 | Insight |

Spy

Dexterity 13 | Stealth |

Tinker

Dexterity or Charisma 13 | Stealth or Deception |

*Mentioned tools require proficiency, not having the actual tool.

Blacksmith.name: Blacksmith
Blacksmith.text:
Blacksmith

Being a Blacksmith

Your desire for craft and the ability to shape things around you led you to this profession. With hardwork and dedication, you create many useful objects for society and wield the flame that was gifted to humanity since the archaic times. You are able to see a raw material and shape it in your mind and influence that image into reality.

How to Play

You will craft metallic objects, such as armors, weapons, horsenails, and similar ones, and repair such items.

Prerequisites

In order to start a Profession as a Blacksmith, a character must have at least Dexterity or Strength 13 and must have proficiency with Smith’s Tools.

Climbing the Ranks

ActIVITY

Reward

Repair an object, such as a dull weapon

5 PEX

Crafting and selling a simple weapon

5 PEX

Crafting and selling a martial weapon

10 PEX

Crafting and selling a shield

5 PEX

Crafting and selling medium armor

5 PEX

Crafting and selling heavy armor

10 PEX

Crafting and selling daily objects, such as horsenails, hammers, furniters, shackles, bars,chains, safety cases and the like.

5 PEX

You gain PEX through the activities listed beyond, but it is up to the GM to award PEX for other possible activities that are not listed.

Apprentice Blacksmith

Rank One

As an apprentice blacksmith, you have the basic comprehension of the craft and have access to basic abilities related to smithing.

Hard Work —50 PEX

“Do you even lift, brethren?”

By working your muscles and lifting heavy objects frequently, you gain proficiency in the Athletics skill.

Fast Blows—50 PEX

With experience, you gained speed in your profession. You need only half the time and cost for producing a metal object.

Useful Arcana—50 PEX

Your leaning into arcane arts finally paid off, and your learning from the ancient ways have made the difference. You learn the mending and produce flame cantrips. If you are a spellcaster, you can use your own spellcasting ability modifier for the cantrip, otherwise it is Wisdom.

Heat Adaptation—50 PEX

“The heat never bothered me anyway.”

You are no longer affected by extreme heat conditions.

Training with the Blades —50 PEX

You spend your free time with the objects you craft, and your training has paid off. You gain proficiency in two weapons of your choice that you can craft.

Defensive Training —50 PEX

You train in armor of your own making, gaining proficiency with Medium Armor and Shields.

Journeyman Blacksmith

Rank Two —300 PEX

You spent enough time to be known as a skillful blacksmith. Possibly locals know and love your metalwork. Most experienced and expert blacksmiths think highly of your work.

Specialization—100 PEX

You now specialize in your craft. You either choose to focus on weapons, their balance, sharpness and so on, or focus on armors, how to make them better and protective as well as to make them lighter, and so on.

Weaponsmith

When you choose this specialization, you further hone your ability to forge weapons. You add a Quirk to the weapon when you craft it or spend 1 hour working on it. Check out the table below: Quirks for Weapons. No matter what quirk you apply to a weapon, it is counted as a magical weapon for the purpose of overcoming resistance.

Armorer

When you choose this, your craft excels at armor making. You can add a Quality to a piece of armor you craft or if you spend 1 hour working on it. Check out the table below: Quirks for Armors. No matter what quality you apply to an armor, it reduces damage taken by equal to the wearer’s proficiency bonus.

Quirks for Weapons

QuIrk

Property

Sharp

Any damage roll you make on the die that is 1 is counted as 2.

Flexible

You can choose to deal bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage with the weapon when you score a hit.

Balanced

You choose a number between 10-19. That number is counted as a critical hit for you when you roll for an attack roll.

Hard End

You can use a bonus action to make an attack with the weapon’s other end if it’s not a weapon like that already. It deals 1d4 damage.

Sturdy

The weapon’s durability is doubled.

Slight

The weapon’s penalties from Heavy no longer apply.

Bound

With specially made leather-bonds or metallic chains, the weapon is bound to you, and you can’t be forced to drop it.

Sturdy Ammo

Your ammunition does not break when you miss an attack.

Special Clothing —100 PEX

“Fashion is my passion.”

Your art is so fine that you can work on regular clothing and enhance them. Working on clothes requires 1 hour and 150 gp. When you are done, the cloth makes the wearer’s Armor Class 11 + regular bonuses when they are not wearing armor.

Premial Arcana—100 PEX

You honed your skills with arcane ways and learned beneficial spells to aid you in your daily tasks. You can cast the find familiar and the unseen servant spells as rituals. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for the spells.

Weapon Training —100 PEX

You train with the weapons of your own design, and you learn to use them as well as a warrior. You gain proficiency with four weapons of your choice that you can craft.

Heavy Armor Training—100 PEX

You spend your time with the heavy armor you craft, and your training has paid off. You gain proficiency in Heavy Armor.

Adept—100 PEX

You double your proficiency bonus with any check related to your Smith’s Tools.

Qualities for Armor

QuIrk

Property

Enhanced Shield

This shield gives +1 to AC rather than +2, but you can wield a light weapon with that hand.

Quick

Don and doff time is halved for the armor.

Embrace

When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed attack while wearing the armor, it deals 1 additional damage (type is chosen when the armor is forged). In addition, when it grapples a creature, it deals 1 damage to the grappled creature at the start of the grappled creature’s turns.

Stealthy

If it normally gives disadvantage on Stealth checks, this armor does not.

Agile

While wearing this armor, standing up and mounting/demounting only costs 5 feet movement for each.

Comfortable

While taking a long rest with this armor, you suffer no penalties, such as restoring your Hit Die as normally sleeping without armor.

Nimble

Armor that limit Dexterity modifier to +2 now limit it to +3.

Quick Shield

This shield can be donned and doffed with a bonus action.

Feather-like

Heavy property for the weapons you make can be carried by races that have a Small body type.

Expert Blacksmith

Rank Three —1000 PEX

You are a renowned blacksmith, having visitors and customers from all over the world. There are adventurers who want to have your gear, and commanders visit you to hire you for future conflicts and arming of their armies. Many young aspiring apprentices arrive at your shop with a desire to be trained by you.

Specialization Improvement—200 PEX

You have been a blacksmith so long, your craft is like breathing for you. Weaponsmiths get Expert Weapons and Armorers get Expert Armor perks.

Expert Armors

You choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. The armor you make grants resistance to one of the damage types. If you spend an extra of 200 gp and use enchanted metals, you can make it +1 Armor.

Expert Weapons

You can add one of the Quirks below to a weapon you craft:

Reach

The melee weapons you craft that are spears, staffs, or have metallic blades now have the Reach feature.

Versatile

The melee weapons you craft that have the Versatile ability now normally deal that damage. For example, when used with one hand, your Longswords deal d10 slashing damage.

Finesse

If the weapon has the Finesse property, its damage die becomes one greater. For example, a dagger deals 1d6 damage.

Ranged

If the weapon has the Ranged or Thrown property, its normal range is doubled.

Magical Weapons—200 PEX

By spending an extra 250 gp for the weapons you make (for each property), you can embed them with magical properties. A weapon can have Magical Properties up to a number equal to half your Dexterity modifier (rounded up).

MagIcal PropertIes

ExplanatIon

Magically Sharp

The weapon gains +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls and counted as magical.

Elemental Core

The weapon deals extra 1d4 elemental damage (chosen when the weapon is built): fire, cold, acid, poison, lightning, or thunder.

Protective Spell

With the weapon, the user can cast one of the spells once a day, without expending a spell slot: false life, shield, mage armor.

Offensive Spell

With the weapon, the user can cast one of the spells once a day, without expending a spell slot: faerie fire, burning hands, thunderwave.

Utility Spell

With the weapon, the user can cast one of the spells once a day, without expending a spell slot: jump, expeditious retreat, longstrider.

Enterprise

While holding this weapon, the user adds an additional 1d6 to their Initiative rolls.

Alert

While holding this weapon, the user can’t be surprised.

Secrets of Gunpowder—200 PEX

If your GM allows, you may research gunpowder and its effects on explosives and have access to gunpowder weapons, such as pistols and rifles.

Early Pistol

100 gd

1d6 piercing + 1 fire

3 lb.

Ammunition(range 50/150), Loading, Impact, Loud

Early Rifle

100 gd

1d8 piercing + 1d4 fire

5 lb.

Heavy, Two Handed, Ammunition (range 120/500), Loading, Impact, Loud

Impact

When you roll the maximum on one of the damage dice, you reroll the die and add the total to the damage. For example, if you roll an 8 with the Early Rifle, you roll another d8 and add them together. This ability works once per hit.

Loud

The weapon’s blast can be heard from 300 ft. away.

Arcane Flames—200 PEX

“Just add a little bit of spice.”

Your work with the forge and fire over the years and research of the arcane matters have enabled you to use magic to improve your craft. You can cast the heat metal spell three times a day without expending a spell slot. If you are a spellcaster, you can cast it normally with your spell slots. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

Raised in Fire—200 PEX

You are so used to the flames touching you and hurting yourself, your body is adapted to it. You gain resistance to fire damage.

Master Blacksmith

Rank Four —5000 PEX

You are one of the greatest blacksmiths who ever lived. You probably forged a legendary sword that slayed a dragon, felled a demigod, or destroyed whole armies. An adventurer who is brave enough to face a cold-hearted lich’s gaze is probably wearing armor forged by you. You armed kings, leaders, generals and conquerors.

Stories of the Past —Free

“Oh, have I told you about the time when…”

You have a lot of experiences and stories, and have probably taken part in some of the legends and myths. You have the ability to inspire greatness in others. You can grant inspiration to anyone who listens to your stories a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus daily. This inspiration point must be used in 1 hour, or it will be lost. Anyone who already has an inspiration point won’t be affected by this.

Word of a Blacksmith —Free

You invoke the name of a magical metallic object that is known to you and touch a similar object. For the next minute, the mundane object gains the properties of the magical object you invoked. For example, you touch a mundane metallic shield and it becomes Animated Shield*for the duration. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Downtime Activities for the Blacksmith

Research New Materials

You spend your time traveling and discovering new methods, materials, and other possible improvements in your field. You make a Smith’s Tools check against DC 10. On a success, you gain 10 PEX. Depending on the nature of your discovery, the GM may apply additional rewards or penalties. For example, if you discover a new type of weapon that is uncommon for your land (such as a blacksmith from Damascus learning to make a Wakizashi - a short katana), you can craft and sell that weapon for more coins than usual.

Market Sale

You sell your basic materials in a market. You roll a Charisma (Persuasion) check against DC 10. On a success, you gain 2d6 gp (3d6 if you roll more than 15) and 10 PEX. Depending on your success, the GM may introduce new customers.

Training

You either train an apprentice or find someone to train you. You roll for a DC 10 Intelligence check. On a success, you gain 15 PEX.

Interrogator.name: Interrogator
Interrogator.text:
Interrogator

Being an Interrogator

Every law enforcement organization needs a professional who is an expert at getting people to talk and extracting information on tough targets. You always had a skill in touching people’s nerves, both figuratively and literally. You know the mind games and the like, and you know the human body well enough to inflict the right amount of pain.

How to Play?

You question people, extract knowledge, learn secrets, find information, conduct research, observe people, and do many similar activities.

Prerequisites

In order to become an Interrogator, a character must have at least 13 in Charisma, Strength or Dexterity and must have the Insight skill proficiency.

Climbing the Ranks

You gain PEX through the activities listed below, but it is up to the GM to award PEX for other possible activities that are not listed.

ActIVITY

Reward

Extracting Knowledge in an interrogation (CR 1 and below)

5 PEX

Extracting Knowledge in an interrogation (CR 2-4)

15 PEX

Extracting Knowledge in an interrogation (CR 5-7)

30 PEX

Extracting Knowledge in an interrogation (CR 8+)

75 PEX (GM may award more for creatures that have drastically more CR)

Learning an important secret

10 PEX

Breaking an organization leader in an interrogation

50 PEX

Apprentice Interrogator

Rank One

You joined an important organization and started to conduct interrogations to extract knowledge. It may be a law enforcement organization, an illegal thieves’ guild, a military order or a similar one. You may even be working as a freelancer, a guy that is called when someone needs to be “talked to.” You are at the start of your career, but you are discovering the ways to improve your skills.

Reading People —50 PEX

“I see right through you.”

You are good at reading expressions and catching lies, as someone in your shoes must. You double your proficiency bonus in all Insight checks.

Right Skills for the Job —50 PEX

You trained yourself in many ways to better do your job. You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice: Persuasion, Deception, Intimidation, Perception or Investigation.

Right Amount of Pain —50 PEX

When you interrogate people with physical methods, such as inflicting pain to make them talk, you deal only 1 point of damage (damage type is based on the tools you used)

The Necessary Tools —50 PEX

“Something smells fishy in here.”

You gain proficiency in the Forgery Kit and Poisoner’s Kit. In your profession, it is important to catch lies and forgeries in documents and crime scenes.

Armed and Dangerous —50 PEX

You never know what your enemies carry with them, you must be ready. You gain proficiency in two weapons of your choice. In addition, you gain proficiency in Light Armor as well.

Journeyman Interrogator

Rank Two —300 PEX

Specialization —100 PEX

You specialize in a way of your choice: You either choose to train yourself to make people talk with your charms and wits (Silver Tongue) or through physical methods (Surgeon).

Silver Tongue

“Few can resist my charms.”

You force a creature to make a Charisma or Wisdom saving throw (your choice) with your action that is restrained or confined in a room with you. On a failed save, it must answer a question asked by you. The DC for this ability is determined when you choose this specialization. It equals to 10 + your Charisma (Persuasion) bonus or your Charisma (Intimidation) bonus. If a creature succeeds in this saving throw, you can’t use this ability on it again until a month has passed.

Surgeon

As an action, you force a creature that is restrained or confined in a room with you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it must answer a question asked by you. The DC equals to 8 + proficiency bonus + Dexterity modifier. If a creature succeeds on this saving throw, you can’t use this ability on it again until a month has passed.

Arcane Methods —100 PEX

You can spend some time and coins to establish a connection with a potion dealer or make your own potions for interrogations. For potions to work, the creature must be restrained or confined in a room with you.

Truth Serum—200 gd

The drinker must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be compelled to tell the truth for the next minute. A dose large enough to affect a humanoid is worth 200 gd.

Friendship Serum—150 gd

The drinker must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be charmed by the nearest person for 1 minute. A dose large enough to affect a humanoid is worth 150 gd.

Dread Serum —100 gd

The drinker must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be frightened of the nearest person for 1 minute. A dose large enough to affect a humanoid is worth 100 gd.

Agony Serum—200 gd

The drinker must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or lose 1d4 hit points at the start of each of its turns and experience incredible pain for 1 minute. A dose large enough to affect a humanoid is worth 200 gd. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

Conducting Investigation—100 PEX

You double your proficiency bonus on Perception and Investigation skills.

Foreign Tongues—100 PEX

Some enemies may speak other languages for many different reasons, so you must know them as well. You learn two languages of your choice.

Underground Smarts—100 PEX

“I know these dark tunnels like the back of my hand.”

You’ve been to the underground more than you care to admit. You learn Thieves’ Cant.

Chasing the Criminals—100 PEX

“I really need to work on my stamina!”

Some interrogations need the culprits to be caught, and you have found yourself in rooftops or hot chases more than you wanted. Your walking speed increases by 10 ft.

Guarded by Metal—100 PEX

You can be the target of many attacks, as you are a valuable asset. In order to protect yourself better, you gain proficiency in Medium Armor and shields.

Expert Interrogator

Rank Three —1000 PEX

Specialization Improvement —300 PEX

When a creature makes a saving throw against your abilities chosen with this Specialization, they have disadvantage on the saving throw.

Smelling Lies —300 PEX

You understand when you hear a lie.

Expert Liar—300 PEX

“Sometimes even I believe in my own lies.”

You have heard so many lies that you can make up a new one easily. When another creature rolls to see if you’re lying, they have disadvantage on the check.

Master Interrogator

Rank Four —5000 PEX

There is no secret safe from you. There is no person living who won’t talk while your gaze is upon them. You are already a living legend at what you do. Underground guilds are filled with youth who aspire to be you. Law enforcement organizations teach your ways to their new apprentices, and you are only wanted when the balance of the world may be at stake.

Stories of the Past —Free

You have a lot of experiences and stories, and have probably taken part in some of the legends and myths. You have the ability to inspire greatness in others. You can grant inspiration to anyone who listens to your stories a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus daily. This inspiration point must be used in 1 hour or it will be lost. Anyone who already has an inspiration point won't be affected by this.

The Smile —Free

“Have you met my pearly whites?”

You are the epitome of an interrogator. Kings, presidents, and khagans want you in their courts. You can use your action and smile at a humanoid that can see you within 60 ft. of you. It makes a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier). On a failed save, it is marked by you. For the next minute, when you ask a question, even if it lies, you can read the truth in its mind. The creature has no idea.

Downtime Activities for the Interrogator

Collecting Clues

You spend your week observing a suspect or a potential enemy. You must succeed on a DC 10 Perception or Intelligence check to gather clues, listening to conversations and with similar activities. On a success, you learn two crucial pieces of information and gain 10 PEX.

Studying a Suspect

Instead of directly interrogating a person, you may spend your time with them and observe their nature, state of mind and other aspects. You must succeed on a DC 12 Insight check. On a success, you have advantage on the rolls you make to interrogate the person and gain 10 PEX.

Underground Contact

You can spend one workweek and 25 gp to learn the places you can buy or fence some unique and possibly illegal items or meet with “interesting” people. Roll a Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Insight) check against DC 10. On a success, you meet one of the black-market tradesmen. Work with your GM to determine their proficiency, their items, attitude, and other important details. Once you establish a contact, you can revisit this downtime activity with a DC 10 Persuasion check to have an arrangement with the determined contact, for example for information or a specific item. The details are determined by the GM.

Herbalist.name: Herbalist
Herbalist.text:
Herbalist

Being an Herbalist

To the uneducated, nature is a brutish, hostile place, but to those who know it, there are uses for everything to cure, to enhance, and to harm. Certain people have spent their lives identifying and analyzing the aspects of nature, the diseases it wrought and cures that help. Herbalists can be found in almost every civilization, especially in the countryside. They are needed by the common folk when their children have a fever, when they are coughing blood, or when they need something to soothe the pain.

How to Play?

You gain PEX through identifying plants, herbs, mushrooms, and the like; preparing medicine; diagnosing diseases; and curing people.

Prerequisites

In order to become a Herbalist, a character must have at least 13 to Wisdom, and must have Medicine skill proficiency.

Climbing the Ranks

ActIVITY

Reward

Identify a plant/herb/mushroom

5 PEX

Diagnose a disease

10 PEX

Curing symptoms

5 PEX

Curing a disease

10 PEX

Preparing a medicine*

15 PEX

Discovering a new disease**

25 PEX

*Note: The medicine such as a burn ointment or a pain killer must be useful in order to gain PEX. Such medicines will be introduced below.

**Note:As most campaigns in 5e resemble the Middle Ages, there were many diseases and conditions people were not aware of. Encountering such a disease or illness through adventuring is not enough. A herbalist must be able to understand and analyze the disease in order to gain PEX.

***Note: Possible elixirs and potions will be introduced below.

Apprentice Herbalist (Rank 1)

Rank One

You have basic knowledge of the beauty and the horror of nature.

Understanding Nature —50 PEX

You begin to tell the difference between seeds, plants, mushrooms, and their properties.

You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice from the list: Nature, Survival, Medicine, or Perception. In addition, you can forgo one of the skills and gain proficiency in the herbalism kit.

Journal —50 PEX

You keep a journal for your plants, seeds and herbs. If you encounter a new plant that is not recorded in your book, you can make a Nature check against a DC determined by the GM according to the rarity of the plant. On a success you can learn its properties without needing a kit or a long identifying process.

Additionally, if you spend 1 hour studying a plant, you can learn its properties, such as poisoning or healing abilities. This 1 hour can be a part of a short or a long rest.

Diagnose —50 PEX

Ninety percent of a cure is early and correct diagnosis. When you encounter a sick person, you immediately understand what external symptoms (not the internal ones) the patient has. You can examine the patient for 10 minutes and make a Medicine check against a DC determined by the GM. With normal diseases, you have advantage on this check.

Potion Making —50 PEX

Hubble bubble.

Transmutation Cantrip

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: Touch

Components: V, S, M (an avian feather)

Duration: Special

You touch an object with an avian feather to give it properties of a magical quill. The object must have some sort of a sharp part to be used. A wooden stick, a sharp stone, a metal shard, or a similar object would do.

The Marvelous Quill: The object can be used to write and produce its own magical ink when you activate it as an action. It can be used for writing on any solid surface for 1 hour. When you reach 5th level, you can spend 4 hours and 15 gd to produce a cantrip scroll of your choice. When you reach 11th level, you can spend 8 hours and 50 gd to produce a 1st level spell scroll of your choice. When you reach 17th level, you can spend 12 hours and 200 gd to produce a 2nd level spell scroll of your choice. When you reach 11th level, the duration of 1 week becomes 1 month. When you reach 17th level, the duration of 1 month becomes indefinite.

Casting Time: 1 Bonus Action

Components: V

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 round

You look deep into the eyes of a creature that is not a humanoid and utter the words of infernal domination, first discovered by the master demonologist, Mehmed Siyah Qalam.   • Its resistances
  • Its vulnerabilities
  • Its immunities

Range: 10 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Instantaneous

Components: V, S

You create an illusional attack to strike an enemy within range. On a success, it realizes the illusion and can no longer be harmed by the spell until you cast it again.

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M (a black thread)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 hour

You utter the word of Al-Ahmar, The Red One of the Djinnfolk, and surround yourself with arcane energy. For the duration, your essence changes. Components: V, S, M (a spellbook worth at least 50 gd)

Duration: Instantaneous

When you cast this spell, you can choose a 1st-level spell (its duration must be 1 action) from your spellbook and cast that spell instead. If the spell asks for a material component, you must have it on you.

Your maximum hit points increase by 10. This spell does not increase current hit points, and the effect does not stack on multiple casts.

2nd Level Abjuration

Components: V

2nd Level Transmutation

Range: Self

Components: V, S

Duration: Instantaneous

You target yourself and up to two allies within 10 ft. of you. They can use their reaction to cooperate with you. All three of you can move up to your speed and deal one attack to a creature within your reach. If any of you use ranged weapons or throwable melee weapons, you can also make an attack roll with them against a creature within range. You can aim for the same or different targets.

On a hit, each attack deals additional 1d6 lightning damage. Instead of dealing extra damage, any of you can choose to push the target up to 10 ft. and force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a fail, they also fall prone.

Warlock, Wizard

2nd Level Transmutation

Range: 60 feet

Components: V

Duration: Instantaneous

When you cast this spell, all possible light sources are lit within range and can't be put out for the next hour, unless a 3rd level darkness or a similar spell is cast. If there are no possible light sources, an orb of light that sheds 30 ft. of bright light and a further 30 ft. of dim light appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range, and it stays for 1 hour.

2nd Level Illusion

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M

Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

When you cast this spell, you cloud the mind of all who gaze upon a particular piece of paper or a similar item. Unless they succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, the item you show appears as a proper legal document with a function of your choosing, such as legalizing your presence there, proving you indeed have authorization to bring the goods into the city, and the like. On a success, they see through the illusion and realize that you were trying to meddle with their minds.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Celestial Force of Attraction.name: Celestial Force of Attraction

@UUID[Item.EbaXe4E1t9zYvBd1]{Celestial Force of Attraction}

2nd Level Abjuration

Casting Time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a one target spell is being cast within 60 ft. of you

Range: 60 feet

Components: S

Duration: Instantaneous

When you see a spell being cast within range, you can call upon your arcane might to misalign gravity and change the spell's course, presenting yourself as the target.

If the spell targets a creature and is made with an attack roll (for example, guiding bolt), it takes your Armor Class into account, and if it forces one creature to make a saving throw and not an area of effect (for example hold person), you make the saving throws. If the spell succeeds, you are affected by the spell, not the original target. If the spell is an AoE attack (for example fireball), the center of the spell shifts to right below your feet.

If it's a healing spell, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell heals you.

If the spell normally targets one creature at its lowest level and now somehow affects more than one target (for example, due to upcasting or Metamagic), you can only alter one attack roll or one saving throw.

At Higher Levels: For each level above the 2nd, you gain +1 bonus to your Armor Class or saving throw.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Zengi's Armor of Faith.name: Zengi's Armor of Faith

2nd Level Abjuration

Casting Time: 1 Bonus Action

Range: 30 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You draw the sigils of the lords of Zengi to the aether, summoning the arcane might of the powerful masters who fought for the Holy Lands with great faith and pride. For the duration, each time you take damage, you reduce the damage by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus or equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (your choice when you cast the spell). If you reduce the damage to 0, you gain the remaining damage as temporary hit points. For the purpose of your concentration saving throws, no matter the damage, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to hold your concentration.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer

Al-Aswad's Interrogation Circle.name: Al-Aswad's Interrogation Circle

@UUID[Item.jKnCdfLb7D5qKl1r]{Al-Aswad's Interrogation Circle}

3rd Level Enchantment

Casting Time: 1 Minute

Range: 10 feet

Components: V, S, M (an incandescent iron)

Duration: 1 Hour

You create a runic magical circle centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range and up to a 10-foot radius in size. Runes are written in djinn speech, they glow faintly, and are imbued with the name of the great djinn, the Two Thunders, Al-Aswad.

You can use your action to activate the circle to target up to three incapacitated creatures inside the circle. The targets must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save they start to feel heavy pain. Whenever you desire, you can use your bonus action to deal 1d10 psychic damage to the target. This damage can't reduce the target below 1 hit point for the first time. Every damage you deal after reducing the target to 1 hit point triggers a spellcasting check by you against DC 13. On a failed save, the target takes the damage as normal and drops to 0 hit points, and it can't be targeted again by this spell for 24 hours.

While inside the circle and affected by its magic, a character has disadvantage on checks and saving throws related to interrogation, asked questions or spells of similar effects (for example, zone of truth).

For all the subsequent casts of this spell on the same creature after the very first time, the creature may go mad. When a target is submitted to this spell again, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw when the spell ends or goes mad. The details of the madness are determined by the GM.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell slot or higher, the damage of this spell increases by 1d10.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Al-Jazari's Marvelous Duplicates.name: Al-Jazari's Marvelous Duplicates

3rd Level Conjuration (Ritual)

Casting Time: 1 Minute

Range: touch

Components: V, S, M (Identical flintstones worth at least 50 gd, which the spell consumes)

Duration: Concentration up to 1 minute

You touch an object that is tiny. It can be a magical item and can be consumable but it must not be rarer than Uncommon. Within 5 ft. of the object, an exact duplicate of the item appears with a small puff of smoke and stays there for 1 minute. If it is a consumable item, it can be used as normal and will affect normally.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the item can be Rare. If you cast it with a 9th level spell slot, the item can be Very Rare.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

3rd Level Divination

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range:1 Mile

Components: S, M (a leaf)

Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

You touch the ground and heighten your senses with magic. For the duration, you sense exactly how many humanoid creatures are present within range. If you desire, you can shorten the range to sense a limited area.

Class Lists: Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

Battle Focus.text:
@UUID[Item.HkUedKSNMZbaq05s]{Battle Focus}

3rd Level Enchantment

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: touch

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You touch a creature and improve their focus to an extreme level, granting them one of the following effects:

Combat Maneuvers: The target adds +2 to their attack rolls.

Arcane Determination: The target's spell save DC increases by 2.

3rd Level Transmutation

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: Self

Components: V

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You draw upon the lingering arcane wisdom of the Tang General Li Jin. As a part of the action you spent to cast this spell, you gain +2 bonus to your Armor Class and any saving throw you make. Until the spell ends, you can use your bonus action to grant three allies of your choice the following magnificent abilities, each of which lasts until the start of your next turn (you can choose other allies or the same ones when you use this again with another bonus action).

Magical Weapons: If not already magical, the weapons they hold are counted as magical weapons for the duration and deal an extra 1d4 force damage.

Precision Attack: They have 1d4 bonus to their attack rolls and damage rolls.

Hammering Strikes: For the duration, one of the hits made by each of the targeted allies forces the creatures that are hit by them to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target falls prone. For example, if you have three allies affected by this spell, until the start of your next turn, three of them force each creature they hit to make a saving throw with this effect.

Resurgent Assault: You can choose to end the spell early by using an action to make one weapon attack. If the attack hits a creature, you force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take 6d8 thunder damage. The total damage makes up a pool. You can distribute the pool as temporary hit points among three allies of your choice within range.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Nightmare.name: Nightmare
Nightmare.text:
@UUID[Item.BeCpi0WDNLMj6IfB]{Nightmare}

3rd Level Illusion

Casting Time: 1 Minute

Range: 60 feet

Components: S, M (a hex doll)

Duration: 7 days

You put the seeds of nightmares in a creature within range that you can see. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or its dreams are polluted with fear and horror. When the creature attempts to take a long rest, instead it is forced to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it can't benefit from the rest and the creature's nightmares manifest into reality. A night terror creature is summoned within 10 feet of the creature. Normal exhaustion rules apply.

The spell can be removed early with a remove curse or a stronger spell.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Al-Jazari's Infernal Metals.name: Al-Jazari's Infernal Metals
Al-Jazari's Infernal Metals.text:
@UUID[Item.sFGVbckCdTheD8ch]{Al-Jazari's Infernal Metals}

4th Level Evocation

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: 30 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You affect shields, armor, weapons, and all kinds of objects that are made of metal that are nonmagical in the range of the spell. The wearers or the ones that are in physical contact with the objects take 5d8 fire damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

If the wearer is wearing armor and does not doff the armor when the spell ends, the armor melts away and deals 8d8 fire damage to the wearer.

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above the 4th.

Class Lists: Cleric, Wizard

Binding Darkness.name: Binding Darkness
Binding Darkness.text:
@UUID[Item.SDWhdsCgLV7wqdcK]{Binding Darkness}

4th Level Evocation

Casting Time: 1 reaction which can be triggered at the end of an ally's turn

Range: 30 feet

Components: V

Duration: Instantaneous

You utter the word of the deep and summon darkness that lies in the realm of Al-Ghaib. A 20-foot-radius sphere of blackness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point within range and lasting for the duration and is counted as a 4th level darkness spell. Creatures that enter the area for the first time or start their turn there must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they fall into despair and experience a horror of your choice; you can choose different outcomes for different creatures that failed the saving throw. The effect either is instantaneous or lasts until the end of your next turn. Creatures that succeeded on the saving throw take 2d6 psychic damage.

Enemies Around: They perceive every living creature as hostile and menacing. They are frightened of the nearest creature.

Mind Blast: They take 4d6 psychic damage.

Bound Ethereal: Otherworldly creatures (creatures that are not humanoid, beast, monstrosity, giant, or dragon) have advantage on attack rolls against them.

Smothering Darkness: They feel the very air is being sucked out of their lungs and receive extra damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier when they take damage. In addition, they have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock

Li Jin's Ultimate Command.name: Li Jin's Ultimate Command
Li Jin's Ultimate Command.text:
@UUID[Item.VChFU6TA20PE52P9]{Li Jin's Ultimate Command}

4th Level Transmutation

Casting Time: 1 reaction which can be triggered at the end of an ally's turn

Range: 30 feet

Components: V

Duration: Instantaneous

An ally you choose is inspired by the words you invoke that belonged to great Tang commander Li Jin. Using your reaction you can inspire them to force their limits. They play an additional turn right after their normal turn ends in the initiative order.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 6th level spell slot, you can include one more of your allies that at least played one turn in the initiative order to take another turn right after this one.

Class Lists: Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

Healing Litany.name: Healing Litany

@UUID[Item.E1HKJyTbtV3dszb1]{Healing Litany}

4th Level Abjuration (Ritual)

Casting Time: 1 action

Range:Self (30-foot radius)

Components: V, S, M (a rare wood from a tree at least hundred years old, worth at least 250 gd)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

A litany worthy of the skies above conjures an invisible aura with a 30-foot radius. The aura is centered on you and moves with you. Whenever a friendly creature damages or you damage a creature in the aura, you can use your reaction to heal an ally within the aura. The creature regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

In addition, if you take damage while the spell is active and your concentration is broken due to that damage, you can sacrifice your own vitality to help an ally within range. You can use your reaction to take an additional 2d8 necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, and one creature of your choice that you can see within range regains a number of hit points equal to twice the necrotic damage you take. Then the spell ends.

This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger

Al-Jazari's Wondrous Armory.name: Al-Jazari's Wondrous Armory
Al-Jazari's Wondrous Armory.text:
@UUID[Item.JEHt76LLtcYUk8Sp]{Al-Jazari's Wondrous Armory}

5th Level Transmutation

Casting Time: 10 Minutes

Range: 10 feet

Components: V, S, M (A shard taken from a blade or a rusty piece of armor that is at least a thousand years old and is worth 500 gd, which the spell consumes)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 hour

You choose up to 6 pieces of armor or weapons within 10 feet of you. When the casting of this spell is complete the armor and weapons are animated. You can summon a number of animated armor* or flying swords* with a total combined Challenge Rating of 2. For example, you can create 1 animated armor* and 4 flying swords*. The constructs take orders from you and act best as their ability allows them to. You must spend your bonus action to command them. Unless they take commands, they simply follow you and attack the nearest enemies or take dodge action.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Divine Agony.name: Divine Agony
Divine Agony.text:
@UUID[Item.eJEr9fGFVEDlep3P]{Divine Agony}

5th Level Evocation

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: 120 feet

Components: V, S, M (a whip)

Duration: Instantaneous

You invoke an avatar of pain, drawing eldritch strength from your suffering. You create a pool based on your maximum hit points. You choose a point within range and force each creature within a 20-foot radius to make a Constitution saving throw. You can distribute any number of damage to creatures from your pool to the ones that failed. For the spell to work, there must be at least two creatures in the radius, and you can't exceed half of the pool when assigning damage to a single creature.

Class Lists: Cleric

Omar's Justice.name: Omar's Justice
Omar's Justice.text:
@UUID[Item.3FA29IByZ7BO5Tfh]{Omar's Justice}

5th Level Evocation

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: 120 feet

Components: V

Duration: Special, concentration on certain occasions.

You utter the words that were spoken by the Caliph Omar when he condemned his own soldiers when they defied his orders. You choose any number of creatures within range and force them to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are condemned to a divine punishment chosen by you. On a success, they only take 4d6 psychic damage.

Murder Penalty: The target takes damage equal to all damage it's dealt to other creatures or constructs within 10 minutes.

Ban of Magic: The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw each time it attempts to cast a spell. On a failed save, the spell can't be cast, but the slot is not expended. On a successful save, the spell is normally cast, but the caster takes damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier + the spell's level (1, if it's a cantrip). It lasts for 1 minute and you must concentrate on this spell.

Limb for Limb: The target loses the ability to control one of their limbs, possibly a hand or a leg, it can't be the head. The target faces a penalty according to the limb. For hands, they can't hold a weapon or a shield with that hand. For legs, movement speed is reduced to half. You must concentrate on this spell and it lasts for 1 minute. If you are able to concentrate on it for a full minute, the limb is chopped off from the body, and the target takes 8d8 necrotic damage as well as a one level of exhaustion.

Scorching Eyes: The target's eyes start to feel hot. It has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and has disadvantage on attack rolls. You must concentrate on this spell, and it lasts for 1 minute. If you fully concentrate on it for a full minute, the target is blinded permanently; its eyes melt away, and the spell deals 8d8 fire damage to the target.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Withering Breath.name: Withering Breath
Withering Breath.text:
@UUID[Item.fniuby7mEpGjALrp]{Withering Breath}

5th Level Transmutation

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: 30 feet

Components: V

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You unleash an eldritch shout that defies the natural order. The metal objects within range that are not worn or carried are affected by your spell and instantly turn to rust. The objects that are worn or carried by other creatures are also affected if their owners fail their saving throws. You force each creature within range to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, any metal on them withers away in the form of rust. If there are magical objects made of metal, each requires separate saving throws. On a failed save, they lose their magical properties for the duration.

If your concentration is broken before the spell ends in a full minute, the objects being worn or carried by other creatures return to their normal state. However, if you concentrate for a full minute, they remain withered. Magical objects always gain their properties back after the spell ends.

Class Lists: Druid, Ranger

True Awareness.name: True Awareness
True Awareness.text:
@UUID[Item.bB6FLZKNecG9Zpqf]{True Awareness}

6th Level Divination

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: touch

Components: V, S, M (specially made peppermint worth at least 25 gd, which the spell consumes)

Duration: 1 Hour

For the duration, the creature you touch understands when it hears a lie, its passive Perception increases by 5, and has advantage on all Wisdom checks and saving throws.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Fate Intervened.name: Fate Intervened
Fate Intervened.text:
@UUID[Item.owAeAFg9GhycQv3b]{Fate Intervened}

6th Level Transmutation

Casting Time: 1 reaction, which you take after you roll for Initiative

Range: 30 feet

Components: V, S, M (an hourglass worth at least 150 gd)

Duration: Instantaneously

When you roll for Initiative, you choose up to five creatures (including you) that you can see within range. You force them to make Charisma saving throws. Creatures can fail the saving throw voluntarily. You roll 2d6 and add or subtract the result to their Initiative rolls. You can decide for each of the creatures separately.

At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, instead of rolling, you take the result as 12.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Danger Inbound.name: Danger Inbound
Danger Inbound.text:
@UUID[Item.pNbHKRTQczgebR9X]{Danger Inbound}

6th Level Abjuration

Casting Time: 1 reaction, which you take when you roll initiative or detect an enemy

Range: 30 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

When you cast this spell using a reaction, you and all voluntary creatures within range are transferred into an ethereal version of this world. You can perceive your surroundings as if they were somewhat blurry, and the sounds reach you via echo. For the duration, you and other creatures are undetectable except by creatures capable of true sight or by divine means. Other ways, such as see invisibility or detect magic, do not reveal your presence. However, you and your companions can't take actions that involve walking outside your current position, can't communicate with anyone outside this ethereal world, and can't cast any magic or activate a magic item. For the duration, no other effect can harm you, and all effects on you are suspended. The spell ends early if you use a bonus action to end it.

When the spell ends, you and your chosen companions appear back where they left. If a space is occupied then the creature appears in the nearest unoccupied space. If the environment changes drastically, such as due to a fire, earthquake or a spell, you or other creatures may be susceptible to an otherworldly danger decided by the GM.

If the spell ends, and you roll for initiative again, you have advantage on that roll. If the enemies did not expect you, the GM may decide on a surprise.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Herald of Doomsday.name: Herald of Doomsday
Herald of Doomsday.text:
@UUID[Item.krVIm7gFMVDpbbmm]{Herald of Doomsday}

7th Level Illusion

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: Self

Components: S, M (a piece of holy text)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You become the embodiment of your message, of the upcoming apocalypse. You briefly change your appearance suitable to your beliefs. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you for the duration. While they are frightened, they take 4d6 psychic damage at the start of each of their turns. After you concentrate on the spell for a full 1 minute, the creatures are still frightened and become paralyzed for 1d6 rounds.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock

Contact the Dead.name: Contact the Dead
Contact the Dead.text:
@UUID[Item.XT39Ox5Q7GWmFVul]{Contact the Dead}

7th Level Necromancy

Casting Time: 1 Minute

Range: 15 feet

Components: V, S, M (a branch of a rotten tree)

Duration: 10 minutes

You invoke the name of a dead humanoid. It must be its true name or legal name: a nickname or a pseudonym does not work (If there are multiple creatures with the same name, you must use something distinctive, like a title or a nickname, such as Thomas the Unholy, One-eyed Ibrahim, Jonathan son of Abel, or the like). Its spirit appears within 15 feet of you to converse. The spirit immediately makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is required to answer you truthfully. On a success, it can act however it desires, at the GM's discretion. In both cases the spirit does not know the saving throw it makes, and succeeding on it won't impose any disadvantage. On a failure, it feels the truth is the best option. You can talk to the spirit for 10 minutes. After the duration, it is returned to wherever it belongs.

Class Lists: Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Mind Swap.name: Mind Swap
Mind Swap.text:
@UUID[Item.jEVWeE4yHIBsxCiA]{Mind Swap}

8th Level Conjuration

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: 120 feet

Components: S

Duration: Concentration, up to 8 hours

You choose two creatures within range, which can include yourself. You force them to make Charisma saving throws. Creatures can fail voluntarily. If both of them fail the saving throw, you swap their minds. For example, if you swap minds with an ancient red dragon, your personality remains the same, but you use its stat block and it uses yours. This spell lets special effects or features be transferred within minds, such as you can using its fire breath and it can use your spells for the duration, but it does not let memories and feelings pass between creatures. For example, a dragon won't have access to your memories or vice versa.

Class Lists: Bard, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard

True Execution.name: True Execution
True Execution.text:
@UUID[Item.w7fr18Yvv1n7YrFR]{True Execution}

9th Level Necromancy

Casting Time: 1 Action

Range: 120 feet

Components: S

Duration: Instantaneous

You point your finger towards a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save it takes necrotic damage equal to half of its maximum hit points. On a success, it takes half as much. If a creature dies because of this spell, it can't be resurrected.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Warlock Pact Boons.name: Warlock Pact Boons
Warlock Pact Boons.text:
Pact of the Key

Your patron gives you a key marked with the essence of the cosmos. It holds many possible solutions to your obstacles and can be used for many marvelous deeds. The key also represents exploration and even conquest.

In Arabic, “Fatih” means conqueror, and it comes with the same root as the word “Miftah,” which means key.

The key is inscribed with runes or carvings depending on the nature of your patron. For fiends, it may have infernal runes on it, resembling sulfuric nature or blood. For djinnmasters (Warlock subclass introduced in Historica Arcanum: The City of Crescent), it may have Arabic carvings on it or miniatures on its keychain. These represent the key’s magical charges. It has charges equal to your Charisma modifier, and any spent use is refreshed when you finish a long rest.

While the key is on you, you always sense the nearest door, window or archway.

The key can be used as a spellcasting focus and it has other uses that you can activate by spending a charge as an action:

  • (1) It can be used to open any non magical locks. More than one key requires more charges, one for each.
  • (1) It can be used to lock any non magical lock. The DC to lockpick it increases by a number equal to your Charisma modifier.
  • (2) It can be used to detect traps and secret doors within 20 ft. of you. Natural hazards and natural blocks that hide a room do not count.
  • (2) You use it to open an invisible door in thin air. When you reach out to the opening, you can name a mundane object that is tiny and pull it out from there. Items must not be more expensive than 99 gd.
  • (3) It can be used to replicate the knock spell.
  • (3) It can be used to replicate the arcane lock spell.
  • (4) It can be used to replicate the misty step spell. Instead of vanishing into mist, you open an invisible door to the place you wish to teleport.

Pact of the Tool

Your patron’s love for crafts and all that is handmade resulted in this pact, and your patron gave you a magical ring. This magical ring can be used as a bonus action, and it immediately transmutes itself into an artisan toolof your choice. After the tool is created in this way, you are counted as proficient with it, and for all checks you use your Charisma modifier instead of any Ability Score necessary for the tool. It stays like that for 1 hour. Once you create a tool like this, you can change its form twice during that time. After 1 hour passes, or you drop to 0 hit points, the tool reverts to its original form.

If you craft an item using the tools and paying double, it is counted as a magical item, and you can enchant it with some magical abilities. You can have a total of 5 items enchanted this way. If you enchant a sixth one, the first of them loses its magical properties.

Enchanted Weapon: It gains +1 to damage rolls and attack rolls.

Improved Ammunition: You grant five pieces of ammunition you crafted +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.

Enchanted Armor: The wearer of the armor receives 2 damage less for each damage it takes.

Reinforced Shield: The shield grants +1 more Armor Class.

Magnificent Bottle: The liquid in the bottle becomes magical for 10 minutes and when consumed it gives the effects of a healing potion or a potion of resistance (your choice).

Delicious Food: Five people can eat this. If they consume the food you prepared during a short rest they gain a use of their Hit Dice back or gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus (consumer’s choice).

Hazardous Liquids: You produce a vial of acid or basic poison.

Wondrous Map: You chart a map or use an existing map to mark a location. You know its location in your mind and always know where it is.

Cobbler’s Boots: Wearer’s walking speed increases by 5 ft.

Miraculous Fixer: The object can be used to cast the mending spell as an action.

Warlock Invocations.name: Warlock Invocations
Warlock Invocations.text:
Blessed by the Patron

You can choose one of the options below when you choose this Invocation. This Invocation can be chosen multiple times:

  • Close Inspection: You gain proficiency in the Perception and Investigation skills.
  • Way of the Sage: You gain proficiency in the Arcana and History skills.
  • Keeper of the Woods: You gain proficiency in the Animal Handling and Survival skills.
  • Healer’s Hands: You gain proficiency in the Nature and Medicine skills.
  • Faithful’s Mind: You gain proficiency in the Religion and Insight skills.

In addition, you gain one tool proficiency of your choice.

Dimension Key

Prerequisite: Pact of the Key, Level 7 Warlock

By spending 5 charges you can cast the dimension door spell with your Key.

Eyes of the Primordial Spider

You gain blindsight with a range of 15 ft. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn’t behind total cover, even if you’re blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

Echoes of the Past

When you touch a creature, you can force them to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, you can choose one of the options below:

  • Learn 1d4 knowledge about their past. You choose the type of knowledge. For example, the name of their father, the last crime they committed, or something similar.
  • You learn their alignment.
  • You erase the last minute from their memory.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Eldritch Keychain

Prerequisite: Pact of the Key, Level 5 Warlock

You gain additional charges for your key that is granted by your patron. Extra charges depend on your proficiency bonus. You roll for your extra charges when you finish a long rest. Check out the table below to determine your extra charges.

Minstrel’s Talent

Prerequisite: Pact of the Tool

You can create any musical instrument with your ring. You are counted as proficient with it.

In addition, you learn a bard cantrip of your choice and a 1st level bard spell of your choice. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for both spells. You can cast the 1st-level spell without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can’t do it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Ultimate Toolkit

Prerequisite: Pact of the Tool

You can create any tool except vehicles and magical instruments (you must take Minstrel’s Talent for this ability) with your ring. You are counted as proficient with the tool you created. In addition, you choose a conjuration spell with a maximum level of 3rd, and you can cast it once without expending a spell slot.

Flashes from the Future

You can cast the augury spell as a ritual. When you reach 7th level, once a day, you can cast the divination spell without expending a spell slot. When you reach 9th level, once a day, you can cast the contact other plane spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast one of these spells (except augury), you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again this way.

Realmwalker

Prerequisite: Pact of the Key, Level 13 Warlock

As an action, you magically touch your Key to a solid surface, such as a stone wall or a tree, and turn it. A magical door appears and you must make a DC 13 Charisma check. On a successful check, you choose where the door leads: another plane of existence or another unoccupied space within the plane you are currently on. If you fail, a random door appears and if not closed by you within the next 1d4 rounds, a creature that is related to the other side of the door crosses through the threshold, and it must have a CR that is at least equal to half your level. For example, a door to the Inferno could bring a chain devil with it.

You can’t use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

Foreword.name: Foreword
Foreword.text:
Your Journey

This section is optional. These are not rules meant to be followed letter by letter but inspirational hooks that we hope will spark some great ideas for player characters. It is worth noting that we purposefully did not put gameplay-heavy choices into these tables, including races and classes. Roll, read, or ignore these tables as you wish when you are making a new character to start your adventure in the world of Historica Arcanum. We recommend that you give luck and fate a chance; after all, we don’t get to decide where we will start our journey in the real world.

Origins: These tables will give you information about your birth, childhood, and family. Also, there is one special table about the beliefs of your childhood community.

Personal Decisions: These tables will give information about your adventurer background, your class, your past education, and your profession if you have any.

Life Experiences: In this section you will learn about your character’s past deeds and experiences. Results may spark new ideas about ideology, life goals, phobias, or even deep personal traits.

Supplementary Tables: These tables are here to support the main tables.
