Life Events Table

@UUID[Macro.vfB9EmZxkTU45lYr]{Roll Life Event Table}

D100

LIFE EVENT

1

Unbeknownst to you, your significant other has been working for the enemy.

2

After a horrible accident, you were stripped of your rank in the army.

3

You embarked on a lengthy journey, and upon your return, your family was nowhere to be found.

4

You fell deeply in love, only to discover that they were a ghost.

5

You have been followed by the same crow throughout your entire life. It appears to desire something specific from you, but it is unable to communicate (the speak with animals spell reveals that the crow is speaking in Ancient Egyptian).

6

You have never experienced a single dream throughout your entire life. Suddenly, you find yourself within a dream, and a voice is calling you to come and find them.

7

You have witnessed a horrifying murder, yet the victim returned to your village the following day with a sinister grin on their face.

8

Throughout your entire life, you have been catching glimpses of a veiled figure just at the corner of your eyes, a presence that no one else seems to perceive. Since “it” happened the figure has disappeared.

9

One day, you woke up in a different body and found yourself in an unfamiliar place where no one recognized you, not even yourself.

10

You made the foolish decision to deceive one of the most influential businessmen in your region and have been in hiding ever since.

11

You discovered an incredibly valuable gem, yet you are the sole individual able to perceive it.

12

You stumbled upon a buried parchment that purportedly holds the world's secrets, but it's written in a language that no one seems to recognize.

13

You found yourself burdened with an incredibly heavy debt to a warlord, leading to the kidnapping of your family for ransom.

14

Someone has stolen your beloved dog, and you are now on a quest for revenge.

15

A con artist made a promise to double your entire sum of money if you entrusted it to them. However, they lost it all, resulting in your family disowning you.

16

Just before your mentor's passing, they disclosed the existence of a substantial hidden treasure that could guarantee wealth for generations in your lineage. Unfortunately, they forgot to specify the exact location before their demise, leaving you with the knowledge that it's somewhere in the vicinity of Jerusalem.

17

Your community holds the belief that you were the chosen child destined to bring them greatness. However, you actually switched places with your twin sibling, who was the true chosen one. As the pressure from the community continues to mount, you are compelled to locate your twin, who was sent to live with your aunt many years ago.

18

Unbeknownst to you, a fairy has fallen in love with you. You can't fathom why you're incredibly fortunate in every facet of your life except for matters of the heart.

19

Throughout your life, you've received telepathic messages from an unknown source. While you've been able to witness what they see, pinpointing their location has been an enigma. Until now.

20

You formed a close friendship with a mimic whose sole delight is to listen to stories. Resembling a mirror in shape, you carry this mimic with you. In return for sharing captivating tales, the mimic vowed to safeguard you, and this unique bond thrives as long as you continue to feed it with engaging narratives.

21

You find yourself recalling memories that don't belong to you – these are remnants from your previous life when you possessed great power.

22

One day, a door materialized within your house, a door that had not previously existed. Despite your persistent attempts, it remained resolutely sealed. Curiously, intricate carvings adorned its surface, guiding your attention to a mosque in Cairo. It became evident that this mosque might hold the key to unlocking the door's secrets.

23

As the offspring of one of the most prominent families in your hometown, you are entangled in a longstanding vendetta between your family and another. In a bid to preserve a fragile peace, you were designated as a sacrificial pawn. However, you managed to elude this grim fate and escape.

24

After a ritual gone wrong, you are now stuck with a completely useless and incredibly annoying demon by your side, who steadfastly refuses to assist you in any manner. However, they prove to be an exceedingly intriguing character.

25

Having struck a life-saving agreement with a dragon, you are now obligated to periodically locate new lairs for them, lest the dragon follow through on their promise to consume you in a most gruesome manner.

26

You repeatedly encounter individuals who bear an uncanny resemblance to you, yet the moment your eyes meet, they hastily flee. Despite your efforts, you have never managed to catch up to any of them.

27

Abducted as a child for ransom, your family's apparent indifference led your captor to raise you as a fellow criminal. In an unexpected turn, they proved to be the best parental figure you could have hoped for.

28

A curse cast upon you by a fairy has had an unexpected outcome. Instead of rendering you unlovable, it has made everyone perceive you as incredibly adorable, increasing your Charisma score to 17, if it isn’t higher already.

29

Your reflection has gained sentience, representing the most exasperating aspects of your personality. As a result, you actively evade mirrors and any reflective surfaces.

30

Each time you drift into slumber, your mind immerses itself in incredibly lifelike dreams that unfold as if they were reality. Unknown to you, you are astral projecting during these moments, yet your abilities remain beyond your control. You had never realized this until you saw a familiar face.

31

For a significant duration, you served as the right-hand person to a satrap. However, your position was terminated after you delivered an incorrect message that jeopardized their identity. Consequently, your memories were erased, and you were left to navigate your path independently. Nevertheless, intermittent flashes of your former life manage to resurface in your consciousness.

32

One fateful day, you awoke from a profound slumber to find a knife clenched in your hands and your entire family brutally slaughtered. As you hurriedly stepped outside in a state of panic, the horrifying reality became apparent: your entire village had been mercilessly slaughtered. Since that harrowing moment, you've been in a constant state of evasion, fleeing from the law.

33

You had been employed by an amoral mercenary leader for years. Your employer saw no problems in slaying children, burning villages, or torturing ordinary people. When you were already fed up with him, he learned that he was not supposed to push your buttons the hard way. Now that you have killed their leader, the whole mercenary gang is trying to hunt you down.’’

34

Having undergone rigorous training among the Hashashins, you stood on the brink of receiving your inaugural assignment. Yet, fate intervened when you overheard your supervisor unveiling the true character of the individual you were meant to assassinate. That very night, you made your escape, vowing never to return to that path.

35

Your master endeavored to ensnare a djinni within a bottle, similar to Aladdin's tale, yet the magic misfired, incarcerating you within the vessel instead. Accompanying your master, you embarked on a global quest to unearth a means of liberation. Only upon his demise did you finally escape the confines of the bottle, reemerging in Cairo.

36

Once a soldier within the Saladin’s naval fleet, you found yourself in the throes of a tumultuous night of revelry. As morning broke, you awoke to discover that your ship had set sail without you, leaving you stranded in an unfamiliar land. Bereft of any means to return home, you now faced the daunting task of navigating this foreign territory.

37

Raised within the opulent confines of Jerusalem's palace as a member of the aristocracy, your life took a grievous turn several years back. Due to a mere rumor, your father and your entire family were exiled from the palace, forcing you to relinquish your privileged status. Since then, you've been navigating the unfamiliar realm of the common folk, endeavoring to find your place in this new world.

38

Your heart stopped when you were a child, leading to your death and subsequent rebirth. Ever since then, you have possessed the ability to see people who remain unseen by others.

39

You nursed an injured stray puppy back to health. From that day on, you have gained a loyal friend who was there for you in all your adventures.

40

When you were a teen, you were kidnapped by an entity of draconic origin and set aside to be food later on. However, upon seeing your birthmark, the creature let you go. Ever since, you have wondered what was so special about your birthmark that you were spared that day.

41

Your mother was a beloved witch and healer of your village. When witch hunters killed her, you vowed revenge.

42

You were experimented on by a group of scholars in the House of Wisdom. They kidnapped you and subjected you to torturous experiments, resulting in serious trauma and the acquisition of arcane powers.

43

Every year, one person from your village goes missing for a few days and returns with a changed appearance, sporting a completely different face and character. They resume their daily routines as if nothing has happened. No one but you seems to notice these changes. You didn't pay much attention to this phenomenon until your sister came back with a new face.

44

One day, you are stopped by a strange old person. Tears are streaming down their face, and they keep telling you how much they love you. No matter how many times you ignore them or try to get rid of them, they keep finding you. They tell you that you haven’t met them yet, but when you do, you’ll fall in love, too.

45

After winning a bet against a warlock, out of anger from losing, he told you that you have been cursed to die by the hand of a horse. You have been avoiding horses ever since.

46

While living in Cairo, you were digging into the ground to build a strong foundation for your new house. However, the area you were excavating turned out to be the grave of an Egyptian general. As a result, their soul became bound to you, and they now accompany you wherever you go. Only you have the ability to see him, and he is quite a stubborn individual.

47

You served as the food tester for the king. One day, while you were completely unaffected, the king suddenly died. It was later revealed that the king had been allergic to a spice that you were not allergic to. Despite your innocence, you were blamed for the incident and narrowly escaped being executed by beheading.

48

You were abducted by a cult with the intention of being sacrificed. Just moments before they could carry out the act, an invisible power intervened and mercilessly wiped out the entire cult. Miraculously, you emerged as the sole survivor of that fateful day. However, the remaining members of the cult, those who did not attend that particular ritual, hold you responsible for the devastation, and now they are relentlessly hunting you down.

49

For centuries, tales have circulated about a family heirloom prophesied to bestow wealth and power upon the entire lineage, should it ever be found. This legendary artifact is said to be housed within the Old Temple. Despite being dismissed as mere bedtime stories for generations, you made the daring decision to embark on a quest to locate it. Regrettably, the inner chambers of the temple are heavily guarded by the knights of Guy de Lesignon.

50

Throughout your entire life, you’ve kept seeing the spirit of a Hashashin everywhere you go. It was somewhat easy to ignore him until the day he finally spoke to you.

51

Having managed to escape from an emir’s harem, you find yourself on the run, evading pursuit. Though your time within the harem was brief, you did receive some training, granting you a degree of arcane knowledge that could prove invaluable in your current circumstances.

52

Operating covertly as a monster hunter, you maintain the façade of a lumberjack in your official role. However, individuals who are aware of your true nature engage your services to safeguard against these creatures.

53

Upon the passing of your parents, you stumbled upon a letter hidden within your home. To your astonishment, the letter unveils a long-held secret: you were abducted as a child and raised under false pretenses by your parents. The letter repeatedly alludes to your father's immense power, tempered by a lurking danger. However, it withholds the true identity of your father, leaving you with a cryptic trail of clues to decipher. Determined to unveil the truth, you embark on a mission to follow the hints provided in the letter and finally uncover your father's identity.

54

For years, your sister persistently claimed to be the wife of Saladin. Her assertions, however, were met with disbelief, and many considered her to be delusional. Despite her pleas falling on deaf ears, one fateful night, a contingent of soldiers arrived and forcibly took her away. You have been looking for her ever since.

55

Your father held a distinguished position as a prominent knight within Baldwin's court, aligning himself with Tiberius' faction. His life was tragically cut short by a mysterious and unsolved murder, leaving his killer's identity concealed. In the course of your journey, you discovered his cherished dagger among his belongings. Strangely, from the moment you took hold of the dagger, an extraordinary connection was forged – enabling you to perceive your father's presence. Through this ethereal link, he shared the identity of his murderer and his unquenchable thirst for retribution.

56

(If the PC is older than 40 years old) The love of your life, an unforgettable figure who left an indelible mark on your heart, was a summer romance that blossomed during your youthful years. This person embodied all your desires and dreams. Yet, inexplicably, they vanished from your life without a single trace. However, recent events have taken an astonishing turn. A wandering painter happened upon your village not long ago, their canvases displaying a range of scenes. To your astonishment, one of these paintings depicted your long-lost love, frozen in time, bearing no signs of aging. This artwork was crafted merely months ago in the city of Jerusalem.

57

You have discovered a map that displays the locations of treasures. Every time you unearth a treasure, a new marking appears on the map. You've been diligently following the map to discover treasure chests and jewelry, which you intend to sell to sustain yourself. This marks the first instance where the marking, situated atop Jerusalem, is twice as large as the previous ones.

58

You had served as the palace entertainer for many years. However, you were sold to another king and were in transit to your new destination. Tragically, during the journey, your chaperone suffered a heart attack and passed away. As a result, you find yourself stranded in an unfamiliar land.

59

You were raised by a single mother on the outskirts of a small village. The house you moved into had been abandoned for some time due to its haunted reputation. However, your mother didn't mind, and neither did you, because the ghosts residing in the house became your closest friends and essentially raised you. You made a promise to these spirits that you would find a way to bring them back to life. This promise became your life's purpose.

60

You have carved out a livelihood by studying the stars and unraveling their hidden meanings. The constellations and their arrangements serve as your guide to foreseeing what lies ahead. Individuals from around the globe seek your insights to gain a glimpse into their future. One fateful day, you received a summons from a princess.

61

Throughout your life, you held onto an imaginary friend. Even as you matured, this companionship remained unbroken. As time advanced and your features became more defined, you gradually noticed an uncanny resemblance between your imaginary friend and an older iteration of yourself.

62

You have discovered a thick notebook among the belongings of your late father. It had belonged to your grandfather, who was evidently an adventurer, and these are the logs of his escapades. Within its pages, a few unfinished quests remain, which could possibly be undertaken even today.

63

Abducted and raised by a healer warlock in the heart of a forest, you were released to forge your own path upon reaching adulthood. As years flowed by, a startling realization settled in – the whereabouts of the warlock who had raised you had slipped from your memory entirely. The knowledge of your true parents remained a mystery, and the yearning to unearth your origins intensified.

64

Once a prosperous caravan master, wealth flowed through your veins. However, a harsh period of relentless security breaches and a chilling assassination attempt shattered your world. Faced with no recourse, you made the daring choice to orchestrate your own demise and slip into the shadows of hiding. Now, consumed by the need for answers, you are determined to unveil the hands that stole your life from you.

65

You have found an old book. It seems that someone has written a long novel about the protagonist’s life story. The first few chapters eerily resemble your life. In the fifth chapter, it exactly matches your life. As the story moves along, the character sets out on a long journey that changes their life.

66

You are a priest or an imam, and you have been assigned to a new church in the unfamiliar land of Jerusalem.

67

Among the belongings of your late mother, you have found a worn-down pile of letters. They were written by your father, whom you have never met. It seems as though he had been sending funds to your mother for your care and inquiring about your life. You notice that the letters have been signed by a knight. Filled with curiosity, you decide to find him, hoping that you might inherit his knighthood when he passes.

68

You had been an emir who dared to offend a shah. Prior to your execution, an old friend orchestrated your escape. Now, you are wanted by the palace and find yourself on the run.

69

Raised in a cult your entire life, you were devoted to its beliefs. One night, you were abruptly awakened by whispers outside your door. Inexperienced cult members had been assigned to capture you for an upcoming ritual sacrifice. Their panic was evident. Seizing the opportunity presented by their incompetence, you managed to escape. However, you remain uncertain whether the cult is still actively searching for you or not.

70

You were an incredibly talented calligrapher. One day, you received a special pen as a gift and were instructed to use it only on special occasions. Upon using the pen, you realized that it possessed arcane powers. The things you wrote with the pen had a tendency to come true, although the effects were limited to minor things. Just as you were becoming adept at using the pen and achieving more significant miracles, it was stolen from you. The only distinctive detail you could recall about the thief was their bright red hair. Now, your sole aspiration in life is to recover your stolen pen.

71

You have spent years working as a guide for caravans. As your master's retirement approaches, you are poised to take over the business. However, there is another candidate vying for the same position. Both of you have been striving to maintain a favorable relationship with your master and seize any available business opportunities. The most recent assignment involved leading a caravan to Jerusalem. Surprisingly, your rival allowed you to take charge of this task without any dispute.

72

Due to your frequent work-related travels, you found yourself forming separate families in three different cities. On a particular day, as you were about to enter one of your homes, a chilling sight met your eyes: all three of your partners stood there, their gazes filled with vengeance.

73

Having been betrayed by your closest friend, you've been consumed by a desire for revenge. You've been on a quest to settle the score for a while now. The most recent information places them in Jerusalem.

74

As a highly skilled painter specializing in religious murals, you have received a prestigious commission. Your task involves creating a mural for a church located in Jerusalem.

75

From a young age, you have been deeply immersed in the teachings of Sufism. Integrating music into your prayers, you've skillfully played the oud and earned a revered place among your community's musicians. However, as time passed, you felt a calling to visit the sacred religious sites that hold profound significance to you. This inner urging led you to embark on a meaningful journey.

76

In the lands that ruled by the Seljuk Empire, you served as an alchemist in a manor, spending years trying to uncover the mysteries of the universe for patrons whose values clashed with your own. Having had enough, you orchestrated your escape and are, finally, free.

77

You were a well-established priest. One day, a person came to your church for confession, wearing a mask. They began talking about their life and started coming for confession every week. However, you never knew who they were. As they spoke, you found yourself falling deeply in love with them. One day, during a confession, they revealed that they would be moving to Jerusalem and that this would be the last time you would see them. Unable to banish them from your thoughts, you are determined to uncover their true identity.

78

You had a happy home with your partner and child. It was a peaceful sanctuary until that fateful day when individuals from the palace arrived and abducted your child. Your partner was slain as they attempted to intervene. Now, all that consumes your thoughts is vengeance and the determination to locate your missing child.

79

For years, you have been striving to initiate a revolution, but unfortunately, nobody is willing to join your cause.

80

You have been the owner of a bookstore for years. The best part about your store is the fact that it is immensely haunted. However, all the ghosts that live there are truly intriguing scholars and writers who simply didn't want to depart from the world of literature. One day, one of the ghosts opens up to you about how they died. Now, all you want to do is seek revenge on their behalf.

81

You were the son of an Ottoman padishah. When your father passed away, your brother assumed the throne, and according to tradition, he was meant to eliminate you to ensure there would be no one else with a claim to the throne. However, you managed to escape before he could carry out his intentions.

82

You had a profound purpose in life and were willing to go to any length to attain it. You came remarkably close to achieving your goal. However, right as you were on the verge of obtaining what you desired, you had an epiphany and recognized that you were, in fact, the antagonist. Overwhelmed by this realization, you chose to abandon everything in order to seek redemption for your wrongdoings.

83

You are a very accomplished cartographer, and your life’s goal is to create an accurate map of the inner chambers of the Dome of the Rock.

84

You are a famous bard. Someone has stolen your name and is using your reputation. Their songs are not as good, but because of your fame, they are making great money even though their performances are subpar. You have decided to catch them in the act. You follow them around, going to their last known locations, but you always seem to be one step behind.

85

You have lost all your memory, and you don't even remember who you are. Your last bits of memories are returning to you in flashes. In your last memory you are sitting in a hut, sipping tea, while a great church looms in the distance with a very distinct bell.

86

Your biggest desire was to join the Crusades and prove yourself, but you were deemed unfit. After months of training, you will show all who doubted you that you have what it takes.

87

Your mother believed you to be a messiah and protected you your whole life, preparing you for your eternal duty. After her death you have set out for Jerusalem to fulfill your destiny.

88

The love of your life ran off on the night of your wedding with another person. They were last seen headed to Jerusalem. Your revenge awaits you in the city.

89

A traveling merchant announced themselves as a servant of Baldwin IV to you. They convinced you that you made the best potato soup in all the realms and should be awarded for it. He told you that word was sent to the king and he awaits you to give you riches and a medal for your marvelous work. At first you didn’t believe it, but after being hyped by the entire village you set out for Jerusalem to collect your rewards.

90

After years of non-communication, your estranged father sent you a letter. He was locked up in Jerusalem because of a misdemeanor and pleads with you to come save him.

91

On a drunken night you found yourself in bed with the Lord’s wife. You ran off to Jerusalem, both to save your head and to repent.

92

The last few months have been lost to you, as if your brain was under command of someone else. You woke up in a caravan, not knowing why you’re there or where you’re headed.

93

You have been running away from someone your whole life. A long life…you have run so long that you forgot who you were running from. But run you must. That’s all you’ve known.

94

For the past year, an incredibly vivid dream has been haunting you. You see yourself looking down on Jerusalem, holding the hands of your future partner. You know this is where your happiness lies.

95

You have been bought off of your parents by some Bedouin soldiers. During one night of debauchery, they loosened their watch over you, and you ran off until you snuck into a caravan that’s headed towards God knows where.

96

You have been possessed by a fairy but you eventually became good friends, because it made your life better and eventually stopped possessing you. All along, it was feeling sorry for you and decided to help you to improve the quality of your life.

97

You made a bargain with a local seer to use his powers for gain, but on one of the darkest nights, you approached his house and heard him talking to some weird crystal ball and a vicious voice answering. You ran away and have not looked back since.

98

Your ship sailing through the Mediterranean wrecked on a small and probably uncharted island. You spent months there, and you were sure there were other people who tried to hurt you but you never met one of them. Eventually, a ship passing by saved you but you never shook the feeling of being watched.

99

You found an interesting compass from a stranger in the market. The compass led you to a tree-house, and you found a lamp in it. There was a creature in the lamp that declared that it could grant you a wish. You accidentally wished for some nonsense, a very simple thing; it actually happened, but you never heard of the creature again.

100

You defeated gods, slain dragons, fought off ancient krakens at sea, and wrestled giants at the top of the clouds. Or so you thought until you were put in a mental institution proper to the area you live. You were eventually healthy enough to be released, or did you imagine that as well?

Forge Your Own Holy Order.name: Forge Your Own Holy Order
Forge Your Own Holy Order.text:
The Kingdom of Jerusalem and the Holy Lands are teeming with knightly orders and mercenaries that are fighting for their creed, gold, and glory! Some of the orders are well known throughout the world, such as the Knights Templar and Knights Hospitaller.

In this section, you as the Game Master have the option to create your own order of the knights, guild of traders, charity organizations and similar factions that you can bring to your own games, or even allow your player characters to form and lead their own orders! To decide their numbers, ideals, patrons and other aspects of an order, you can take inspiration from the tables below.

Most of the sections below go well beyond the Historica Arcanum setting, so you can use everything here for your own homebrew games!

Step I: Deciding the Essentials for the.name: Step I: Deciding the Essentials for the Narrative
Step I: Deciding the Essentials for the.text:
Step I: Deciding the Essentials for the Narrative

Is your order a religious one? Which religion does your order follow?

The mention of an order of chivalry may sound very Christian, but your order also can be of another religion, such as Islam or Judaism. It is theorized that Christian orders were modeled after the ribat, Arabic fortified religious institutions, which served both medical and military means.

Relıgıon

explanatıon

Christian

There are many Christian Knight Orders in history itself, which are also detailed in this book. Christian orders are highly connected with the idea of the Crusades, as it gave way to the birth of the orders.

Muslim

Muslim orders mostly focus on spreading the religion and advancement of the armies of Islam. There are also many charity orders and purely scholarly orders as well. There are many ideas for these aspects in later tables.

Judaism

Jewish orders are mostly founded for the preservation of their faith or protecting of the trade, as well as for scholarly purposes and charity.

Zoroastrian

Its followers are highly diminished due to the rise and spread of Islam in Persian lands. Most of Zoroastrian orders are founded for the preservation of ancient texts and scholarly aspirations.

Pagan

Surviving pagan religions are hard to encounter in the Holy Lands; however, if your game needs one, a pagan order can be created. They can be formed to protect holy sites, fight against invaders, or similar reasons.

Occultist

The members of this order follow eldritch teachings and arcane powers as devout followers, forming a fringe religion distant from any earthly beliefs.

Other

Your order might be from other religions, such as Shintoism, Confucianism, or other religions around the world.

What are the main goals of your order?

@UUID[Macro.AHtpAUtqgLRSEXEb]{Roll goal Table}

d10

goal

explanatıon

Your order focuses on converting crowds through the activities of missionaries and other members of the clergy.

3

Craft

Your order is put together to unite the members of the same craft and protect their rights, such as masons, smiths, tailors, and more.

4

Trade

Your order was founded to protect and control the trade. It could extend to mercenaries, sellswords, and even religious charities for the distribution of money and medicine.

5

Charity

Your order was founded to help people in need-for example, the orphans, the wartorn citizens, and more.

6

Hospital

Your order was founded to cure illnesses and take care of those who have fallen to heavy diseases.

7

Scholarly

Your order was founded to do research, collect books, and pursue science.

8

Religious

Your order was founded to maintain and protect religious texts, theological researches and providing spiritual leadership to common folk.

9

Hunt the Wicked

Your order was founded to hunt down threats to civilization, mostly from the realm of the arcane.

10

Collect Artifacts

Your order was founded to pursue a set of artifacts, to safekeep their power, to abuse their potential, or to restrict the access to these powers by the unworthy.

An order may have more than one goal and carry more aspects than it seems. A crusader order may also have charitable institutions and people specialized in this. Also, some goals can be hidden and the order may have steered away from its original purposes.

Not all of the people committed to the order were knights, and they did not especially have to be skilled in fighting.

The Influence of the Order

Titles & Ranks.name: Titles & Ranks
Titles & Ranks.text:
Titles & Ranks

Hierarchy is the most important aspect of an order or a guild. The chain of command regulates the daily errands and improves the quality of work, given orders, preparations, and practically everything inside an organization. Without it, the organization is doomed to fail, and it is important to designate the right person for an important rank.

The leaders of the organization can possess many ranks depending on the type and the greatness of the organization. The leader of a small guild may not be as important as a lieutenant of a great order of knights. The ranks represented here are for relatively large and influential organizations.

RANK

EXPLANATION

PossIble AbIlItIes/BenefIts

Head/s

The ones with absolute power, deciding the fate of the organization.

Charisma boosts, Help and similar order-giving abilities, most powerful magic items, most knowledge about the world, Insight and Perception related abilities, powerful guards and protectors, intelligent advisors, large economic power. High mental Ability Scores (such as Wisdom or Charisma) are needed.

Leading Administrative Ranks

The ones that take actions regarding the organization’s legislative business, economics, diplomatics, member relations or similar situations. Usually have their own initiative for relatively large issues that are encountered within the order.

Charisma related abilities, powerful guards, moderate economic power. Possibly high mental Ability Scores (such as Wisdom and Intelligence)

Military Command

If the order has a military branch or a militia, this rank commands, trains, and leads this armed force. Usually the most experienced or formidable commander/warrior among them.

Some useful abilities from Fighter class (Action Surge, Second Wind, etc.), abilities that can inspire soldiers, quality armor, possible magic weapons, large economic power and good physical Ability Scores (such as high Strength or Constitution)

Bureaucrats

The ones handling the communication and business between the higher ranks and the ranks below. The position most open to corruption and bribery from outside.

Influence of regular members and lower ranks, great knowledge about the order, minor economic power.

Lieutenants

The ones that take out dangerous duties outside of the organization, usually raids, bodyguarding for higher ranks, carrying out scout missions and usually maintaining contact between military leaders and regular armed forces.

Good weapons and armor, the ability to defend themselves from regular threats, good relations with the higher ranks.

Intelligence

The ones that spy on necessary people, both internal and external targets. Carrying out special missions in secrecy.

Possibly high Dexterity and Stealth boosts. Necessary equipment, quality weapons, and forged documents.

Experienced Members

Mostly older and good servants to the organization, leading the newer generations with their wisdom and experiences. Usually keeping them in line. Having moderate authority and usually answering to higher ranks.

Possibly high Wisdom and limited authority over the regular members. Respect and sympathy of new and younger members. Minor economic power.

Specialists

Depending on the nature of the order, there must be many people specializing in the area. For example: Knights for Holy orders, nurses and doctors for hospitals, rangers and guides for orders founded to protect the pilgrims.

-

Favored Members

Mostly young, talented, and promising members of the organization. They are usually awarded with responsibility and the benefits that come with it.

Better accommodations and living standards than regulars, better equipment, and better economic power, if any.

Regulars

The main branch of the order, usually the lowest part in the hierarchy. Taking orders from all higher ranks and consisting of the largest portion of an organization, usually dealing with all sorts of tasks.

Depending on the influence and power of the order, respect and/or fear of the local folk.

New Recruits

Rookies of the order, usually training and learning the ways of the organization, hierarchy and more.

-

Advancing Ranks

  • Religious Orders: Through dedication and hard work.
  • Knight Orders: Through success in battles and campaigns.
  • Trade Guilds: Through the quality of craftsmanship and working towards the benefit of the guild.
  • Mercenary Groups: Through the money gained.
  • Scholarly Foundations: Through scientific research and hard work.
  • Charities: Through getting donations and helping the sick.

For Player Characters to advance ranks, side quests, important missions, challenges, duels, tests, and inquiries may be issued by the higher-ranking NPCs. This may create the perfect opportunity for the player characters to prove their worth and strength.

Abilities and Benefits of the Ranks

In this section, there are some examples of features that could be given to varying ranks and title holders of an organization, which can be added to their stat block.

It is also advised to check the Spells, Feats & Items section in the Character Options chapter to further arm and adorn your NPCs in orders and organizations.

Head/s

@UUID[Macro.mFusMmKSYCQrhSKQ]{Roll Head/s Table}

d6

feature

1

Strict Order: As a bonus action, the leader can give a verbal order to a member of the organization that can hear him/her/them. The member has advantage on the next ability check tied to the order.

2

Mental Fortitude: The leader has advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

3

Unyielding Mind: The leader has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

4

Judge of Character: The leader has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to determine a lie.

5

Charismatic Leader: The leader can roll a d6 when it fails a Charisma check and potentially turn it into a success. It can do this 4 times a day and restore expended uses after finishing a long rest.

6

Wise Leader: The leader can understand the mood and the mental condition of a member directly by looking at them and have advantage on Wisdom checks related to the members of the order.

If a player reaches this rank:

If the organization is a well-known and/or an important one, and a player character climbs the top of the faction, it may receive special bonuses other than the ones mentioned above, such as:

  • Ability Score increase in Charisma, Intelligence or Wisdom.
  • Expertise in Intimidation, Persuasion or Insight skills.
  • Access to special magic items of the organization.
  • Loyal comrades, guards, or other people who execute their command without question.
  • Deep connections with powerful figures.

Recommended Characteristics

Languages: The leader knows at least three languages of GM’s choice.

Skills: At least 3 skills from: History, Insight, Religion, Nature, Persuasion, Deception, Intimidation, Arcana.

Weapons: Depending on the type of the organization. If a military organization: simple and martial weapons.

Armor: At least Medium Armor proficiency and Shields proficiency. If a highly military organization, such as Templar Knights, also Heavy Armor proficiency may apply.

Tools: Proper Artisan’s tools, a gaming set

Spellcasting: Entirely dependent on the setting and the type of the order. Religious order leaders may be of Cleric class

Knight Order leaders may be of Paladin or Fighter class. For the Historica Arcanum universe, it is advised that unless really important, most of the leaders possess none, very limited or low-level spellcasting.

Economy: Really deep pockets that can make a big sum of buying at once, providing tools, luxury goods, weapons and similar tems easily.

Class: Some abilities and features from Cleric, Fighter, Rogue, Barbarian or Paladin can be used to make the head stronger.

Leading Administrative Rank

@UUID[Macro.ILEe3GyClX3kknP1]{Roll Leading Administrative Rank Table}

d4

feature

1

2

3

4

Reaching Hand: The member can spend up to 1 week to gain enough money for mundane but important items and goods. For example, enough money to buy weapons and armor for a small militia. This could be done by exploiting a hook, getting a debt, extracting a favor, or a similar situation.

If a player reaches this rank:

A player may climb to this rank with years of service, outstanding feats of leadership accomplishments, or another way. They can receive these:

  • Expertise in relevant skills or tools.
  • Connections with important figures.
  • Access to important items, information, and secrets.
  • Some form of protection from external threats: it could be good armor or an efficient guard or two.

Recommended Characteristics

Languages: The member knows at least two languages at the GM’s discretion.

Skills: At least 2 skills from: Investigation, Insight, History, Persuasion

Weapons: Depending on the organization’s form, possibly simple weapons.

Armor: Light Armor, and if the nature of the organization lets it: Medium Armor and Shields

Tools: Proper artisan tools

Spellcasting: Very limited, if any.

Economy: Deep pockets, enough to fund a comfortable lifestyle. Class: Abilities and features from Rogue classes and subclasses.

feature

3

4

5

6

If a player reaches this rank:

A player character may achieve this rank through heroic deeds, exceptional combat and strategy skills, or years of service.

  • Finest set of armor and appropriate weapons. A magical one if possible.
  • Better reaction abilities that decrease damage or increase the Armor Class.
  • An Ability Score increase in physical ones.

Recommended Characteristics

Languages: Two languages of the GM’s choice.

Skills: At least two skills from: Athletics, Perception, Insight, Survival, Intimidation

Weapons: Simple weapons and martial weapons.

Armor: Light Armor, Medium Armor, Heavy Armor and Shields

Bureaucrats

@UUID[Macro.EXJg35Wkyk69mbhj]{Roll Bureaucrats Table}

2

3

If a player reaches this rank:

A player character may reach this rank through hard work, bribery, or a similar way.

  • Loyal servants, eyes on other departments, and similar people working for the character.
  • Deep pockets coming from controlling the money transition and legal matters.
  • Skill and tool proficiencies related to Intelligence and Charisma.

Recommended Characteristics

Languages: Two languages of the GM’s choice.

Skills: At least two skills from: Insight, Persuasion, Deception, Intimidation, Perception

Weapons: Simple weapons

Armor: Light Armor and Medium Armor, maybe shields if the order has military identity.

A player character may reach this rank through hard work, dedication, incredible feats of strength, or a similar way.

Favored Members & Regulars & New Recruits

Arcane Matters.name: Arcane Matters
Arcane Matters.text:
Arcane Matters

In the world of Historica Arcanum, magic is a reality, and you may want some of the organizations to have some magic practitioners and spellcasters, or at least access to some magical items. Some organizations may have different approaches to spellcasting and spellcasters.

@UUID[Macro.azaJ5CFENSETYsZo]{Roll Approach to Magical Affairs Table}

d8

Approach to MagIcal AffaIrs

1

Indifferent: There may be individuals that are aware of the arcane, but the organization does not have a specific opinion on the matter, and most high-ranking members aren’t aware of it.

2

Adversarial: The organization strictly forbids spellcasting and is actively against it.

3

Negative: Spellcasting isn’t something that is well regarded. Most members are advised not to use it due to its wild nature.

4

Neutral: A more pragmatic approach to magic. The organization members may use magic and magical items and punish only those that harm the organization or its members. The rules do not interfere with members who are spellcasters.

5

Positive: The organization uses and advises practicing magic, thus having some spellcasters in their ranks, especially in higher ranks. They also have many magical items.

6

Pro-magic: The organization is based on spellcasters and has magical guild tendencies. They teach and use arcane matters in every possible way.

7

Collectors: The organization is aware of the magical nature of the world and actively collects artifacts to hide and guard them. Their primary goal can be considered thus, as they do not want these items to reach villainous hands.

8

Scholarly: The organization uses magic for scholarly means and conducts research for scholarly purposes.

Possible Magic Items

Organizations may have collected many magical items or even produced them during their existence. These items may be distributed among the members while most of them can be locked behind a vault. They may be given to some members as a reward, for safekeeping, or if a quest requires that item to be completed.

There are tables below that provide example magic items based on rarity. However, it is important to note that the Historica Arcanum universe has very limited, if none at all, very rare or legendary items, especially concerning spell scrolls that are higher than Level 6. Symbols & Heraldry.name: Symbols & Heraldry
Symbols & Heraldry.text:
Symbols & Heraldry

All organizations have their banners, as a means of recognition and legality. Some banners are designed to inflict fear on their enemies, some ignite the fires of hope and some represent the ideals of the organization.

General Ideas

Powerful beasts from nature itself, usually representing war, triumph and the warrior aspect of an organization

Lion, eagle, panther, elephant, wolf, bear, boar Claw, tooth, horn, wing, scale

Animals that have subtle meanings usually representing peace, knowledge

Dove, owl, badger, raven, crow

Mythological creatures

Sphinx, chimera, dragon, minotaur, mermaid, kraken

Symbols from natural fauna

Rose, sunflower, olive branch, flower headpiece, sapling, apple, grape, oak tree, plane tree

Generic celestial symbols

Star, sun, moon, cloud, eclipse, dawn, dusk

Astrological symbols

Symbols of horoscopes and celestial objects: Gemini, Venus, Andromeda, Ursa Major, or similar

Naval symbols

Wave, river, anchor, sails, warships, skull and crossbones

Abstract symbols that could be interpreted in many ways

Geometric shapes, teardrop, scales, heart

Ancient runes and carvings

Nordic runes, Turkic runes, Egyptian hieroglyphs

It is worth noting that many organizations in medieval times used more detailed and complex coats of arms or banners. The order you create may also use a complex coat of arms that brings many of the elements together. For example, a wolf that is crowned under a full moon.
