The Wings of the Angel.text:
Recommended Level: 3-4

Quest Summary: Shahbal-i Melek has been given a big opportunity by Nadim-lenk and a local Emir is about to lose power. Shahbal-i Melek can take advantage of this situation with the help of a capable group of adventurers.

Possible Rewards: 100 gd for each adventurer.

Daman is looking for adventurers to plunder and kill a corrupt emir of the lands named Nasir (@UUID[Actor.hzLqHAeE1LqDx94q]{Emir}, Noble of Levant). Emir’s mansion outside the city will be stormed by Mamluks, but he and some of his men (1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{Knight}j, 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.7tRhrxuknTpHpYcA]{Werewolf}j, 4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{Guards}j) will escape using 4 horses and 2 carts, as they are aware of the attack. Nadim-lank let Daman know about the situation, and they could use the wealth of the emir (about two thousand gold dinars).

Their way will venture into the desert where they will be met by 20 armed men (all Guards) and go into exile with all his wealth. Daman wants to set up a trap, but he needs help before Nasir reaches his men; he wants the adventurers’ help to prepare the ambush and choose the location. Daman has four @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.O3ABqI55Ir1du1Xa]{Scouts}j (Half-elves) who are willing to help as well. However, if they help, the adventurers’ price will be lower.

During the ambush, Nasir will offer half of his treasury to all those who come to his side and attempt to persuade the men. If the Scouts are there, two of them will join the forces of Nasir unless the adventurers convince them otherwise (DC 12 Charisma check, proper proficiencies may apply, such as Persuasion or Intimidation).

If cornered and threatened with death, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.7tRhrxuknTpHpYcA]{werewolf}jnamed Aykan will show his teeth and attempt to intimidate the attackers to flee or be cursed by his bite. This may terrorize any NPC without knowledge of arcane matters.

Resolutions:

  • If the adventurers fully succeed without any problems and keep Daman as their ally, they will receive additional 100 gd as a bonus.
  • If they try to keep all the wealth themselves, they will make an enemy of Daman and his comrades.
  • If they can’t stop Nasir in time, he will unite with his twenty men and will be a harder target to eliminate.
  • Nasir will keep his promise of giving them half the treasury if the adventurers side with him. He may offer to take out all of Daman and his forces for additional payments if the adventurers want to continue helping Nasir.
  • If Aykan manages to curse a creature with lycanthropy, it can be got rid of with a remove curse spell until the next full moon. Otherwise, it becomes permanent.

A chill runs down your spine as a wet, ominous breath caresses the edge of your field of vision, its warmth penetrating your clothing. You pivot slowly, coming face-to-face with glowing red eyes that resemble distant, fiery orbs. The creature’s onyx fur melds with the night, rendering it nearly invisible, save for its sinister gaze. A growl punctuates the air as it takes a measured step forward. This is the Animal of Set, a daunting and sleek entity, its physique reminiscent of a large, muscular dog endowed with a long, curved snout and sharply pointed ears. It is revered as a physical manifestation of the god Set’s intentions, roaming the deserts and ruins, safeguarding ancient tombs, or preying on the unsuspecting amidst storm-induced chaos. Far from mere guardianship, it excels in tracking adversaries and serves as a lethal vanguard in ambushes laid by sorcerers and conjurers within the desert’s embrace. The Crusaders.name: The Crusaders
The Crusaders.text:
Whispers from the Holiest City weave through the souls of the faithful, uniting them under a celestial banner with a cry that pierces the heavens and ignites the spirits of all who hear: “Deus vult!” These crusaders, an assembly of knights, valiant warriors, exiles, nobles, and devout believers, embark from the corners of Europe on a sacred odyssey. Their mission: to reclaim and shield Jerusalem from the encroaching forces of the Muslim world. In the crucible of the First Crusade, their valor was forged and proven.

Clad in armor as unyielding as their resolve, bearing shields as steadfast as their faith, their hearts ablaze with devotion to their Lord and their homeland, they embody the essence of determination. These pilgrims of war, having traversed half the globe, are driven by a divine mandate. Their journey, fueled by an unwavering commitment to fulfill their holy duty, marks them not merely as warriors, but as indomitable survivors of a quest sanctified by their unbreakable spirit.

The Mamluks.name: The Mamluks
The Mamluks.text:
In the heart of a realm shaped by the will of Sultan Saladin, there exists a cadre of warriors, the Mamluks, whose tales of valor are woven into the very fabric of the land. These venerable soldiers, once bound in servitude, carved pathways to freedom with the might of their swords, standing as the very sinew and soul of the Ayyubid military might. Trained beyond the measure of ordinary men, they ascended to become unparalleled equestrians of war, their prowess on the battlefield a testament to their relentless spirit. Their bravery, talent and influence on the throne granted them many benefits: the bonds of matrimony, the stewardship of lands, and the inheritance of their lord’s bounties. Esteemed among the military elite, their allegiance is a fortress, impenetrable and steadfast, safeguarding their patrons with a zeal that transcends life itself.

As the wheel of time turns, the Mamluk Sultanate’s legacy will shape the fate of Egypt greatly, ushering in a period of great power. This empire will dominate the Levant, its influence lasting until the rise of the Ottoman Empire in the sixteenth century.

Their life is in agony and their mind is stronger than ever. They carry the burden, and face the consequences while facing their fear. They share one mind and heed the voice of the hermit and all see and think as one.

Shared Spellcasting.The bearers of moth sigils have access to these spells and can cast them innately when they are within 60 ft. of each other and at least three of them are together, due to their connection with Peter the Hermit, the bearer of the Moth Sigil. Their spell save DC is 15 and have +8 to hit with spell attacks.

3/day each:magic missile, guiding bolt, shield

1/day each:darkness, heat metal, alter self, lightning bolt

At will: ray of frost, shocking grasp

The Sigil of Phoenix.name: The Sigil of Phoenix
The Sigil of Phoenix.text: Ashes turn to blood, and blood gives new life to the fallen warrior. The fallen warrior rises, without necromancy, without the touch of shadow, but with grace, elegance and radiance.

The Sigil of the Wolf.name: The Sigil of the Wolf
The Sigil of the Wolf.text:
Bloodlust, aggression, fury… All part of the Wolf Sigil’s power and an incredible source of might. Those who are branded find themselves to be stronger than most and able to do incredible feats, spreading corruption in a powerful way to destroy their enemies.

Corruption:This new condition, called Corrupted when a creature receives it, works like exhaustion by means of mechanics; each long rest reduces it by one level, and the greater restoration spell can affect it just as it affects exhaustion in the spell’s description.

Corrupted.The creature has disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks but has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

Corruption has 5 levels in addition to the condition:

Level 1:The target sees under normal light as if it is in dim light. It bypasses every kind of vision except Truesight, Tremor Sense and Blindsight. In total darkness, if it has darkvision or a similar means to perceive, it sees as the normal rules deem appropriate.

Level 2: The target sees under dim light as if it is in total darkness. It bypasses every kind of vision except Truesight, Tremor Sense and Blindsight.

Level 3: While perceiving its surroundings as if it is in dim light, it must succeed in a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw when making an attack roll, or it confuses the target as a friendly creature and thus must attack another creature or lose the attack.

Level 4: While perceiving its surroundings as if it is in normal light, it must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw when making an attack roll or it confuses the target as a friendly creature and thus must attack another creature or lose the attack.

Level 5:The target is blinded and sees everyone in shades and colors. It can’t discern friend from foe and perceives everyone as hostile creatures of the GM’s choice, related to its characteristics, knowledge, traits, fears, and other circumstances.

Sphinxes.name: Sphinxes
Sphinxes.text: Sphinxes, creatures steeped in legend, are often associated with the iconic stone figure that guards the outskirts of Giza. However, the roots of these beings extend beyond mere myth into a realm of reality. These enigmatic entities, embodying the fusion of human intelligence and animal might, have captivated human imagination for centuries.

Introduction.name: Introduction
Introduction.text:
Introduction

World of Historica Arcanum

The World of Historica Arcanum combines the arcane powers and eldritch horror with a vast historical lore rooted in our world. Magic is hidden away from those not privy to its secrets. Magic is also very dangerous, and those who venture to harness its power face the peril of corruption and madness. This section is designed to get Game Masters and players immersed in the World of Historica Arcanum.

Welcome to the Era of the Crusades

In this chapter, we will guide you through the world of the 12th century, focusing on the history, culture and politics of Jerusalem and Cairo of the era. Here, you will embark on a journey of historical discovery, exploring the significant events and gaining insights into the motivations and actions of the key factions of the time.

Character Options

Here in this chapter, you will find subclass options created for the Era of the Crusades setting and the World of Historica Arcanum, a series of profession choices for our mechanical addition to 5th edition, new spells, magic items, feats and other options.

Character Builder

In this chapter you will find a comprehensive character and backstory builder that draws inspiration from the rich history and diverse geography of the Holy Lands. This section features dozens of rollable tables to quickly generate unique characters with deep backstories, as well as to give players inspiration to build their own.

The Era of the Crusades

The main chapter of the setting book. Here, in the Era of the Crusades you will find a world nestled on the verge of war. Within this chapter, you will find everything a Game Master could need to create and run a game in the legendary cities of Jerusalem and Cairo in 1182, with quests, character highlights, locations and cultural insights.

The Knight Orders

Forge your factions as a Game Master or allow your players to form a Knight Order - whether they are noble warriors defending the realm or adventurous mercenaries seeking fame and fortune. This section offers the tools and rollable tables for everything, from distinct heraldry to guiding tenets, from headquarters management to recruiting and promoting allies and players.

The Deck of the Damned

The combat encounters and story arcs of the 5th Edition are inherently intense, marked by fierce battles, mystical upheavals, and heart-wrenching losses, seldom mechanized. To address this, we have developed the Deck of the Damned: A System for Combat and Narrative Stress. Within this section, you will find everything you may ever need to add Deck of the Damned to your campaigns - without the need for physical cards.
